name: Scratchees: Treasure Hunt
description:
5 Different Treasure Hunt Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

OBJECTIVE: You are risk-seeking archaeologists on a expedition for exotic treasure. Danger surrounds you and your archrival is out to beat you to the fortune. The player who collects the most treasure by the end of the game wins.

HOW TO PLAY: Take turns trying to locate a treasure by drawing straight lines between any 2 dots on the map. Lines can be drawn vertically or horizontally, but not diagonally. When you draw a line that connects all four sides of a square, the find at that location is yours. Immediately scratch off that spot to reveal a prize (or perhaps trouble). If you locate treasure, circle the matching item on your stone scoring tablet to keep a record of your newly found wealth. There are four different kinds of treasure:

GOLD COINS - Worth 1 point each
BLACK PEARLS - Worth 5 points each
CUT RUBIES - Worth 10 points each
SOLID GOLD ICON - Worth 25 points

After finding a reassure, you must immediately continue your turn by drawing another line; even if you don't want to. Archaeology is a dangerous business and sometimes you get more that you bargained for. Head hunters are about and thief is lurking somewhere in the area. If you happen to find either, you're in trouble.

HEAD HUNTER - A threatening little person who stops you in your tracks. You lose your turn immediately (but you're too clever to lose you head). Nevertheless, your opponent takes a turn while you figure your way out of this predicament.
THIEF- An encounter with the thief is a costly mistake. He is well trained at slipping through your fingers and takes with him one piece of the most valuable treasure you have discovered so far. If you have any treasure, mark one piece of the best off your stone tablet. It's gone for good.

Super Secret Rule of Archaeological Exploration: Treasure is found in groups. Find something valuable and the rest of the same treasure is sure to be connected!

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Mole Hole Mania
description:
OBJECTIVE: Your are the groundskeeper of an exclusive golf course that has been invaded by six pesky moles (each a different color). See and destroy the rascals! The player with the most points after all six moles have been caught wins.

PREPARATION - Write the player's initials in the coring area. Players then scratch the squares on the bottom of the card to determine who goes first. The player finding the number "1" starts the game by digging the first hole (scratching a circle). The moles you seek are pink, blue, black, yellow, green and purple.

HOW TO PLAY - To find moles, you "dig" holes on the golf course by scratching any circle. You can find all sorts of stuff in a hole - information on where the moles are hiding, bonus points, or nasty traps the moles have set for you! After each hole is dug, the turn passes to the next player on the left (unless otherwise stated). Use hashmarks in the scoring area to keep score. Here is what you might dig up:

MOLE - 5 points
GOLF BALL - 1 point
POISON GOLF BALL - Minus 1 point
SNAKE (Hiss!) - Lose your next turn
MOLE POOP - Lose your next turn
EMPTY HOLE - Nothing, zip, zero.

Digging up the following items will give you important information:

FLASHLIGHTS - Shine light on moles of the same color. The mole will be somewhere within the "total area of circles" defined by the direction of the "beam of light". This helpful light also allows you to continue your turn.

MOLE HOLES - The mole of this color is somewhere in line with this symbol.

MOLE METER - A number 2, 3 or 4. There is a mole (of this color) that number of circles away.

DYNAMITE - It blows up! You must scratch off all the neighboring circles that surround the explosive and score them as normal.

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Geekzilla
description:
You were just a normal pencil-neck geek working on your computer when suddenly, it filled the room with weird radiation and turned you into a 150-foot tall monster - GEEKZILLA! You go on a rampage downtown and collect everything you find!

Decide who goes first. Take turns scratching any window on the sky-scrapers to see what you find inside. You score points depending on what interesting things are found in the window. Keep track of your points in your head or by writing on the scoring building.

After all windows have been broken into, the player who has scored the most points wins the game! You will see:

GIRL IN TOWEL - 50 points. She screams at you!

COMPUTER - 25 points. A geekzilla's best friend!

DOG - 10 points. A geekzilla's second best friend!

VIDEO GAMES - 5 points. (Clue: a computer is in one of the nearby windows!)

SECURITY GUARD - 0 points. For some reason, they shoot at you if you try to grab them. Leave them alone.

BROKEN GLASSES - Oh no! Your opponent takes 2 turns in a row while you fix your glasses.

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Dinosaur Disaster!
description:
You are scientists who have just discovered the greatest dinosaur burial grounds ever found! Million of years ago. a comet hit this spot and buried hundreds of dinosaurs. Unfortunately, the comet also sprayed radioactive uranium all around, so be careful where you dig!

The fist player to dig up 21 points worth of bones is the best dinosaur digger and wins the game.

Decide who goes first. Take turns digging in the dinosaur pit by scratching any circle. You see:

VERTEBRA BONE - 1 point. Mark your score at the top.

LEG BONE - 2 points.

SKULL BONE - 3 points.

URANIUM! - Oh no! You must be decontaminated before you can resume digging. Scratch any oval on the decontamination shack. If it says "Yes", you are safe and can continue digging on your next turn., But if says "No", you must stay in the shack and try again next turn.

FIDO - Whoops! Score 1 point for your opponent! You found a bone but Fido, the camp's mascot dog, took it from you and gave it to the opponent!

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Mutant Parents From Planet Mars
description:
Friendly parents on Mars are trying to escape to freedom on Earth, but the evil Martian politicians are turning them into mutants! You have just arrived in your rescue ships and are battling to save the parents. After all spaces are scratched, the player who has rescued the most pairs of Moms and Dads is the winner!

Decide who goes first. Take turns. Each turn scratch any 2 spaces on the planet. There are 4 different things you can find: A MOM, DAD, MARTIAN OR EXPLOSION. Match both spaces you scratched to see what happens:

Mom + DAD - Perfect match! Score one of each on your rescue ship and take another turn!

MOM + MOM - Score 2 Moms. You saved them!

DAD + DAD - Score 2 Dads. You saved them!

Martian + Mom or Dad - Oh no! Your opponent scores the Mom or Dad while you fight the Martian Off!

DOUBLE MARTIANS - Your opponent gets to take 2 turns in a row while you fight the Martians off!

EXPLOSION + ANYTHING - An explosion destroys whatever else you scratched. No points scored!

DOUBLE EXPLOSION - Awesome! Martians watch the fireworks while you take another turn!

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Suck Up The Slugs!
description:
Scientists have just discovered that Amazon slug juice can give you superhuman powers! Healthy Amazon slugs are now selling for thousands of dollars each! You and your partner buy slug-sucking machines and head south to the Amazon to suck up as many slugs as you can sell! The first sucker to suck up 16 slugs wins the game!
Decide who goes first. Take turns scratching in the forest. You see:

LEAF - Good! Slugs hide under leaves. Scratch any space on the leaf pile to see if you find 1, 2 or 3 slugs. Scratch this many spaces on your slug sack to mark your score.

SLUG SLIME - Clue: there must be some slugs near this space because slugs leave a slime trail when they move.

SNAIL - Your opponent takes 2 turns in a row because your sucked a snail by mistake and it clogged your slug-sucker.

SQUISH - Yuck! You stepped on a slug! No score this turn.

GIANT AMAZON MOTHER SLUG - Oh no! She doesn't like you sucking up her slugs so she attacks you! Luckily, you brought salt to defend yourself. Throw a box of salt on your Giant Slug at the top of the card by scratching one of the 4 "salt boxes". You only have 4 boxes, so if you get attacked a 5th time, a Mother Slug smothers and slimes you and you lose the game!

—user summary

name: Departure on the Nile
description: Departure on the Nile puts 2 to 4 players in the 1830s to 1880s in Egypt. During this period, Egypt under its rulers and the increased influence of Europeans experienced a tremendous upswing. The first railway lines were built, cotton was grown and exported, the Suez Canal was opened, as well as schools and hospitals built on the European model. Not least, the country also opened up for the emerging mass tourism, which brought a large number of people in the land of the pharaohs and pyramids. The players in Departure on the Nile embody young investors from Europe who want to contribute to the expansion of the country and invest in the Egyptian economy, solely with the aim of achieving the greatest fortune. Departure on the Nile is a classic worker placement game in which each player starts the game with only three of their own colonial officials. The construction of buildings, however, bring specialists into the country, who can recruit players using a novel mechanism (felucca travel and rail travel) and from now on can use. The game comes with a high level of interaction so it does not have the character of a multiplayer solitaire game. All players are involved at all times, whether through the use of the buildings (owners receive a bonus), by rail travel or the use of the Suez Canal where players can receive money and influence through their share certificates. Since the game is all about earning the most money at the end of the game, every investment in the game should be well considered. The game material is relatively extensive, the random game structure (bonus tiles, majority tiles, building tiles, personalities) guarantees a long game stimulus that prevents deadlocked strategies.

name: Mutopia: a game of ruin and redemption
description:
The world is an irradiated wasteland, inhospitable to life. Hordes of bloodthirsty mutants roam this desolate hellscape in search of human flesh, but pockets of non-mutant survivors have managed to wait out the horror. They have gathered ranks, formed factions, and have emerged ready to rebuild utopia.

Gameplay
In Mutopia, each player represents a team of human survivors. Survivors are categorized by virtue—guts, brain, brawn, heart, and soul. Players must advance Survivors and build structures in order to ascend from their shabby Communes and achieve Utopia. However, the more structures they build, the better their chances of encountering the Skull of Ruin. Each time a Ruin is rolled, a Ruin card must be drawn and a skull token placed on the player’s survivor board. If a player’s board fills up before they reach 15 ascendency points, the player flips over their board and becomes….A MUTANT.

Objective
It takes guts, brains, brawn, heart, and soul to ascend in Mutopia. These are Virtues and the currency with which players advance Survivors and purchase Items and Structures. Structures and some Items are worth Ascendency Points. The first player to achieve 15 Ascendancy Points before filling all 10 spaces on their Survivor Board wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Die verflixte 7!
description:
Each player rolls 2 dice. On the roll of 4, 6, 8 or 10 the meeple is placed on space 1. On the roll of 1, 2 or 12 it is placed on space 2. All other rolls are fails.

To move a meeple 1 space ahead, the player has to roll a 4, 6, 8 or 10. A 1, 2 or 12 moves the meeple 2 spaces ahead.

On the roll of a 7 the meeple is moved 1 space backwards. To reach space 6, 8 and 12, special rules must be observed.

The first player to reach space 12 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bull Frog
description:
Be the first to hop your team of frogs from your PUDDLE, around the board to safety in your BIG POOL. Each turn you’ll choose a frog to move exactly the roll of the die. If you roll a 1 or 6 you may bring a new frog into play from your PUDDLE to your STEPPING STONE (the first space on your journey around the board). But be careful as enemy frogs can TAG each other by landing on their space. The TAGGED frog is sent back to their start PUDDLE. You can also leap over enemy frogs. You cannot tag your own frogs or leap over them, so you have to manage your frogs carefully so that they don’t get bunched up. Moves must always be exactly the number of spaces indicated by the roll of the die. A roll of 1 or 6 always gives you another turn no matter how many times it occurs. If you have only one possible move, you must take it. If you have no legal moves, you pass your turn.

Once a player Fills up their BIG POOL by moving all of their frogs into it, they win!

The game can also be played in teams of 2 vs 2. When one player’s frogs are all safe they may move their teammates. TEAMMATES FROGS MAY TAG EACH OTHER! So take care that it is not the only option.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: Trivial Pursuit: Poitou-Charentes
description:
The famous trivia game. The questions are about the French region of Poitou Charentes.

There are 3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geography, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.
Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

name: Quadrant: Adventure in Mirva
description:
Quadrant is a CCG game for 2 players.
The heart of Quadrant is the Quadrant mechanism : all players roll a dice and choose their actions available in their hands(and each card has 4 available actions!), and more choice will be available with more dice point. This unique system of quadrant maximize the strategic nature of your adventure.

Players choose their hero and pick 5 disposition cards. This makes the tendency of hero. And each players construct their own deck with various cards pool.

And 5-line battle field system makes fast-paced game play possible.

-2021.03.27

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Book, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Ozeanien 3: Scotties Dschungeltour
description:
Description: The goal of the game is to quickly overcome all obstacles in the jungle and reach the finish field. Exciting action fields complicate the jungle tour.
—description from the publisher

This Roll-and-move game was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Space Buccaneers
description:
In Space Buccaneers, you start out as a lowly vagabond looking to make a living by running jobs out of Buccaneer’s Den and appealing to The Man… the head behind all illicit business that happens in this corner of the galaxy. Successfully deliver on your contracts to gain credit and renown; fail, and you’ll find The Man’s confidence in your capabilities will dip. Work to upgrade your menial starting ship and crew to better push your luck within the Galactic Underground Trading Route (GUTR) and become the richest, most famous freebooter of all!

Space Buccaneers is game about taking on jobs and attempting to deliver their cargo to the furthest location possible along the GUTR. The trading route is comprised of a series of planetary systems willing to do business with the Den. The further along the route that you deliver, the more credit and renown you will gain. Along the course, you’ll be attempting to resolve events by rolling dice provided by your ship and crew. These are resolved by matching the symbols on the event cards with the symbols on the dice. As you roll misses and are forced to set dice aside, you’ll have to decide if you risk pushing on to profit from greater gains or not. If you roll too many misses, your delivery attempt will be cut short and your reputation will suffer. Events get harder as you press along the GUTR; the better your ship and crew the better your odds. The game ends when one of the players reaches the renown threshold. After which, players will have a chance to complete their turns, and the player with the highest amount of renown will be declared the victor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Voyage of the Damned
description: This expansion adds characters from the Voyage of the Damned episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, four faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Tomb of the Cybermen
description: This expansion adds Cybermen from The Tomb of the Cybermen episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, four Cybermen faction cards, and six new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Criminal City
description:
Criminal City, 2019.

Here, every day, the eternal struggle between the Law and the "Interstellar Mob" is rekindled without respite and shows no signs of dying out, also due to the scarce resources available to the police.

The 3 powerful interstellar criminal factions are fighting to command the entire city, fueling the black market, the corruption and the sense of insecurity of citizens, while few but brave space policemen face them every day to try to stop them.

And which side are you on?

Criminal City is a partially asymmetrical and semi-collaborative game for 3-6 players divided into a number of rounds depending on the number of players participating.

In each game a single player chose to be the head of a criminal faction(in this case he is playing as a "Interstellar Mob" Player) or, alternatively, can control policemen (1 or more, depending on the number of players).

The players who lead the criminal factions win individually by accumulating more Dominion Points (DP) than their rivals and trying not to be arrested by the space police.
The policemen win if they manage to capture all the factions fighting for the city's control within two consecutive turns or if, at the end of the game, they managed to limit the Criminals by accumulating at least 5 DP more than the most powerful faction.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: SOLO Schnupperspiel
description: A promotional demo version of SOLO with 32 instead of 112 cards produced on a sheet of thick paper, perforated to make it easier to separate the cards. The rules and promotion material for other Amigo games are printed on the same sheet. The cards come only in three colors (yellow, blue and red), in the numbers 1 to 6. There is one draw-two, one skip and one reverse card per color and also two draw-four jokers, two regular jokers and one pass hands card.

name: Repro Baseball
description: The game comes with all 24 the MLB teams with a minimum of 30 player cards per team. The cards come with a lefty-righty control factor for both pitchers and batters. The pitcher also comes with a "men on base" column in addition to the regular columns on Repro Baseball ATG teams. All the game parts that are in the Repro ATG baseball game are here with revised Out Decks and Range play decks. The charts have also been revised.

name: Repro Football
description: The players are individually rated to recreate their performances. The QB's are rated for short,medium and long pass completions as well as running ability and proclivity to throw interceptions. Rb's are rated for inside and outside ability, pass complete gains, and individual long gains.Rec's are rated for their pass gain ability and the ability to run the end around if they did in real life. If a key lineman or player is injured it will cost your team. The offensive line is rated for on each type of play as a unit. The defense is rated on each type play ans for sacks and interceptions. Special teams play a key part in each teams success just as in real life. Each team has an individual player locator chart that chooses the key player on each play if you do not want to do that yourself.

name: Double trouble
description:
Double trouble is a rapid fire, rhyming word game that will have you on the edge of you on the edge of your seat.
In double trouble, two teams have 90 seconds to identify double troubles provided by a player sitting in the "hot seat". The hot seat players team shout out as many answers as they can in an effort to identify the correct ones the opposing team write down their answers hoping to pick up bonus points.
Double troubles are amusing pairs of rhyming words which have to be deduced from cryptic clues and other quick thinking clues by the player in the hot seat.

—description from the back of the box

name: Disney Rocket Game
description:
Disney Rocket game is a 1960's Japanese variation of Pachisi. The game board features 4 Walt Disney characters which players start by placing their tokens on. Players then move around the board by the roll of a dice in a clockwise direction and up a straight to reach their goal line.

Variations to the traditional Parchisi are an added shortcut using a colored rocket and advantages of landing on a particular colored square.

The game box shows Disney characters on a TWA rocket. Erik Voskull, in his book 'Before Mario',(2014) explains that Nintendo obtained a licence in 1959 to produce games featuring Walt Disney characters and themes.

Also in the first half of the 1960s Nintendo introduced a cursive style logo as seen on the back of the playing board. This logo was used on Nintendo's earliest boardgames.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Space Exploration

name: Mit dem Roller durch die Wachau
description:
The players start on space 1 (Krems). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 80 (back in Krems) wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vom Rhein zum Schwarzwald
description:
This game contains two separate game boards: "Rhein-Reise" and "Schwarzwald-Reise".

The players start on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 89 or 100 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tira
description:
The players take turns putting one disk on the game board. When all disks are on the board, move their disks one space a turn.
The goal of the game is to build a sequence of 4 connecting disks in any direction or a 2x2 cluster.

—user summary

name: Manhattan: Festival en Manhattan
description:
The first expansion for Manhattan!
More actions in Manhttan... Your little 1-level pieces will be more interesting now! Everytime you place a little building on the board, you will get an action card. You must play it as soon as possible, or somebody will take it from you!

There are two modules:


Festival en Manhattan (Festival in Manhattan): 2 rules cards + 5 action cards
Un monstruo en Manhattan (A monster in Manhattan): 1 rule card + 1 monster card (to cut-and-play, and using the starting player token) - This expansion was included in the Mayfair old edition, but only as a variant rule. Now you have components and a real monster to destroy the buildings.


The art is based on the modern edition (Manddo Games), but the cards can be played and are compatible with all the editions of the game.

Promo expansions celebrating Karen & Amdreas Seyfarth as special guests at the XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.

—description from the publisher














































Ahora los bloques de 1 planta van a ser más atractivos, porque te darán acceso a nuevas acciones en las manzanas de Manhattan. Gira tu carta, bloquea una acción rival, roba una carta a alguien, suma una planta a tu pieza, puntúa tu barrio... ¡Y dejad de pisar mi edificio!

Además un gigantesco monstruo arrasa la ciudad. Los rascacielos tiemblan, pero lo cierto es que a la vez que construyes, tienes el control sobre el movimiento de la criatura. Lo malo es que no eres la única persona con poder sobre ella...

Hay dos módulos:

Festival en Manhattan: 2 cartas de reglas + 5 cartas de acción
Un monstruo en Manhattan: 1 carta de reglas + 1 cata recortable (se monta sobre la pieza de jugador inicial) - Esta expansión se incluía solo como variante de reglas en la edición de Mayfair del juego. Ahora se presenta con un monstruo de verdad para destruir los edificios.


Incluye dos variantes de reglas: Monstruo Kong y Monstruo Zilla.

Expansión promocional y gratuita celebrando la visita de Karen & Seyfarth como invitados especiales del XIV Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2019.
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Please, Papers
description:
Based on the video game Papers Please, players take on the role of government workers for the M.O.A. in the totalitarian state of Arstotzka. They will draft cards allowing immigrants, tourists, and citizens to pass through the border, always careful to keep a watchful eye out for members of the EZIC who are trying to bribe others and sow the seeds of dissent. However, players may also wish to align themselves with the EZIC to subvert the brutal government of Arstotzka!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Political, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting

name: Neon party
description:
A new neighborhood has been built and the people who live there don't know each other. A neon party is organized to get to know each other. You also live in this neighborhood. If you decorate your house with as many lights as possible, you will make a good impression. Do you know after the neon party who lives on who on which house number lives? Then you have a big chance of winning the neon party game!

The player tries to get many points as possible on his house number. The players don't know each other's house number. There are 2 sets of house numbers cards 1-5. One of them are placed in the middle of the table. Each player receives a secret housenumber from the other set of 1-5.

The rest of the cards consist cards with numbers -5 (defect neon lights) to 5(working neon lights) and a few special cards. These cards form the draw pile. If it is a players turn, he will take a card from the draw pile. He can place this card on both sides of a house number. Then it's the next players turn and he does the same. If there is a total of 5 cards on both sides of a house number, there is a scoring.
First, it is determined which side of this house number has the most cards. The side with the most cards will be placed on table below the house number card. For the order house numbers, the same side will be placed below the house number card. The entire other side of the house numbers with cards will be placed on the discard pile. After this, there are no more neon light cards on table (except below the house numbers and the discard pile). Then the game continues. If there are 5 cards placed at a house number another scoring takes place. The game ends when the draw pile is used up.

There are 2 special cards with which you can remove cards and do 2 turns in a row.

The players then guess from each other which house number they have. Each correctly guessed house number earns 5 points. If someone is well guessed by all persons, he is out of the game and therefore does not participate in the final scoring.

Everyone counts the points on the cards under their house number. The player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Blackpool
description:
Blackpool is a strategy and racing board game designed for both, entertainment and intellectual stimulation. A fun game for parties, family gatherings, or just a casual evening with friends, Blackpool is designed to engage kids and grown ups alike.

Along with luck, you will need to use sound strategies to win this game. To win, you have to be the first player to get all of your travellers (the tokens are called travellers in Blackpool) out of the mystic whirlpool and land them safely back to your camp. You can use curse cards to stop others, charm cards to move ahead, and take advantage of anyone who is ahead of you by using the special piggybacking technique. You can jump on someone who is ahead of you to slow them down, or move ahead with them. Smart use of piggybacking can become the difference between winning and losing the game.

The race starts from the middle of the board, and the players have to move outwards. Each player has three ‘travellers’ whom they have to save from the whirlpool. In order to do so, the travellers have to get to their camps, which are at the corners of the board. The travellers have to go through several rings to get to the camp. Like a real whirlpool, in Blackpool, it gets easier to move as you get further away from the center. The players movement depends on the dice roll and on the ring they are at. The first player to get all their travellers to their camp wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: PitchFest
description:
PitchFest is a card-driven improv party game about pitching ridiculous video games. It's going to be a wonderful idea... until the publishers get their money-filled hands on it.

The pitch is constructed using four prompt cards from the deck, after which the 'developer' (a single player or team) presents their game concept to the rest of the group.

The rest of the players are 'investors' that then ask yes/no questions about the pitch and product to ascertain whether or not they want to fund the game. The developer then must draw an answer card to determine how they are allowed to answer the question, requiring quick thinking and improv storytelling techniques.

The goal of the game is to collaboratively create the best pitch of the night.

—description from the designer

name: Questicus
description:
Welcome to the world of Questicus, a hand-drawn adventure of epic questing and fierce competition for up to 3 to 6 players. The idea is simple: become the most influential adventurer in a given time to become the next Mayor of the Town and win the game. Your worst enemy is your fellow players as they are also fighting for power and influence. Utilize an arsenal of magical items, cunning skills, and secretive plots to become the reigning Mayor over the land!

Enjoy an engaging adventure as players create the map as they explore the world around them. With 38 unique tiles and over 50 special events, you’ll never play the same game twice! Every time you start a game you will be thrown into a brand new experience with new challenges and different strategies for you to apply. Vie for power and influence with one of twelve exciting characters! Will you choose to be a good adventurer seeking to help the people, or an evildoer who seeks to destroy all those that stand in their way? In Questicus the choice is yours with each character having their very own stats and abilities specific to them.

Worried a game might drag on too long? Afraid that the game will be over to soon? Well fear not, Questicus has just the thing for you! With Questicus, we set up a way to keep track of how many rounds are left in a game by using “Town Event” cards. Each round, one of these cards will be drawn and revealed with a special event that all players participate in. Customize your experience with a simple game of 10 rounds, or go in for the long haul and set up a 35 round game! The choice is up to you, as we know players like games tailored to their needs and with Questicus you are given the freedom to choose the length of the game you want to play.

Are you ready to get questing?

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Political
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Bribery, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Combatendo o Cyberbullying
description: Edu and his robotic friend Ludo built a social network called Cyberface so that their friends the fuze Teka, the cat Zum, the strong Montanha and the smart Zeca could safely share their photos so that friends have fun posting their photos and that no funny guy resolve to disrupt the fun by making a healthy and safe environment.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Move Mundo Kids
description:
All around the world, population growth and disordered city growth pose major problems. Mobility, accessibility and environmental issues are among the main.

Move Mundo Kids is a serious game where players take on the role of transformative agents and build a smart city that provides solutions to these problems.

With building mechanics and area management through tiles, the kids build a new city with every match. When building problems can arise and from them discussions on how to solve them.

name: Bunaken
description: Bunaken National Marine Park is a hidden paradise under the sea. Located in Manado, North Sulawesi, Bunaken is famous for its underwater park charm which is overgrown with various types of colorful and gorgeous coral reefs. To add those gems, are various types of fish and marine life hiding behind the coral reefs. The colorful reefs combined with the types of marine life are true eyes opener. All These charm are what makes the diving and snorkeling enthusiasts always choose Bunaken as the first destination when they want to enjoy this one of the world’s iconic underwater beauties. Come and snap pictures of the existing biota. Set a strategy to determine the biota you want to photograph. Use your diving skills with the diving cards in your hands, such as 2-5 diving cards, then you can dive from 2 to 5 depth or from 5 to 2. Don’t let other players snap your biota’s pictures first. Remember, you can get points from the biota collection as well as from your diving expertise. So collect as many biota photos and be a reliable diver to win the game.

name: EverZone: Hilga Promo Card
description:
Unit Vermin Queen

15 Resources required to have this card active on the battlefield.

You can place one unit of the opponent's army that you just destroyed into your retreated pile until the end of the game.

9 Attack
4 Defense
4 Range
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: The Kevin Bloody Wilson Bar Krawl
description:
Race other players round town on your bar kraawl, stopping for a drink at your favorite watering holes on the way.
Pick up a Kev Kard and face the challenge - or pay the penalty impress your friends with your balancing skills! Get your tongue around a limerick! sing a few bars of your favorite Kev Klassic.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Host Your Own Christmas Games
description:
Festive fun for family and friends!
Bring an extra dose of chear and laughter to your household this Christmas - by inviting your friends and family to play a hilarious round of party games in addition to the "12 games of Christmas" there are race games party games observation games and games to drive you crackers!

Whether you're having a sneak peek in "Santa's Sack", annoying the neigbours with your "Karaoke Carols" or quietly humming tunes in "Bah! Hummbug" you'll soon succumb to the Christmas Spirit!

Packed on the audio CD there are challenging trials, trivia quizzes, musical fun and games to play against the clock! Come on... work of those extra calories, switch off the telly and amuse eachother with some good old-fashioned home entertainment!

—description from the back of the box

name: Ethan Allen's Manager's Supplement to All-Star Baseball
description:
While very similar to All-Star Baseball, Ethan Allen saw it as a different game rather than an expansion or 'supplement' in that it was more strategically involved and more sophisticated than the original game. New material was incompatible with the original game.

Description of All-Star Baseball:

signed by former major league player Ethan Allen and introduced in 1941, All-Star Baseball became one of the most popular sports games of all time. The game is essentially a batting simulation of major league baseball, built around a spinner and player disks that are divided into sections in such a manner that a hitter has the probabiltyi of reproducing his real-life statistics in such important categories as home runs, triples, doubles, singles, walks, and strikeouts. In general, the game follows the basic rules of major league baseball. Teams are created from the player disks supplied with the game (often a mix of current players and all-time greats such as Babe Ruth) and from player disks for other seasons published separately. The team at bats places the appropriate player disk on the spinner, spins, and reads off the resulting number. The game does not attempt to realistically simulate pitching and defense. Thus a hitter's result from a time at bat is not affected by the opposing pitcher or the defensive prowess of the fielder to whom the ball may be hit, although the player in the field on some play outcomes is required to spin a second spinner to determine the advancement of base runners and other certain details. Results of each play are recorded on the field using plastic pegs for the base runners, while runs and outs are tallied on a rotating scoreboard. Cumulative runs scored are tallied on paper score sheets. Strategy discs are included that enable plays like sacrifice flies, stealing bases, bunting, hit and run, etc. The team with the most runs after nine innings (or extra innings, if needed) is the winner.

name: Exploitation
description:
It is the Turn Of The Century — The 17th Century, that is. World explorers have discovered new lands, and the race is on to discover what new valuables and resources await those who manage to hold onto the claim. Wars and rumors of war continuously occur across the old Continent, and everyone’s looking for an edge.

But these new lands, much of it is already populated by unknown peoples with strange customs. No matter… perhaps they can be convinced to become an asset for us, or be forcibly removed. Maybe these inhabitants should just be left alone in peace, much like so many wish for their own here at home. But the continuous undertow of world supremacy rages on, and all are caught in her current.

This is where you find yourself today: Will you sit back peacefully and leave to chance your country’s rise to dominance on the self-destruction of the others, or will you dive right in and grab what you can of what the New World has to offer, using that tried and true technique: Exploitation.

Exploitation is a 4x game (3.5x essentially), whereby players manage their resources to navigate the world, founding/conquering settlements and using them to reap more resources. In turn, they can be used for exploring farther regions, building stronger armadas, battling other players, enlisting the help of Privateers, and otherwise trying to be the nation with the highest prestige in the historical setting of the Colonial Era. In the course of play, players are also confronted with the moral complications of the slave trade and the plight of indigenous native populations of the New World.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Income, Resource to Move, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Belapati War
description:
Nusantara, 14th Century ..

Jawadwipa burned. Two unequal forces met on the battlefield. If before, Sunda thought that eventually it would end up with happiness, they must face the bitterness of seeing everything turn into disaster. King Linggabuana and Princess Dyah Pitaloka were astonished to see what was happening before their eyes. Majapahit besieged with complete weapons ready to melt Sunda. Gajah Mada wants Sunda to bow in Majapahit's lap. King Hayam Wuruk couldn't resist Sunda still hold fast the soul of the knights they have. Bela Pati is the only way they choose. They fought to protect their pride. They fought for the sake of their kingdom pride. They fought for the sake of the kstaria they have. They fought even though they knew it would all be ashes. They fought to the point of death.

After all there is nothing left, Princess Dyah Pitaloka chose to sacrifice herself in order to protect the pride of her kingdom. Even the King Hayam Wuruk was sad, his loved one is gone. But the spirit of struggle of the two kingdom countries teaches us, that what we dream of is worth fighting for until it becomes a reality.
Inspired by how the courage of the Sunda to fight against Majapahit, Bela Pati Boardgame was created. Aside from being a media for education of the dark history of the people of Indonesia, This board game will also take you to feel how the soul of “ksatria” in each step you choose burn in your heart.
Choose the kingdom that you will play. Mighty Majapahit, or Brave Sunda. Find the path to victory to maintain the dignity and spirit of the knights of Nusantara.

The warrior pawns moves 4 directions while the king pawn moves 8 directions. There are change direction boxes and secret card boxes. If the pawn on the change direction box, then the pawn of the player has the right to change direction according to the available arrows. If it is in the secret card box, then the player has the right to take the card provided. victory can be achieved by spending all the opponent's pawns.

name: Two Kingdoms
description: Game about fighting for domination between two kingdoms which will win each other's Domination of Religion, War, Technology and Culture by recruiting their citizens. In this game the two players compete quickly to complete the existing conditions in one of domination (war, religion, culture and technology) by recruiting Citizens who are behind the opponent's card by paying the Coin card in the hand in accordance with the request.

name: Laga Pendekar
description:
Laga Pendekar is a card game that invites all players to play & feel the simulation of Pencak Silat competition easily & fun. While playing, the players can get to know some of Pencak Silat techniques and style from the existing game components. This game aims to become a champion by reaching 15 points first. The unique part of this game is 5 characters with different abilities. Each character consists of 3 Style cards. This Style Card is used to attack to get points (without being able to strike back with a regular action card) or just defend (other options if there is no action card to counter other action cards).

However, if this style card is reversed, then it functions to be a Foul card. Used to counter actions, so that opponents can be deducted points.

—user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Luwenak
description:
The game setting is a restaurant that serves traditional Indonesian foods. One day, The Chef falls ill and cannot continue the business. The players are the children of The Chef, competing against each other to inherit the business and carry on the legacy. Be the savior and prove that you can be the best successor in the family! In Luwenak!, players collect as many Customer Cards and Food Tokens as possible. The winner is the first to reach 15 points.
Players have color tokens that they exchange for matching Ingredient Cards. Then players combine their Ingredient Cards to make recipes represented by food tokens, having various point values. Players also gain points by matching food tokens with a customer's favorite food.

name: Prabumeru
description: Welcome to the climbing area! As a novice climber, the climb begins from the easiest to the hardest climbing level, by passing several climbing posts and cannot easily achieve it, some obstacle that must be passed by climbers. By using a climbing information and PIN token it will be easier to reach the peak. Prabumeru is a board game with a theme nature especially mount on java island. Prabumeru is the name taken from mount prau, Mount Merbabu, and mount semeru. The game starts from basecamp Patak Banteng - Selo - Ranu Pane, players must pass each path until they pass the ascent post. Collect as many coins as possible and get a PIN token when in a special area to make it easier to climb. This game is very fun when players get obstacle and penalties. The game is finished when the player is at the highest peak of mahameru. Feel the excitement on every trip!

name: Apocalypse Run
description:
Welcome to Mint City, welcome to the Apocalypse!

The inevitable apocalypse has arrived and you find yourself holed-up in Mint City.
As our intrepid hero you must leave the safety of the Secure Zone and brave the zombie-infested streets to find the components of a highly experimental and almost definitely feasible Z-Bomb.

You'll start out with nothing but your wits, and you'll need them as you dodge zombies and keep moving around the city to find your objectives.

Along the way you'll find Items and Ammo to help you in your quest and return safely to potentially perchance save Mint City.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Relative Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: I Am: Celebrity Edition
description:
This game could not be any easier to play. Throw the dice and the "famous person" will give you a clue to their identity based on the number of the dice - throw a six and will even get the name you are looking for!

—description from the publisher

name: Space Maze Puzzle Game
description:
Space Maze Puzzle Game is a cube shape puzzle with 64 interconnected cubical zones. The objective is for players to place a metal ball in an opening and then rotate the cube and navigate the ball through a path to an opening at the other end.

Once the puzzle is solved the instructions suggest trying a short way, improving the time to complete the maze and even doing it blindfolded!

Made in Australia during the 1950's for a company called Space Maze distributors, The game box has an atomic space theme.

—user summary

name: PANDO: Embarassment Pack
description: 36 cards of potentially embarassing questions

name: Behind Closed Doors: Res Life Training
description:
Add a little fun to your training!
Behind Closed Doors is a card game designed to accompany the training of the commonly named Residence Life Resident Assistant student position. These cards reflect experiences from a multitude of schools and departments and is fun and interesting for new and veteran staff alike because it frames conversations and fosters the sharing of experiences for the supervisor to cover.

Staff draw cards and pick one scenario out of the hand to tackle, taking into account the difficulty of the situation which awards different point values. Staffs take turns attempting to resolve the situation to a supervisor or senior staff's satisfaction to earn points and avoid biting off more than they can choose and lose the points indicated. Rare game cards allow for lifelines, passing on difficult scenarios, and other helpful powers.

Behind Closed Doors is a training card game for employees of university residence life. Introduce your students to novel real-life situations, build team-work, and foster a supportive environment.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: PANDOS: The Family History Game Deluxe
description:
This is a game about family history. Players attempt to answer questions about their family history. As each question is asked, the first to answer correctly scores a point. The first player to score five points wins.

The "Elders" (usually Mom and Dad, or Grandma and Grandpa) are those who will ask questions and who those questions will be about.

The "Progeny" is everyone else (typically family members).

Deluxe Edition limited to 200 copies available only through Kickstarter campaign.

Include First Edition of PANDO: The Family History Game and the Embarassment Pack expansion.

Set comes in a wooden box.

name: Inspector McClue: Diamonds Aren't a Girl's Best Friend
description:
Everyone's a suspect when murder is on the menu. And with a Classic Detective Murder Mystery you have everything you need to serve up the perfect murder dinner party. First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious suspect and invite them to come along as that character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course...a really tasty murder to solve. It will be drop dead fun, and by the end of the evening, one (or more) of the suspects, your 'friends', will be caught out as the murderer!

It's 1919 and the world is still reeling from the shock of the Russian Revolution. For those inside the country, the political upheavals are matched by personal tragedies, and nowhere are this truer than within the Russian royal family. The Tsar, his wife and children have all been killed, and the surviving royals are anxious to escape the same fate. Which is why they are now sailing into exile on board the British warship the HMS Winston.

But even here, it seems, no one is safe. On the second night of their voyage a stowaway is discovered on board. He's found face-down in one of the lifeboats, and he has a jewel-encrusted dagger stuck in is back. Who is this mystery man? Who killed him? And what does any of this have to do with the assassination three years earlier of the mad mystic, Rasputin?

The suspects are:

Dowager Empress Marie – The mother of the murdered Tsar and the great matriarch of European royalty, she is reluctant to leave Mother Russia for the first, and maybe the last, time.
Prince Felix Youssoupov – The playboy prince whose behaviour scandalised St Petersburg and is most famous for being the man who killed Rasputin.
Princess Ivana Legova – A niece of the Tsar, she is reputed to be the richest woman in Europe, particularly since the death of her financier husband.
Grand Duke Boris Borisovich – One of the great landowners of Russia, though the source of his wealth is still something of a mystery.
Captain Pretty – The naval officer in command of HMS Winston is very young for such a position, but he has a distinguished war record and is expected to rise high in the service.
Martha Harry – An American journalist who has been covering the Revolution for the Washington Fox and now seems in something of a hurry to leave the country.
Charles Bronstein – With mixed American and Russian parentage, he has been brought along to act as translator between the royals and the naval officers.
Jane bond – An Englishwoman who was employed as a nanny for the Tsar’s daughters and is now accepted as almost part of the family.


—description from the back of the box

name: BrainBox: Time Traveller
description: This super BrainBox board game now takes every player to the past to experience the age of the dinosaurs or the defining moments of ancient Egyptian civilization. The social goal is for players to memorize as much information as possible within 10 seconds about the tales on the drawn card. After the time has elapsed, you must correctly answer the number rolled dice. The answers can be checked on the card.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Power im Park
description:
This game wants to put a focus on the rights children (should) have.
On a 7 by 7 grid square tiles similar to Labyrinth show paths and dead ends. On your turn, roll a colored die that allows you to flip, rotate or switch one or more tiles. (The color „red“ on the die allows to go directly to an adjacent tile ignoring the path system.) Then move your pawn along the paths to reach a destination. Each player has one secret destination card and tries to accomplish it. After you reached your destination, try to accomplish the task or answer the question. The other players may help you. If you succeed, read the written text (articles of the convention of children’s rights) on the back of the tile aloud and keep the card. When all destinations are reached, the player with the most accomplished cards wins.

Developed by Matthias Gradinger
Produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion-Service GmbH.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Rommel's Last Battle: Caen 1944
description:
This is a war simulation game talked about Battle for Caen in 1944 for 1 - 2 players. The biggest feature in this game is no random elements (no dice, no CRT...).

Components:
Map x 1
Counters x 82
Cards x 55
Rule-book x 1
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Mumbo Jumbo
description:
Mumbo Jumbo is a teasing tangled game of anagrams and general knowledge.
Ingeniously-devised anagrams covering a wide range of topics from movies to places, television to household objects and people to books have to be solved with the help of subtle clues both straight and cryptic
Mumbo Jumbo is more than just a brain teasing challenge - it's a tense race against time and all the others players. Everyone is under the same time limit everyone is up against everyone else.

—description from the back of the box

name: BrainBox: Opposites
description: Children aged 4+ can learn about opposites with this beautifully illustrated BrainBox. Designed for parents to play with their children, this great game will improve observation and memory skills. Whether players are old or young, big or small, BrainBox Opposites will provide fun for all the family.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Food and Drink Trivia Game
description:
2400 questions the yummiest trivia game ever!

Whether you are a fast food junkie, a lover of good home cooking or an expert in haute cuisine, Food and drink trivia has something for you.

—description from the publisher

name: Spin the bottle
description:
Whose letter card will the bottle point to when it stops spinning? Who will the be victim that has to be kissed on the part of the body beginning with that letter ? Is it going to be the player with N (nose) or the player with T (toe)
This hilarious game for bold players will have you frantically thinking up names for body parts (B for ... Bellybutton) and stealing kisses to win you the game. But if the victim forbids you to kiss that body part you can use the ink stamp to decorate that very nose toe or belly button that was refused a kiss. The victim has one last option, to perform one of the forfeits on the back of one of the letter card. But it could be an embarrassing one.

name: Primordials
description:
The Universe is ending and it's up to you to save it, channel the energies of the ancient Primordials to bring harmony to the universe and stop it from falling into the void, or should you be so inclined you could devote yourself to using one Primordial's energy and create chaos, which is sure to bring about the destruction of the universe.

This Take-that style of a set collecting game gets players to play cards to advance their board state while hindering their opponents.

—description from the designer

name: TriviaJig
description:
The object is to win (obviously) and you do that by beating your opponent (or 5 other opponents, because the game is designed for up to 6 players)...
Each player has there own colour coded jigsaw. There are 25 pieces to be pieced together each question answered correctly is rewarded by a piece of the puzzle SIMPLE??... NO. because not all of the pieces fit.. and not only that, but the questions are designed for someone of a high intellectual standard, so ... if your ready here's a little taste of whats in score....

—description from the back of the box

name: Host Your Own: After Dinner Games
description:
Throw a dinner-party with a difference..! Whilst serving a meal from our menu of mouth-watering dishes prepare your guests for the evening of challenging games some sensible some silly some seemingly impossible.

—description from the publisher

name: Smiley Miley's Radio 1 Roadshow Mileage Game
description:
The game can be played by individual players or in teams. The players must successfully negotiate a trip around the British isles starting from London and staging radio 1 roadshows on the way. The players collect "miles" in the form of millage cards on their journey and the player/team with the highest number of miles at the end of the game s the winner. The game ends when the first player arrives back in London with an exact throw.

—description from the rulebook

name: The Ultimate Movie Showdown: A Card Game for 2 players
description:
In this fast paced game, you and your opponent are cliche movie heroes or villains, challenging each other while recreating classic movie scenes. You should expect a lighthearted game, where your super villain character may tell his evil plan to the other contestant, who is apparently a 120 year old kung-fu master ... on the top of a moving train.

The game requires two standard 52 decks and a pair of six sided dice for 2 players. Things that you already have probably. You can print one page to browse your character of choice, but let’s be honest: most of you will use your smartphones to check your character sheet.

There is not always a winner and a loser of a fight, if you can’t put on a good show together, the audience will be displeased, and the director will "remove" the characters from the tournament. If the show was above expectations, the director may have mercy even on the defeated one too, meaning, the character progress won’t be lost. Different characters use different subset of cards, and also alter the standard rules, giving more variety to the game, and offering more fun. Also, the fight can be spiced up with several scenarios listed in this booklet. Different environments may alter the rules, and may change the way how the contestants fight.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoo Ha! Hoo Ha!
description:
Hoo Ha! Hoo Ha! is a simple and captivating card game that uses number matching to amuse friends and family. Easy to learn and a lot of fun to play, it uses four learning styles (aural, oral, visual and kinaesthetic) to aid recall, improve concentration and develop spatial awareness and reasoning - great for young and old minds alike!
The game begins simply: identify two cards that equal your target number, and cover them with two cards from your hand. The excitement begins when you have to work at speed and against other players, which is sure to get the whole family shouting 'Hooa Ha! Hoo Ha!' The winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

name: The Cubist Challenge Game
description:
A very simple roll die and move game, but by playing it one might be led to learn a little about Cubism. An example of instructions on a space is "You’re jealous of Braque; GO BACK
3". Notes are included; the note relating to the above instructions is "Even though Picasso may be considered the most famous Cubist painter, it is known that he was often jealous of Braque’s innovations and ideas". The board is done in a Cubist style. It is one of several games about art available from the Artsology website.

name: Host Your Own Music Night
description:
Sing your heart out with the new Host Your Own Music Night by Talking Tables.

Will your team reach the top of the charts and win the coveted gold disc? With 6 card sets including musical shout out, hum and strum, musical trivia and kazoo karaoke there's plenty of musical fun to be had!

Also includes Next line challenge card set, Musical taboo card set, 2x Microphone props, 4x Guitar props, 4x Kazoos, Mixtape scoresheet pad and Winners trophy.

—description from the publisher

name: Moonies
description:
A century after the first humans landed on the moon, valuable mineral deposits were discovered on the dark side of the moon. The resultant volatile market for these sought after gems attracts interest from far and wide; fortune seekers, runaways, fugitives.

As the leader of a team of Moonies, you must mine various minerals, and manipulate the market to make enough credits to upgrade your spaceship and move on to bigger and better endeavours.

Moonies is an extra-terrestrial card game where 1-4 players must use a novel card drafting mechanism to search for the right cards to complete their set, in order to maximize the payout they will receive.

They can also choose to use special action cards to draw more cards, start additional mining operations, or influence the prices of the 4 different gems before ultimately calling the buyer, and selling what they’ve mined. The first lunar leader to get to 60 credits wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: XenoCommand
description:
XenoCommand is an elite international organization tasked with countering alien invasions of Earth.

Each player starts with a modular base and several structures. Roll the dice to gain resources that correspond to your structures. Spend gold and tech to expand your base, upgrade your defenses, recruit agents and buy vehicles. But as each time you roll the dice, the invader's plans advance, bringing you closer to the inevitable invasion.

When the UFOs descend on Earth, the invaders will breech your base! The only way to survive is to spend wisely, position strategically, and cooperate with your fellow defenders. Wipe out the invaders or capture them to steal their secrets to create advanced weaponry! Survive the onslaught of invader attacks and team up to send your forces into space for a climactic battle against the invader Mothership!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Tile Placement

name: Olympic Games game
description:
A roll-and-move game for 2-6 players, around a track shaped like he Olympic rings. Bonus and penalty spaces along the way are themed for various Olympic Events. The game was produced as a folding pamphlet promoting the Commonwealth Savings Bank, a sponsor of the 16th summer Olympic Games in Melbourne in 1956.

The game pamphlet includes illustrations, an official programme for the games, Olympic records, trivia, and information on World Thrift Day.

—user summary

name: Lyryx
description:
The entire deck is shuffled. In turn, a player will reveal the top card of the deck. If the card has a word or word then the player has thirty seconds to identify the line of a song that contains a word from the card. The player may pick any word if the card drawn is blank. Players continue in turn order to recall song lyrics using the given word within the thirty-second time limit or be eliminated from the round. The sole survivor of the round is awarded the card for scorekeeping purposes. The player with the most cards after the deck is depleted is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Memory, Music, Word Game

name: Monkeys vs Lemurs
description:
Monkeys vs Lemurs is an extremely addictive, fast-paced card game that you can enjoy with up to 8 people! Choose which side you want to fight for, the monkey's side or the lemur's side, and battle it out with your friends for survival on the magical island of Leme! Win the game by forming teams, conquering territories and beating your opponents one by one! The game is very intense so watch out! While playing the game you will be able to admire each cards unique artwork, laugh at all the funny lemur quotes, and overall you will have a blast playing it! Guaranteed!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Ancient, Animals, Card Game, Civilization, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Party Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Ownership, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Kippt + Wackelt!: Das Partyspiel!
description: A pyramid of 55 plastic champagne glasses - and a red glass on top! Try to take one glass after the other out of the pyramid - but if the red glass falls down, you lose!

name: Solar Ocean: Colonies
description:
Your stomach sinks as space-time warps around you. For an instant you are everywhere at once, infinite, then it's back to your tiny, cramped body. Yet, you are no longer where you were a moment before; you have arrived at a new space.

Having exhausted its one-shot fuel, your Gateship Warpcore powers down. You are now by yourself in a virgin solar system, unimaginably far away from Cradle System Sol; a single Executor, with terminal authority over your cargo of a thousand intrepid colonists.

Of course, you are not alone. The Joint Assets & Colonial Operations Bureau (JACOB) rarely works without multiple levels of redundancy. Others have warped in with you; other players in the game of conflict and colonisation in deep space. You may choose to work with or against them. Will you form Alliances, or go for each other's jugulars from day one. There need not be one winner of the coveted Colonial Contract after all... but the fewer, the richer.

Think now... and think well - First things first:

You know the worlds; you have the probe data. Exploring them should reveal strategic sectors, key resources and unique secrets. Terraforming is always a useful tool, but do you really need to spend valuable resources on it? Once you have enough materials, you must start building - small outposts at first; and later on, larger settlements to suit your Faction's ideals. You must also full-body-print more colonists from personas downloaded through your ansibles - a weird kind of immigration.

Build, conquer or destroy - your fame or infamy will attract more immigrants. More people mean more expertise and influence. Now you can truly start to weave your destiny: War, Invasion, Espionage, Sabotage, Crime, Culture, Technology, Industry, Commerce, Politics, World-Building... What is going to be your game?

Your choice, Executor. Let's begin!

---

Solar Ocean: Colonies is a 4X tabletop game and companion RPG about Conflict and Colonisation in Deep Space.

We are using digital asset sales as a unique way to fund game development. Please visit the game website for more details.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Action Retrieval, Alliances, Area Movement, Automatic Resource Growth, Betting and Bluffing, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Interrupts, Investment, Market, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Re-rolling and Locking, Resource to Move, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Das Torwand-Spiel
description:
Promotional game made in 1974 by Flora Soft Margarine. Cashing in on the World Cup Finals that year.

Have fun with this Goal-wall-Game!

You have often seen the big football stars shooting at the goal. Now you can try your luck yourself and become the top scorer of your family.

Game: Flick a counter three times at the bottom hole and three times at the highest hole.

The one who scores the most goals has won and that does not necessarily have to be the family football fan.

But do not forget that having a real ball game is just as much fun and a lot of health.

—user summary

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Ashigaru Scouts
description:
"Captain Hiroji leads his scouting force to patrol the border, and drive off any enemy clan forces."

Mounted Samurai Captain
Scout Sergeant
Ashigaru Runner
3 Ashigaru Scouts
9 Recruitment Cards
1 Trait Card
6 Skill Cards
2 Quest Cards
MDF bases, including 1 multibase

This set focuses on scouting, stealth and sudden attacks.

Captain Hiroji is a master at keeping the enemy off guard, and starts with the Poised for the Attack skill card. His horse tack is functional and unadorned, ready to lead a swift, quiet mission on the borders of clan domains, or perhaps into enemy territory.

The Scout Sergeant reading the map helps move up your other Ashigaru (of any type), with an extra boost if they are heading towards an objective.

Meanwhile the Runner can carry orders from any characters and sergeants in your force, giving their effects a wider reach!

The Ashigaru Scouts are armed with katanas rather than larger, bulkier weapons, and carry their bed-rolls and portions of rice with them, ready for an extended patrol.

Skill cards include Flanking Manoeuvre, Reconnaissance and Hide!

Also in the set are cards for a Mounted Samurai Captain and Mounted Samurai Officer, in case you don't want to use the named character. As well as having different stats to the Mounted Samurai from the Clan Forces pack, these new cards have the Military path icon, so they work perfectly with the skills, trait and quests from the Veteran Ashigaru set.

Box contains 18 gaming cards for Test of Honour and 6 metal miniatures plus bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Memo: Feel the Surface
description: The object of the game is to identify as many pairs of tokens as possible with the same surface by touch. All the tokens are placed in the bag and shuffled. On their turn, players will then take the bag, pull out one token, and try to find the same in the bag. If they succeed, they keep them ; otherwise, tokens are returned into the bag. The player who has the most pairs at the end of the game wins.

name: Bodensee-Reise
description:
Each player gets a ticket and a steamboat. The players have to travel the route, indicated on their tickets. Movement is determined with two number dice and a symbol die. The symbol die has the following meanings:
Arrow: roll again
Flag: roll again
Bell: only the result of 1 number die counts
Anchor: the ship doesn't move at all
Blanks (2x): no effekt
The first player to reach his destination wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Garde 6mm
description:
La Garde 6mm: Rules for Napoleonic grand tactical battles in 6mm.

The concept is to give "grand order". That is to give orders to corps & divisional commanders, not to order a single battalion.
It is considered that a divisional or brigade commander ordered to take defensive positions will form his troops in square by himself if the need was to arise ...

An original system with tokens is used to resolve combats.
Dice are used to determine reinforcements entry times and duration of the battle.

The goal is to break the enemy morale, not just inflicting casualties.

Turn order sequence:

Preparation phases


- Reinforcement phase
- Order phase
- Rally and officers replacement phase
- Initiative phase
- Army corps orders Disclosure


Activation Cycle:


- Activation phase
- Orders disclosure
- Movements and combats


Consolidation Phase


Game scale for ~6mm figures:
1cm = 20 meters.
3cm = 60 meters (width of the bases)
10cm = 200 meters (effective range of muskets)
60cm = 1200 meters (max range of 12 pounds of artillery pieces)
1m = 2km
A game turn last from 20 to 55 minutes.

- User summary

name: Foodie Frenzy
description:
Theme:
Foodie Frenzy is a fast and funny game for 3–6 players that combines dice rolling and card play. Players compete to be the first to serve the customer's order without having any LOLcats spoiling it. Success requires tactical thinking and willingness to seize opportunities, as well as quick reflexes.

Gameplay:

Collect all the Dishes that are listed on the Order card on your Platter to win the round.
But it won't be that easy, though. Other players can use LOLcats cards to prevent you from delivering your meal!
They can also spoil your Platter by placing useless cards on it!
Be ready to grab the Kikker when the dice roll shows 2 or 3 of a kind!
Whoever holds the Kikker gets a Bonus card for extra moves, and their Platter can’t be spoiled on that turn.


Goal:
Be the first to complete the order and cash-in the money.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Command Cards, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hell Bent
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Worker Placement with Dice Workers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: European theater: 1941 - 1945
description: ' European theater: 1941 - 1945' （决战欧陆） is a simulation on the the land combat in Europe from 1941 to 1945. The game also has system focus on Submarine warfare, and Technology upgrading.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Autofahrer unterwegs
description:
The players begin at "Start". Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players. The first player to reach space 143 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: マヤる！ (Mayale!)
description:
マヤる！ (Mayale!) is a puzzle game with a theme of Mayan civilization. By placing cards in front of you, you form cities which consist of temples, houses, and fountains.

In this game, there are 72 cards, each of which has six terrain squares. At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt 15 terrain cards. They then shuffle their cards to form their deck.

Each round, they simultaneously draw two cards from their deck. They then choose one and place it in front of themselves, and place the other on top of another player's deck face-up. This process is done in real time.

When you place your card in front of you, you must partially overlap it on an existing card. Both of overlapped squares must have the same terrain.

If at least one temple, houses, and fountain are surrounded by the forest, they form a city, earning you victory points at end of game depending on the size of the city. Fountains score 3pts each. Temples and houses score more points the more they appear in the city. For each macaw you can see in your forest, you score 1pt at the end of the game.

As the game nears the end, you might place a card with no chance to score. In that case, you don't place it but turn it over instead for 2 pts. However, cards that have been placed cannot be moved or retrieved to score.

At the end of the game, the highest scorer wins the game. The game can be played solitaire.
user summary

マヤ文明＋パズル。マヤの王となって都市を作ろう。都市は神殿・家・泉の3つをセットで森で囲わないといけません。しかも1つ以上の地形を同じにして重ねなければなりません。
publisher's summary
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Exploration, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Map Addition, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Reiseland Österreich
description:
Each player starts at one of five starting spaces. Movement is determined by a die. The players have to visit 8 cities and return to their starting space. At each city, the player collects a colored cardboard ring to stack on his playing peace. The first player to return to his starting space with eight collected rings wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wer sucht der findet
description:
At the beginning of the game, different prizes are hidden in the five cardboard buildings. The players start at the park entrance. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces are obstacles. The first player to reach a building collects the prize hidden there. When all five prizes are found, the game ends.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Boxkampf-Spiel
description:
The boxing match goes about three rounds. The players start on space 1 (center space) ant try to reach space 100. Movement is determined by a die. If a player lands on a picture, he gets points, other benefits or penalties. If a player gets on space 100 he wins the game by knocking out his opponent. Otherwise the player with the most points wins after three rounds.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zeti Toto Spiel
description:
The players may bet on the results of the toto-device in the following games:


Sport-Toto
Gesellschafts-Toto
Farben- und Zahlenspiel


The bets are placed on the inner game board.

The toto-device can also be used like a die to play the "Wettrennspiel" (Race Game) on the outer track of the game board. The first player to reach space "Ziel" wins the game.

The toto-device contains a variable number of white, red and black marbles, depending on the game played. There are up to 19 white, 8 black and 7 red marbles. By shaking the device in a upside down position and then turn it up, the marbles fall into the slot and each marble indicates a number.

On the back of the game board, there is a "Nine Men's Morris" game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WereABC
description:
Werewolf's world is big, full of fabulous creatures and characters! Once up a time, they got together and organized a game night called "BINGO!"
The game is simple:

Play as many cards as you want, as long as they can form up a formation;
