And the next player should play cards following the last player's formation;
The last player who plays the formation wins the current round, and take all B, I, N, G, O cards among the played cards this round.
If there is a player played out his hand cards, the game night is over, and everyone calculate their five score cards: B,I,N,G,O.


5. The player who has the most B,I,N,G,O cards wins the game!
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Accuse Me?!
description:
You are a citizen of the small town, Suemlots, and the mayor is in big trouble. As the most litigious person in the most litigious city in the most litigious state in the country, he has to keep his dirty dealings under wraps. The mayor needs distractions and has told the top eight attorneys in his beautiful city to take any case they can get so that he can get the heat off of him.

WE cards provide or block evidence to back up or refute an accusation. For example, a “Security Video Footage” may be used to add a Point to the accuser’s case, but the defender may cancel that card out with a “Blurry Video” WE card. To win a case, the accuser must beat the defense by three points.

With hints from the Crime and Clue cards, players now have the option to Accuse each other of a crime listed in the Suemlots Gazette. Players then try to build a case and take it to court. In court, the prosecution (accuser) always goes first. Randomly turn over a Judge card. Apply Attorney and Judge bonuses or negatives to the case. Explain your case by laying down applicable WE cards and attempt to sway the judge and jury with your witnesses and evidence.

After the prosecution has laid their case before the judge, the defense now brings their evidence and witnesses to bear. All cards to be played by the defense now come into play and a preponderance of evidence/witnesses will win the day. To use the sample from above, a “Security Video Footage” may be used to add a point to the accuser’s case, but the defender may cancel that card out with a “Blurry Video” WE card.

The Accuser wins the case when they have three or more uncontested pieces of evidence/witnesses that the defense is unable to deflect, block, or have thrown out of court. The Defense wins in any condition where the prosecution team has less than three pieces of evidence that are uncontested. The game ends when an accuser wins their case in court.

—description from the designer

name: Draw West
description:
Draw West is a micro card game with bag building. The game plays several rounds, until the end game condition is met.

During player turn, the player:

Either plays a face up card from his/ her hand to perform the ability on the card,
Or plays a face down card to perform one of Market actions.


When each player plays six cards in their tableau, the round ends. Then the players determines their faction by the number of the face up cards in their tableau. If there are two factions in the end of the round, the final duel carries out. The player from each faction starts to duel by drawing cubes from their bags until there is only one faction survived and the survived players scores.

—description from the designer

name: Parrot Pair-it
description:
Parrot Pair-it is a cute and easy game that people of any age can enjoy. Each deck contains beautiful artwork of 26 pairs of parrots. Each pair has its own point value based on how common the parrot species is.

There are two ways to play Parrot Pair-it:

Dexterity

For those who want a dexterity-based game, five random cards would be spread on the table, face up. Each player draws seven cards from the rest of the deck. The player whose turn it is looks for a pair. If there is on in their hand, easy points, lay them down in front of you. If they have a card in their hand that matches a card the table, they must let the parrot fly down to its mate. Hold the card at least a foot above the table, flip it up and try to get it to land, face up, touching its match. If it does, pick up it and add it to your collected pairs. If not, place it in the discard pile, draw a card, and hope you’ll do better the next try.

Simply Picking Pairs

Another way to play Parrot Pair-it is the Old Maid method, where players hold a hand of seven cards and either ask if an opponent has a card needed to make a pair, or they may physically remove a card from an opponent’s hand. Lay any pairs down to be counted later.

Scoring

Cards have a number scale across the bottom that rises from left to right. Some parrots species will only have one pair, while others may have up to five. If a player, for example, has one pair of macaws, which is a five-pair set, it may be worth only five points. But if the player has four of the five macaw pairs, they would have 25 points, and if they have all five, fifty points. Winning the game is when one person reaches a predetermined score, or when all the parrots have been paired with the person with the highest score winning.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Number, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Physical Removal, Stacking and Balancing, Three Dimensional Movement

name: THE GIFT OF THE GAB
description:
THE GIFT OF THE GAB is a unique talking game that brings a combination of humour, mental stimulation and awareness. All whilst enriching speech and cognition!

Free print & play available.

Rules


Don’t say the filler words "um", "er/uh", "like", "you know" and "basically".
Don’t pause for more than 3 seconds.
Don’t repeat yourself.
Don’t talk slowly.


Overview

30 or 60 seconds to speak off the cuff...

Describe - 'Random Stuff' cards that challenge your ability to describe with your basic senses.
Discuss - 'Topical Subject' cards that challenge your ability to discuss and share knowledge on current matters.
Answer - 'Thought Provoking Question' cards that challenge your ability to answer what you may be asked in an interview, by scary in-laws and by silly friends.
Sell -'The Unsellable' cards that challenge your ability to sell by finding the value in anything.

Have you got it?

—description from the designer

name: Nine Fields
description:
A deck-bulding game of heroic drafts and board control.

Nine Fields is a fantasy deck-building game about drafting and board control that fits in your pocket, literally! Designed to work within the size constraints of a single mint tin, Nine Fields offers a fun, quick head-to-head strategy gaming experience that is completely self-contained and ready to go right out of the box.

Players take turns managing their resource dice to decide between purchasing cards from an ever-evolving Center Row to add to their deck, playing cards that they draw, and using those dice to power attacks against their opponents in order to eliminate them from their spaces. With 24 different base Heroes and Monsters to draft from Nine Fields offers tons of replay-ability as players explore different drafting and play strategies.

If a player can retain control of 5 spaces at the end of their opponent's turn, they win!

-description from publisher

name: A Question of Sport: Premier
description:
The all round sports game based on the classic TV show.
So you think your an all round sports fan? You'll need to be to win at this game of sporting knowledge.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Divinities Boon: Primordium
description:
The gods are at war with each other. But that doesn't matter to you, as you are not a god. You are a champion of your race, and your god has told you of a great relic that will provide you with immeasurable power to overcome your foes. You must gather your most fierce forces to make the journey because your enemies have the same destiny.

Divinities Boon: Primordium, pits fantasy races against each other in a battle to a magical relic. Champions command forces as they move forward on the player’s game board. Attack your opponent’s forces with melee, ranged or siege assaults to move your champion forward, or your enemy backward. Once your champion reaches the Boon, they must fight to retain control of it for three rounds. But victory is fleeting, for the other gods have the power to remove the boon and give their favored champion another chance for greatness.

Players take turns by playing one or two minions, whose MELEE, RANGED, and SIEGE stats combine. If they beat the opposing player’s minions in any of the three attacks, that champion is moved forward a number based on the cards played (attack and ranged), or the opposing champion is moved backward (siege). Champions add powerful bonuses to the minion's attacks and defenses. Boon cards may also be played to give an added edge.

Once the champion reaches the final destination, they must maintain control of the relic for three, non-consecutive rounds. The winner returns to their homeland with the favor of their god until they take it away to play their game again.

—description from the designer

name: Tuttu Juttu tuntemisleikki lisäkysymyssarja 400 uutta kysymystä
description:
This is the 400-question version in a square box that was similar, but somewhat smaller than the original game box.

There is also a 300-question edition in a rectangular box (the same as concurrent Alias expansions); both were published in 1992.

Both versions simply have additional question decks inside the box, for the four categories of the game; no new rules or mechanics were introduced.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ophidian 2360: Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes three new cards (two of them double-sided) for Ophidian 2360

Terror Blast
Xarz'ycus VP7/6
Xarz'ycus VP5/4
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: The Banana Tree Game
description:
Object of the game is to put as many bananas as you can in the monkey's basket without making the monkey fall off the tree.

The game comes in a small plastic suitcase. You open up the suitcase and then build the tree, attaching it to the middle of the open suitcase. Then the basket is attached to the monkey and then monkey is attached to the magnet on one of the branches of the tree.

Each player is given three brown bananas, one of each size.
The rest of the bananas are placed in center for all players to use.

Players take turn spinning the spinner to determine the type of banana that is added to the basket. If the monkey and basket fall, the player who knocked it off must take back all the brown bananas, placing the yellow and green ones back in the center pile.

The winner is the first person to be out of brown bananas AND the monkey falls on another players turn.

—user summary

name: Kill the Sushi Master
description:
Kill the Sushi Master! In this highly addictive, fast-moving card game exclusive to Kickstarter where your goal is to avoid any poorly prepared and under cooked sushi and be the last Itamae standing to win! ! Do whatever it takes to be the best in front of the cutting board! (We’ll explain later, but trust us, in Japan: it’s super cool to be in front of the cutting board.)

At the beginning of your journey, you must collect all the ingredients and accessories to first become the Wakiita. Then you must wield the mighty hocho and defeat all the other aspiring sushi chefs. What? Did you think you were the only one aiming to stand in front of the cutting board? Everyone else is striving to get to that prestigious spot. You could use your remarkable skills to make your way to the top, or you could take the totally normal route of making your way to the top by damaging their reputation by introducing nasty smelly salmon and any other unpleasant ingredients to their food.

—description from the designer

name: Tiny Castle Crush
description:
Tiny Castle Crush is a game about building your castles and destroying others' castles. It is the series of Castle Crush, however stand alone game.

The game plays 3 rounds. There are 4 phases in each round: Income, Build, Attack and Evaluate phases.

Income phase: each player takes one block from the supply until running out ot the available blocks.
Build phase: each player chooses one map tile and build a castle on top of the map tile by using the whole blocks owned. After completing their castle, each player moves the map tile with completed castles to the center of the table in order. Each map tile must connect to the other map tiles with the same landscape.
Attack phase: active player may either choose to attack a castle by falling the hammer. The attacker earn the blocks he/she knocks down, or pass the rest of Attack phase.
Evaluate phase: the castle with the the most blocks earns the big castle reward. The castle which is highest one including the King earns the Tower reward.


After three rounds, the last scoring carries out. The player who earns the most VP is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Black Death (fan expansion for Tramways)
description:
Long have the animals of this world grown and prospered, finding ever more means of sustaining themselves and their kind. They sprout up anywhere they find favorable conditions, and when the conditions are not, they adapt to make themselves hardy enough to survive. As they grow in numbers, so too does their insolence.

But not for long.

Now is the time for us to strike! Now is the time to bring these “humans” to their knees and show them that their safety, their progress, is illusory. For what they see as a strength, their numbers, will be their undoing. We shall descend upon them with a fury the likes of which they have never seen. None shall be spared our retribution, all shall wither under our onslaught, and once again the proper balance shall be restored.

We are Pestilence.

We are Suffering.

We are Black Death.

In Tramways: Black Death, players take on the role of Yersinia Pestis and spread the Bubonic Plague (the Black Death) from the Asian Steppes to all of the Western World. Points can be achieved through normal means, but also through the spread of the Plague through Europe and the Middle East. In the end, only one player will win, but the Black Death shall ultimately be victorious.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: El Respondedor
description:
The board game in which you have to guess the answers of your friends!

Each turn, there will be a question given by the game, and 2 possible answers. Each player will have a role:

The Questioner: Will read the question and the 2 possible answers, out loud.
The Answerer: Will answer the question, choosing his answer card, and putting it face down over the table, without anyone seeing it. He will win victory points for every player that guesses his answer.
The Guessers: Each Guesser will try to guess the Answerer's answer, by choosing a card, and putting it face down over the table. At the same time, they will have to choose how many victory points to bet. If they answer correctly, they double the points they had bet. If they answer incorrectly, they lose the points.


The goal is to have the most victory points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Abzorbaloff & Victor Kennedy
description: This expansion adds the Abzorbaloff and Victor Kennedy to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes two miniatures, two faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Milky Way
description:
"A myriad of stars floating in the night sky. The milky way is formed by stars gathered together. How do you want to make this milky way? This game is simultaneously played action game where players make a beautiful milky way by using the stars they have without overlapping the stars of other players."

Contents:
1 Central Star Card
2 Black Star Cards
45 Star Cards (5 cards each of numbers 0-8)
15 cubes

The Game is played over several rounds with 5 phases:
1. Discard Shooting Star cards by spending 2 cubes
2. Select one card from hand and place face down on table
3. All players show cards simultaneously
4. Resolve identical cards
5. Placing cards - In order from high to low each player place cards according to rules with Black Star cards played last. If a card is unable to be played the card is flipped over and becomes a shooting star.

The game ends immediately when a 9x3 rectangle arrangement is filled with cards or when players use all cards in their hands.

The winner is the player with the least amount of Shooting Star cards.

-From Game Instructions

name: Serrature
description:
Serrature is an easy and fast card game for 2-6 players about geometric shapes.

"Serrature" is the italian word for "locks". To win, you try to collect the highest number of Lock cards, guessing the basic shapes (triangle, square, circle, etc.) composing them.

The game is aimed at children (age 7+) and families; it was developed to help discovering and using basic geometric shapes in primary school.

Serrature is easy to print-and-play: just print and cut its 78 cards and you're ready to go!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time

name: Animal Relay
description:
Animal Relay is a fast paced, entertaining game of racing in a highly portable package. In Animal Relay players manage an allocation of Animals to contest a relay race by choosing their optimal team.

Players are assigned six animals from a pack of 48 unique options from which they must choose and programme* their preferred team. Animal’s combined speed will be central to a winning strategy, however, other characteristics such as height, width and natural predatory instincts, may influence progress in neighbouring lanes. Each player will have information regarding their own team, with other teams revealed as the game progresses. Players strategies should allow for possible opportunities and interruptions from neighbouring lanes.

The game is suitable for 1-6 players. More players can compete with the additions of more packs. When playing with less than six players, one or more players may contest with more than one team or the random allocation of cards permits unallocated (but sub-optimal) teams to challenge for the win.
The game is a perfect ice-breaking social game because of its easy to explain rules, intuitive setting, fast pace and flexible player count. It is also a great filler game to pass 15-20 minutes while waiting for players to assemble for a longer game. Its quick and changeable gameplay however, often lead to contests of best of three, best of five…etc

The game contains:
48 No. Unique Animal Cards;
4 No. Progress Track Cards;
6 No. Individually Coloured Dice;
6 No. Individually Colour Player Markers.

The game is not intended as an educational game, however additional scientific information is presented for each animal.

Please don’t take offence at these animals sticking there tongues out at you; each was requested to prove they had no illegal devices to aid in the carrying of a baton!


To programme is a modern gaming term for simply organising options in advance where all players choices are then played out without alteration in sequence. Compliant programming choices in this game are easily comprehensible by simply lining up linking graphics of batons.


—description from the designer

name: Blimps
description:
Blimps is a steampunk themed push-your-luck dice game.

Players start the race in London and then travel around the world in six stages. Each leg of the journey requires you to collect the right equipment, food, weather, tools via dice rolling.

As you secure aspects of the journey leg, the remaining parts become harder to roll. You may choose a high scoring route with a tough combo of requirements, or prefer to race ahead by choosing an easier route.

When one player returns to London, the end-game kicks in. With added determination and grit, the others speed up to try and finish.

—description from the designer

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Sontaran General Staal
description: This expansion adds Sontaran General Staal and his bodyguards to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: GO! GO! Western Team
description:
A Family game for 3 to 4 Players, with variants for 1 and 2 Players, easy in rules, a fast setup and a portable package.

You have 45 Seconds to SHOOT all your Bullet Cards using only One Hand, trying to land them on the Bandit Card of the Same Color, but the problem is... You Only Know your Bandit Cards! and You Can’t Communicate at All! You can deviate the Bullet Cards while they are in the air, but none of them that are resting on the gameplay area.

A game made of 3 rounds of 45 seconds each, at the end of the game you count your remaining Bullet Cards and compare with the score chart, to see how well you did it.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Flicking, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: File Leader
description:
File Leader is a set of miniatures combat rules for smaller battles of the English Civil War, featuring up to a few companies per side.

A notable feature is that units can choose between taking casualties and giving ground.

—user summary
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Spelet om Allemansrätten
description:
A trivia game about the Swedish concept of Every mans right, the right to roam the land.

—user summary

name: Civicus Dice Game: 3-4 Player Expansion
description:
The exciting world of Civicus just got bigger! This expansion pack allows 2 additional players to join the adventure. (Original Civicus Dice Game needed to play.)

Expansion Pack includes:

12 Settlement Tokens (6 each color)
4 Exotic Goods
8 Attribute Counters
2 Reference Cards
2 Colossus Tokens
1 Starting Player Crystal
categories: Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Grim Old Dark
description:
Grim Old Dark is an action role-playing hack and slash tabletop game.

Journey through randomly generated maps while completing quests, defeating Demon Generals, and murdering countless lesser Demons along the way.

Attack and cast spells using Runes. Fortify your Champion with thousands of unique weapons, armor and spell cards by acquiring Cursed Chests.

Conquer unique quests with or against your friends. Build your Champion from scratch or enter with your own gear. Gain favor with Satan and maybe you can save your soul.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: The Lost City
description:
Thousands of years ago, a resplendent city was built on a remote island by the Creators, deep in the undiscovered jungles. Now, looters and archaeologists have found the hidden city after decades of searching for it...what will become of The Lost City?
The Lost City utilizes card drafting, hand management, bluffing, and social deduction, as well as a new “deck construction and deck destruction” mechanic.

The game is played is 3 phases:

The Construction Phase - Players play the role of the Creators and build the Lost City using cards drafted to them.
The Destruction Phase - Players play the role of looters and archaeologists and discover and loot what the Creators have built. It is here that card effects can be played to manipulate the deck.
Calculation Phase - All players calculate the points in their Value Pile or their hand (if applicable). Players will take into account some cards that give them negative points!


—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Deduction, Fantasy
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: Blades of Bronze: Fast play rules for 15mm Ancients
description:
These rules are designed for short skirmish 15mm Ancient wargames between 2 players. For scales larger than 15mm, such as 25mm, double the measurements or use inches instead of centimetres. These rules revolve around the ability of leaders to give orders to the soldiers.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: The War Against Russia
description:
The War Against Russia (TWAR) is a comprehensive simulation covering the first two years of the Crimean War in both the Crimea and the Danube. The game is heavily inspired by Frank Chadwick’s GDW Crimea which was released in the mid 70s, and uses similar concepts but streamlined for playability. Players will be able to choose to start the campaign from the Russian advance into Wallachia (modern day Romania) or at the start of the Crimean campaign. This is the first time the campaign outside the Crimea itself has been depicted in any simulation. Units will be regiment sized, with the ability for some limited tactical choices such as charging. Siege Artillery will play an important role being necessary to destroy fortresses before an assault. In addition to the operational battles, A linked campaign will be included so players can carry their losses across multiple scenarios and compare their performance to their historical counterparts. The allies have multiple options when it comes to landing and conducting amphibious operations. Forces from the allied navies along with the black sea fleet are present as well.

-description from publisher's website

name: Guns Of The Americas
description:
Guns of the Americas is a strategic scale hypothetical that examines what a renewed conflict between the states would look like during the first world war. The history behind the game is that the South manages to win a truce during the Civil War and the USA remains divided up until WW1. The North allies with Germany while the South allies with the Entente (the rationale being both the ethnic makeup and trading relationships of both regions). The North must execute a Schlieffen-like plan to take out the south before they can coordinate fully with their Canadian and Mexican allies.

The game includes units for the USA, CSA, Germany, Japan, France, Canada and Mexico. 2 large maps depict north America from Mexico City to Quebec. The game’s mechanics are derived and inspired from Mark Simonitch’s The US Civil War while introducing several new ideas and layers of complexity such as Naval and Air operations as well as card assisted mechanics.

-description from publisher's website
categories: American Civil War, Wargame, World War I

name: Trierarchs: Trireme Warfare in the 5th Century
description:
Trierarchs is a modern take on ancient Tactical Naval Warfare during the 5th century with a special focus on and surrounding the Peloponnese War. The naval conflicts of the ancient world were strategically and logistically vital to any nation’s ambitions of expansions and colonization. Thucydides himself was exiled as a result of his failure to prevent a Spartan landing at Amphipolis and the subsequent death of Athenian general and politician Cleon at that battle.

The period is notable for the relative ferocity and unique nature of naval conflict. The primary tactic being to ram your opponents ship via it’s broadside as quickly as your oarsman could row. Triremes were packed sparingly along with several hoplite marines and archers who could either attack or board enemy ships if close enough. Athens was primarily the dominant naval power until the end of the war and even had an original tactics where they could maneuver a ship parallel to an opponent going in the opposite direction, pull in their oars, and shear off the oars of their enemies leaving them dead in the water. The quality of a crew would frequently make up for inferior numbers in combat making for interesting and thrilling scenarios, of which Trierarchs is packed.

A basic and advanced version of the rules will be included where players may easily pick and choose what rules they wish to include. The advanced rule increase the playing time and relative complexity of the rules in order to more accurately reflect the nature of ancient naval warfare. Optional rules are included for simultaneous movement, double-blind refereed games, as well as limited combined-operations with land forces.

-description from publisher's website

name: Great Battles of Lacedaemon
description:
The Violent Schoolmaster Tactical Series (VSTS) is (again) inspired by the late John Young and his PRESTAGS series for SPI. VSTS will cover all eras of warfare from the beginning of history until the 17th century. This series is possible because warfare changed relatively little between this period until the wars of the 17th century developed Pike & Shot tactics and the era of combined arms started to develop.

The first full game in the VSTS set of games focuses on Lacedamemon, otherwise known to us in the modern era as Sparta. Lacedemonia was the dominant land power in the ancient Greek world, establishing its hegemony over the Peloponnese peninsula sometime after the collapse of the Bronze Age. After years of internal struggle and intrigue, Sparta emerged from it’s borders putting down tyrants creating allies across the region forming what today is called the Peloponnese league

4 critical battles in Sparta’s history are presented in a clean, accurate, and playable format which promises not to get bogged down in minutia. A simple command system sees leaders able to allow units to their move and grant benefits to units in combat, or units suffering from adverse results in combat, though this can sometimes result in the worsening quality of the leader. Each hex in VSTS represents about 100 meters from hexside to hexside. Each single hex-sized unit represents a company/squadron of 100-150 mean and/or horses. Each turn represents 5 minutes of real time. Units from Thebes, Corinth, Athens, Macedonia, and several others localities are represented in game.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Durch den Dschungel der Sexualität
description:
The players start at the tail of the snake and have to reach the head. Movement is determined by a die. On each space the player has to draw a card. There are question cards, action cards and fate cards. If the player answers the question or fulfills a task the pawn may be moved, if not it remains on it's former position. The first player or team to reach the snake head has to fulfill two tasks to leave the head and win the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Avalanche Crash
description:
Avalanche Crash is a game of balance and slow, careful movements. Load the board with colorful chips, roll the die, and then see which color you need to move up from the bottom to the top. Choose your space carefully, if the board gets unbalanced you might cause an avalanche!

Features
Precision game play for 2-4 players
Teaches balance and coordination
For 2-4 players

Skill Building
By carefully and deliberately placing their Avalanche Crash game pieces, children will work on the development of fine motor skills, concentration, and focus.

Package Contents:
Double tiered tilting tray, 32 colorful playing chips, game die, instructions

Recommended Age:
4 Years to 6 Years

—description from the publisher

name: EleMental
description:
Elemental is a logic and deduction game for 1 to 4 players. It can be played in cooperative or competitive mode.
The game is set in a mansion where a murder has been committed. Players must find out where each of the suspects were, the weapons and the evidence at the time the crime was committed. To do this, they must establish logical conditions to determine the location of each object. The players have a limited amount of conditions to formulate. If these are over or contradict each other they lose the game. In contrary, they manage to locate each element in the room of the corresponding mansion they will have won.

Elemental es un juego de logica y deduccion para 1 a 4 jugadores. Se puede jugar en modo cooperativo o competitivo.
El juego se ambienta en una mansion donde se ha cometido un asesinato. Los jugadores deberan averiguar donde estaban cada uno de los sospechosos, las armasy las pruebas en el momento de cometer el crimen. Para ello deben establecer condiciones logicas para determinar la ubicacion de cada objeto. Los juadores disponen de una cantinadad limitadas de condiciones a formular. Si estas se acaban o entran en contradiccion entre si pierden la partida. si por el contrario consiguen ubicar a cada elemento en la hbaitacion de la mansion correspondiente habran ganado.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Conquest IQ: The Ultimate Strategy Board Game
description:
Conquest IQ - The Ultimate Strategy Board Game is an interactive matrix board with new strategic moves. The game consists of 32 pieces. Each player an Emperor, Empress, Palace Guards, Catapults, Bowmen and Foot Soldiers. Conquest IQ has designated areas for a River, Battlefield and Palaces. The objective is to capture the opponent’s Emperor through strategic positioning. The game-play is to entice novice and skilled chess players. In terms of originality, the game maximizes the concept appeal with:

Next Generation Animation & Illustration
Interactive Multi-Player Board
Intelligible User Interface(UI)& User Experience(UX)
Strong Play Patterns
Live Challenge
Overall Design


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring

name: Kalóz Sziget
description:
This is a children's path game, similar to Chutes and Ladders. The name means "Pirate Island".

In each turn the players move in order from youngest to oldest. The included coin is spun or tossed; if it lands number side up, the player moves one space; the other side, two spaces. If the player is about to land on an occupied space, they can choose the space either before or after it. If the player lands on a space with a word, they must immediately move to the space with the word opposite in meaning, whether forward or back. If the player cannot yet read they can have a parent or older sibling help them find the opposite word. If they can't figure out the opposite word, they lose their next turn. The first player to make it to the boat wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Meet at the Inn
description:
Many heroic adventures begin with a ragtag group of folks gathering to discuss their plans to help save the land from peril! And many of those meetings took place at the town's local inn! In Meet at the Inn, you're the adventurer freshly setting out on your journey... but will you mostly encounter simple beasts and uneventful landscapes, or will you be trapped by a Null Zone, brave the Cavern of the Abyss, or command the power of the Genie?

Meet at the Inn is comprised of 30 unique cards, each with unique Trait combinations and some with unique abilities. The goal of the game is to empty your hand of cards, but that is much easier said than done.

Each turn you will only play 1 card from your hand if it matches a Trait with the top card of the Play Pile. If you cannot, you must draw a card from the Deck. Certain cards can remain in play with global effects, called "Decrees". Some cards allow you to play out of turn to empty your hand faster, these are "Chain" abilities.

There is also a Discard Pile, which helps get cards out of play, because when the Deck is empty and a player must draw a card, the Play Pile is reshuffled!

Set up and teaching the game takes less than 5 minutes. Playing a game takes roughly 5 minutes per player. But Meet at the Inn really shines when you've played it a few times with the same friends because your strategy will adapt to the meta of your opponent.

—description from the designer

name: Lieber bairisch sterben
description:
Lieber bairisch sterben (Better to die Bavarian) covers the Bavarian Peasant Revolt of the early 18th century in which three sides fought for power: the Imperial Austrian Army, the Prince-Elector's forces, and the rebellious peasants.

Players don't represent a particular faction, but instead must court the factions' leadership each turn, acquiring counters of the corresponding color. The main shareholder is awarded the leadership for that turn, and in the course of a game, the leader of a side can change multiple times.

Through their faction, a player tries to gain points, earning them for the capture of the most important towns: Munich, Regensburg, Passau, Straubing, Landshut, and Burghausen. To do so, you must to occupy these with a unit. Occupying a town brings money into the bank, with which you can pay for the cost of the troops. Battles are dealt with via a unique card mechanism.

Lieber bairisch sterben is a completely reworked version of the 1988 game of the same name.

name: 1837-Saxonia
description:
18SX Saxony is an 18XX design that contains thirteen corporations, with up to ten of them being put into play over the course of the game, with "concessions" being made to determine who may start which companies distributed in a start-packet system.

The game has a unique track system in which directors have to choose between single and double track, with those choices having an effect on route length.

18SX Saxony is a heavy reworking of 18SX from the same author.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Investment, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Shaolin Chess
description:
Shaolin Chess theme is a fantasy style, shaolin mortal combat. It combines some design aspects of Chinese Checkers with the moveset mechanics of Chess. The pieces representing some of the 5 most iconic Shaolin Styles: The Tiger, The Dragon, The Crane, The Snake and The Monkey.

Game play - Designed around an arena, up to 6 players compete in various (5) game modes for the title of Grand Master. Each player is given a set of "5 guard" pieces representing the styles. You must battle your way to victory in a blood bath of a game.

Goal of the game - To exercise a sense of strategy and understanding of others by building small inclusive communities.

Game modes - There are (5) different game modes. Each game mode can be made into a team match except for "Duel".

Duel - a game mode that resembles chess more than anything. You must capture your opponent's Grand Master piece. Accommodates between 2-3 players.

BloodBath - Last man standing wins.
Accommodates up to 6 players.

Dojo - Capture the flag like game, where your pieces must infiltrate an opponent's home base by reaching the furthest point in their dojo.
Accommodates up to 6 players.

Siege - An attacking Vs. Defender game, where an offensive team must capture all defending home bases, and the defending team must keep their bases safe.
Accommodates up to 6 players.

Enlightenment - A king of the hill type game, where players must race to the middle of the board, capture the grand master piece and keep control of the GM long enough to direct it back to their Dojos goal.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Score-and-Reset Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Static Capture, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: The Game of Gates
description:
Players take turns turning gates and moving pieces within the open paths created. The game is won by players moving their piece to the opposing players base, or by pinning the opposing players piece.

The game takes place on a 10x10 grid board with 45 gates. Player's bases are located in the far left corner of the back rows on each side of the board. Pieces are placed on their respective bases at the start of the game.

A turn consists of two actions in this order: a player turns any gate on the board, then a player moves their piece anywhere along the open path at least one space. Players take turns doing this until there is a winner.

name: Portraitgeist
description:
One player will be taking on the role of a pesky poltergeist, Vincent VanGhost. Vincent has come to this mansion, to free his ghostly companions from their Portrait prisons in order to help him complete his ghastly rituals throughout the house. Vincent will be moving about the house in secret, using a separate pad to keep track of his movements, trying to free the other ghosts from their paintings. The painting ghosts will be moving about the house too but unlike Vincent, their movement is on the board for all to see. All the ghosts also have a unique movement advantage over the hunters, they can move through walls. As the ghosts are released freed, they will assist Vincent in completing rituals. To win the game they must complete 3 out of 5 rituals in 9 rounds of play. The other players will share control of the 4 hunters on the board. Each of these hunters has one of 10 different special powers to choose from giving each game a different way to combat Vincent and his ghostly pals. But if you think Vincent is without his own powers and tricks think again. Vincent too has different once per game powers to choose from, getting 3 to use each game. For the hunters to win they will need to locate Vincent and zap him, or hold him and his spooky pals at bay until the time limit expires.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hidden Movement

name: Dead Men's Revenge
description:
Quick Explanation of Dead Men's Revenge
After battling in BULLSHIP! to obtain the legendary Black Lagoon, players embark on their ships to race to Treasure Island, where they will amass riches and become the most powerful pirate king in the world.
The player who scored the last place from the original BULLSHIP! has come into contact with a deadly virus that has converted them into a contagious ZOMBIE! The Zombie could care less about Treasure Island - they solely want to convert all other players into Zombies and turn the sea into a zombie-infested undead haven.
The gameplay remains the same, however, with a twist. Each non-zombie player will move forward on the map only by winning BULLSHIP over another player. If a player loses to a Zombie player, they will instantly become a Zombie and their goal is to convert all other player's into Zombies. (Zombies VS Pirates VS Pirates)
The player who won first place from the original BULLSHIP! starts off closer to treasure island than the other players. (well deserved!)

name: Chip Monks
description:
A fast-paced dice pool building game in which you gather resources and learn recipes so that your chipmunks can brew beer.

You'll use worker placement to gather ingredients, learn recipes, build your dice pool, move around a modular board representing the monastery interior and surround grounds, steal resources, and earn points.

Using the dice pool that you've built, you'll choose up to two actions per round as you try to score the highest point total from brewing different types of beers.
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: ヘイッDJ (Hey DJ)
description:
In this game, players are newbie DJs and begin practice sessions.
We will play a song card one by one in turn, but let's play songs that can be “mixed” with the previous songs as much as possible.
If it breaks somewhere, it will be scored by the person who played the song before that.

You can “mix” a song card that appears in play if you can put out a song with the same genre (color) or theme (icon) from your hand. Even if you cannot mix, be sure to play the card.
If the mix fails, the bunch of cards that have been in play until then will be scored.
The player who gets the score is the last player in the bundle.

Basically, each card is one point, but a card that matches the “My Genre Card” distributed in advance can be counted as two points.
Repeat until the deck is gone and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer (translated)

name: Cavity Calamity
description:
What’s scarier than Halloween for dentists? The appointments during the month of November! To keep things interesting, you and a fellow dentist have a friendly rivalry every year after Halloween. Who can put up the best defense against all these sugary sweets?

Cavity Calamity is a game where you are dentists trying to keep your patients’ teeth clean and send kids with the most sugary candy to your rival at the same time. Whoever has the cleanest teeth wins.

You each have 13 teeth dice that you want to keep clean. Your opponent is trying to send kids to you with Halloween candy in order to rot your teeth. Draft cards and then play them on either the Rot side or Clean side. Try to take advantage of the special abilities on the cards to rot and clean efficiently!

This game is part of a thematically linked trilogy of games. In Sweet Dreams, players are adults trying to give away all their candy first on Halloween. In Trade-or-Treat, players are kids trading the candy they got from trick-or-treating. In Cavity Calamity, players are dentists cleaning the teeth of the kids after Halloween.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Girls Night Out: The Pre-Game
description:
Be the perfect HOST with this hilarious and risqué start to any girls gathering or bachelorette party. Your girls will love you for it. Grab some drinks and get your pre-game on!

Plays up to 6 people
Includes 81 FUNNY question cards
24 response cards
Adults only! (NOT for kids)
Comes in a white box

Girls Night Out is a conversational game. There are two ways to play:

Rotate reading the cards or select one person to read cards for the group. Each player gets voting cards (A, B, C, and D). Everyone votes with their card face down, then reveal. The answer with the majority wins. Players that voted for the majority get a point. Play to a predetermined number or number of rounds.
Use the cards as conversation starters. Read each card and discuss the options. No Voting.


Variations:

Drinking Game(21+): Instead of each player receiving a point for voting for the majority, players that didn't vote for the majority must take a drink. (Please play responsibly)
Reveal: Each player who chose a non-majority answer must reveal an intimate secret about themselves or accept a dare from the other players.
Three Strikes: Choose three non-majority answers and you're out of the game. Last one still in wins.
Gambling: Each player wagers before the hose reads the answer choices for a question. If you can answer the card correctly after the options are read out loud, you win. If you win, you gain all of the points wagered. In the case of a tie, no one wins. If you lose, whoever wins will receive your points.


Example Card:
What's the worst thing that can happen at your wedding?
A. Your ex pops up
B. The groom shows up late
C. The families start fighting
D. Someone spills something on your dress
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: TRACES: Downtown Crime
description:
An electronic buzzer board game that requires deduction and tactical choices.

A heinous assassination shocks downtown city! A relentless hunt begins! 4 Police Officers, all with Different Abilities, are thrown into the Murderer’s Traces! Will they manage to find and arrest the Murderer in the first 24 hours after the crime, or will his trail get cold enough, allowing him to escape?

An asymmetric, cooperative game of deductive thinking & tactical choices, that will make you hold your breath!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Events, Hidden Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: SPIES Operation: Europe
description:
An electronic buzzer Party board game that requires speed, knowledge, wits and deductive thinking!

In SPIES Operation: Europe, players are superspies working for a Secret Intelligence Service. Lately, their Service has managed to intercept encrypted messages from a rival intelligence service, that describe the locations in which important objects are hidden!

Can you decode these messages by quickly understanding the locations they pinpoint? Find the correct European country on the map and swiftly place your pawn on it! If you are clueless, make sure you follow the correct opponent, so that you can steal some of his glory!

Think fast, be quick to show off your amazing knowledge, and win the title of most cosmopolitan Spy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Trivia

name: Cats on a Tower
description:
Playing as one of several cats competing for the affection of The Owner, it’s up to you to become the best cat in the house in this Take That game of simple rules but interesting choices.
Play your cards right to balance your cuteness, your hoard of treats, and your ability to be the highest on the tower when the round suddenly ends!

—description from the designer

The goal of the game is to secure 3 or more victory points. Points are earned in 3 ways when a round ends: being the cutest, being the highest on a large Cat Tower, or by having the most treats. A Can opener card is hidden in the bottom half of the deck, and as soon as it's revealed, the round ends. Unless someone has 3+ Points, a new round starts.

Cards can be played in 3 ways:

Play and apply the effect (usually maneuvering on the tower, influencing players treats, or adding to cuteness at a cost).
Played face down to add 1 to your cuteness.
Discarded to gain 2 treats from the bowl.

name: Rugby Glory
description:
The first collectible & customizable rugby card game, RUGBY GLORY is a fast-paced expandable card game (ECG) with rugby ball dice that covers all the key aspects of your favorite sport in a challenging & exciting format that is fun for ages 10-100.

Rugby Glory is a 2-player (or team) deck-building card game with dice that strikes the balance between luck and strategy, and follows all the laws of rugby union, making it a great tool for players learning the game or coaches looking to improve player understanding of the sport. Run, pass, kick or support your teammates with streamlined gameplay full of interesting choices.

Whether you are a life-long rugby player/fan, someone new to this glorious sport, or a curious board gamer unfamiliar with the game of rugby but looking for challenging table-top fun, RUGBY GLORY has you covered!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Corps Command Campaigns: Campaign Scenarios and Rules for the Age of Napoleon – 3rd Edition
description:
A complete Campaign system for the Napoleonic Wars for Miniatures. Covers the period between 1792 and 1815 with army lists, leader ratings, campaign rules, and a campaign map. Can be used with any Napoleonic Tactical system or with Corps Command 3.0 from HR GAMES. Combine it with Line of Battle, the naval rules, for the complete package.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: With Washington To Glory: Rules for the American Revolution 1776-1783
description:
With Washington To Glory is a complete Tactical system for wargaming the American Revolution. Covers the period from 1775 thru 1784 at the brigade level. Some of the features include:

Allows for a 20,000 man game to be completed in 3-4 hours
Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed
Features HRG’s Terrain Generation system
Follows historical organization and unit capabilities
Includes Battle of Newtown Scenario
Rated Leaders
Point system


—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Corps Command IV: Warfare in the Age of Napoleon
description:
Corps Command 30th Anniversary rallies once more in this enhanced Deluxe Edition! A complete and comprehensive Napoleonic system designed for detail, fast play and the “feel of playing Napoleonics!”

Allows for a 40,000 man game to be completed in 3-4 hours
Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed
All major and minor nation’s Army lists
Features HRG’s Terrain Generation system
Follows historical organization and unit capabilities

Re-fight the struggle for conquest and exploration for the Americas or other parts of the world.
Company level rules designed for 1510-1870 action
Battles resolved within 2-3 hours
Can be used with any scale and no rebasing required
Smallest formation is Company, Section, or Squadron

Allows for a fast framework to create scenarios and play them out in a sitting.

name: Lunomino
description:
Lunomino is a card game where you try to get SIX in a row with suns and moons through playing your domino shaped cards/CARDBOARD right. On the cards, there are castles, (sun- and moon castles) and rainbows. The cards are played by putting half your card on your opponent's moon (or sun) and the other half of the card covering the table. You can't cover your own symbols.

—description from the designer

6 in a row much more fun
still same picture

name: Hidden Galaxy
description:
Hidden Galaxy: First Steps is an upcoming tabletop RPG with an expanded background story. This game has a chapter-based main questline, but it is designed to create an open world sensation by offering the players various ways to play the game;


Explore the main map to find different items, chests or bloodthirsty undeads!
Build your chosen hero by unlocking new abilities and upgrading your weapons & armor.
Enter buildings and explore its rooms.
Enter caves, dungeons and parallel universes filled with treasures and danger!
Hunt down different mini-bosses for their legendary loot!


On your path, you will encounter different merchants and talk to different NPCs with the option to choose what you are going to say next through the customized conversation cards which will often lead you to a challenging quest or a new knowledge card!

Hidden Galaxy: First Steps is made to be fully co-operative, but players have the choice to choose for the dark side. Whenever your soul gets corrupted by the choices you made you will have the opportunity to enter the underworld, alone... fight your way to its core and touch its hearth! This will allow you to gain new abilities which you will need to challenge the Dark Overlord. If you defeat him you will take his place and rule over the undead army! Tease your friends and bring doom and destruction upon their world! However, if you die in this fight, then it's GAME OVER.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Events, Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Traitor Game

name: Fang den Dieb!
description:
One player is the thief, who is pursued by the other players. The thief starts on the red space marked with "Dieb", the pursuers start on the large green space nearby. Movement is determined by a die. The thief gets a head start of two rolls of the die. If the thief gets on a red space, he may use a blue shortcut. The thief wins the game if he gets to the red space outside the town gates. The pursuers win, if one of them gets on the same space the thief is standing on.

—user summary
