name: P The Larger Prime
description:
P The Larger Prime is a card shedding game. The object of the game is to be the first player to ditch all your cards while playing prime numbers.

There are two set of rules, Normal Play and Tournament Play. If you are new to the game it is recommended that you play a few games using the normal rules to get a feel and understanding of the game before you try a tournament game. A Tournament game is not harder than a Normal game. It is just more complex and quickly becomes overwhelming because there are so many more possible plays. It may seem daunting at first but given time and practice it will become easier.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: El Juego de Flash Gordon
description:
Game for two players, which represents the assault on the Mongo Planet by Flash Gordon and his friends. To achieve this, he must fight against Ming and his men, who are the inhabitants of that planet.

Flash Gordon and his allies have to move in their ships through space, and land at the bases of the Mongo Planet, occupying it to try to reach the city.

For their part, Ming and his men have to deploy their forces to prevent Flash Gordon from achieving his purposes. He can also choose to approach the base where your secret ship is hidden, and escape to escape to Earth.

In the course of the game both adversaries fight and capture prisoners, to facilitate the fulfillment of their respective objectives.

—user summary
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Golem Arcana: Götze der Pravega Bonus Card
description:
Bonus Card for Golem Arcana

This ancient idol is Pravega, the faceless daughter of the Old-Venerable Allik, which must flow forever in front of her vengeful father.

Bonus:
If this Relict will be activated, add +4 Movement Points to the selected Golem, but also will loss 15 Healh Points. Discard after use.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Superman: Smallville Promokarte
description: Promo card for Justice League: Hero Dice - Superman. Double-sided for use in either Solo or Team play.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tressa Pympes
description:
There are 3 pieces to this cheeky character,
This makes her one of the simplest games to learn. However, don't be fooled! To win, one must be cunning and calculating.

This step-toothed figurine is designed to be aligned, so that the artwork matches up. Players take turns assembling at their choosing and then take turns at moving the head or the body. As both pieces have different cog notches they can only align on special numerical combinations. The seemingly straight forward nature becomes abundant, without seeing the paths to alignment an infinite game is possible!

The countenance bares resemblance to the prehistoric so-called Venus figurines, or could also be compared to Inca gold. Combined with authentic visage and mechanic rotatability Tressa has landed in the forefront of 21st century design! The etched tittering statuette is ultimately a tactile object: sits twisting ergonomically in the hand, mischievously perches on the desk, laughing about something no-one will ever know. Interestingly the form fits in the golden ratio - the height measuring approximately 1.618 of the width. The parts equally ascend in escalating measurements furthering this mathematic harmony.

The game has 3 steps to the head and 5 to the body. At any moment a player can call "Tressa" and change the lower direction, and the other player calling "Pympes" and changing the upper rotation.

—description from the designer

name: CasTiles and Armies
description:
CasTiles and Armies is meant to be a fast-paced tile-based Castle and Siege strategy game for 2 players. Players will build a castle wall, reinforce it as needed, and attempt to defeat the enemy Monarch with their troops.

CasTiles and Armies consists of 2 phases. The Construction Phase and the Combat Phase.

The Construction Phase:
Starting with Player #1, the players will take turns placing castle tiles (dark grey) to construct their Castle Wall until it is 5-tiles wide. After placing a tile, the player may choose to discard one tile, placing it in a Rubble Heap, and then draw back up to 5 tiles in their hand. The Rubble Heap is a separate mass of tiles which can no longer be brought back into the game.

After the 5th tile is placed, 2 more tiles (a total of 6 additional tiles after the Gatehouse) may be placed in the Army Reserves Zone and/or the Offensive Line Zone. Be considerate of the numbers on the tiles during placement, the numbers all mean something! Once the castle is fully constructed, the final step in this phase is to calculate the strength of the wall. The Gatehouse icons count as wild cards and will conform to the number placed adjacent. We recommend placing dice at each of the 4 wall junctions with values that represent their strength. Dice make it easier to track damage on the castle wall. You will likely need a range of dice from D4s to D20s.

Tile placement is a key consideration! Your strategy during this phase of the game will determine your success as a defender or conquer. Tiles must be placed so they read left to right or top-facing-right (from the player’s perspective). See the possible scenarios below to determine how to calculate the strength. The higher the number, the stronger the wall. Once a tile is down it is down.

The Combat Phase:
With the castle wall now complete and total strength calculated and marked on the playing field, it is now time to start combat!

Each player should still have 5 tiles in their hand. At this time, ALL army tiles (gold-ish) in their hand can be placed in either the Army Reserves Zone or Offensive Line Zone, starting with Player #1. Hopefully, you didn’t discard them all during the last phase. Then discard or draw tiles as needed to keep only 3 tiles in your hand. Like the wall junctions, place a die on the arrow side of the army tile to indicate the strength of the army.

—description from the designer

name: Bilder: The Complex Expansion
description:
This expansions adds more difficult challenges for Bilder.
It consists of 54 new 'WHAT' cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Stock-Car
description:
Every player has 5 tiles with numbers from 2 - 6. On the other side of the tiles you can see a broken car.
The board is a circle with 16 fields, 8 in blue, 8 in red. Each player places his tiles on his half of the racetrack. The numbers are hidden, all tiles are revealed at the same time.
Red starts the game. A car is pulled as many fields as the number indicates. If this field is occupied, the opposing car is beaten and placed with the other side as a blockade on a free field on the racetrack. This field is no longer included in the setting.
It wins who has beaten first all opposing cars.

—user summary

name: Das Bunkerspiel
description:
The players try to get their officer from their bunker to the opposite one. Each player has 8 soldiers (small discs), 2 machine guns (big discs), 1 sergeant (small pawn) and the officer (large pawn). The pieces move and capture like follows:

soldiers: move and capture 1 space straigt or diagonaly forward
machineguns: move and capture over any unoccupied spaces diagonaly in any direction (like a bishop in chess)
officer: moves and capures 1 space in any direction (like a king)
sergeant: moves and captures over any unoccupied spaces in any direction (like a queen)

The first player to get his officer into the enemy bunker wins the game.

—user summary

name: Zombie 15': Potwory w Tokio Promo Cards
description:
Two promo cards for Zombie 15': Amunicja Zapalająca ("Incendiary Ammunition") and Celownik Laserowy ("Laser Sight").

These were included in Polish second edition of King of Tokyo.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Death Derby: A Post-Apocalyptic Card Game
description:
The year is 2200 and survivors of man-made and natural disasters struggle to live in a world poisoned and devastated beyond recognition. The new extreme sport and source of income for many are Death Derby races in which competitors vie to win or just to survive.

Death Derby features random courses formed from 15 track sections, 12 vehicles that can be upgraded with 37 different modifications, and 40 action cards that can influence the outcome in multiple ways.

Be the first to finish the race or the last one standing as you try to out think, out race, and out shoot your opponents. Modify your vehicle into a death machine or speed demon to survive while hampering everyone's efforts with well timed action cards.

Can be played in a group from a single deck or a single modified deck, or you can modify your own to take on someone else's.

One 10-sided die, tokens, and pen and paper are needed to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Track Movement

name: Escape from the Titanic
description:
Temporal agents (historians) from competing academies have traveled back in time to witness the sinking of the Titanic and correct any discrepancies in the historical record. Shortly after arriving, the Titanic's collision with the iceberg shatters their time machines, scattering the components and destroying the time modules. Luckily, the remaining components can be assembled into a Transporter that will allow an agent to leave the ship for ... somewhere else on Earth. Realizing they are trapped in 1912, the temporal agents decide to rescue as many passengers as possible who would otherwise have died - 1,517 people. The effects of such a rescue on the timeline are hard to predict...

Escape from the Titanic is a board game where players attempt to construct a Transporter and rescue as many doomed Titanic passengers and crew as possible. But, they must do so before the ship tilts to 90 degrees and sinks!

The game comes with two expansions already included. The optional components allow players to also collect Titanic artifacts and rescue castaways that were brought to the ship when the temporal agents' time machines were shattered. You will encounter such castaways as Albert Einstein, King George V, and Thomas Edison along with other famous people who were supposed to be on the Titanic but missed the trip such as Milton Hershey and J. P. Morgan.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sniper Legends of Italy
description: 1-3 player WW2 sniper board game! As an American Sniper you'll sneak behind enemy lines, complete objectives and snipe Nazis!
categories: Fighting, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II

name: Coliseum: Choose Your Weapon
description:
Coliseum: Choose Your Weapon is a competitive card game for 2-4 players. Each player assumes the role of a Mighty Gladiator. You must prepare yourself and utilize your impressive skills in combat to defeat equally formidable opponents. All the while you are both bolstered and terrified by the ever-growing tension and excitement of the crowd; baying for blood, and the sweet relief of victory to fill their pockets with gold. You could be their reigning champion, you cannot disappoint them, or it will cost you your reputation… and your life.

When opening the Coliseum box, the player will find a simple to play but complex to master game which is, above all, very intuitive. With Gladiator, Skill and Equipment Cards, you quickly prepare your fighter. Then, the dice and strategy guide the player during combat, which usually ends in slaughter or technical defeat after about fifteen minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: The Marquis
description:
The Marquis is a 1-4 player thematic cooperative stealth game which takes place in 18th century France and which will let you experience the adventures from historical novels in the mysterious town which is hiding its dark underground secrets.

A group of three young aristocrats yearning for revenge come to the gloomy streets of mysterious town Montbeliard.
The players will experience the underworld of aristocracy, full of intrigues, lackeys and traitors and reveal the
hidden mystery of Count Ressequie´s family.

The Marquis is a Stealth game. Light is your enemy, dark and shadow is your friend. Quietly approach the guards while hidden in the shadows, jump out of the dark corner to unarm the enemy, or surprise them with resolute attack by the sabre. Hide into the shadows, climb on the town towers to reach open window, many times the only way how to get into building. Shoot your shiny copper musket from the tower to cover your comrades.
Mysterious black fog coming from the sewers hides monster known as the tongue of Mephistopheles somehow connected with the count's family.

The Main Story Line is uncovering slowly as you play and consists of 12 chapters plus side quests.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Flash: Promokarte
description: Promo card for Justice League: Hero Dice - Flash with german text "Speicherpunkt: Merke dir dein aktuelles Ergebnis. Du darfst es anstelle deines Endergebnisses nutzen.“
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Green Lantern: Promokarte
description: Promo card for Justice League: Hero Dice - Green Lantern with german text "Jedes Parallax zählt als 1 Treffer. Jedes Green Lantern Symbol als -1 Treffer.“
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Codes: World Edition
description:
The "Codes" World edition an be played alone or against each other.
There are different categories which contain tasks made up trough various topics, e.g. Cities, countries and rivers.

Use your creativity, logical thinking, general knowledge and speed to defeat your friends and acquaintances in intellectual competition.

You hve to break "codes" using different methods..

Ideal are large game groups, e.g. School classes, because it can be played at the same time with a large number of people. However it should be played with at least three players.
It can be expanded to any number of players.

The players get read an incomplete term, which they have to decrypt with the help of the turntables.

The codewords are divided into three difficulty levels: 1 point = easy, 2 = medium, 3 = difficult.

Winner is the player who first scores ten or more points.

name: Marapi: Tales from the mountain
description: Marapi is a mountain from Indonesia, known for its mystical aura and many horror stories surrounding it. Players who trapped by the mystical beings that reside there must survive in 7 days to get out of the mountain! Every action that players made have much consequence that may help them or even kill them. Players must survive by cooperating with other players or, sacrificing the others!

name: Counter Sneks
description: The game has the same gameplay as snakes and ladders, but it has spells in it. Players can draw spells card if they land onto a drawing point. Most spell should be used once the players draws it or it will be expired. Some spells can be saved to be used later. The board itself has 225 tiles. Only one winner to be chosen.
mechanics: Action Queue, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Roll n Di(c)e: Last Man Standing Board Game
description:
"Surrender your fate to the RNG Gods."

Roll n Di(c)e is a 2-4 player last man standing game. Your life depends on the dice you roll. The last man alive wins.Get Buff Cards to enhance your gameplay. Debuff Cards to weaken your opponent. Even more ways to win by using Opportunity Cards!

Each player starts with 5 Health Points (HP) and can have up to 7HP. Players can move in any direction they want and take a number of steps by rolling a 6-sided dice during their turn. Each player can attack one another by landing on the same tile. The Attacker can attack by rolling a dice once. The Defender can defend by rolling two dices once and pick the highest number on either dice. The highest number inflicts one damage to their opponent. Use Teleport Tiles to instantly move to another Teleport tile. Use DMZ Tiles when your HP reaches critical, other players can't attack you here. Up to 30 turns each gameplay!

Wanna play tag team with your best bud? TURBO Mode allows you to play as a team of two against another team! Four players, two teams, 20 turns max. Each team shares 5HP. Double the fun with your teammate!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Euromasters
description:
With Euromasters, you will learn everything, in the form of a game, about the value of the euro, but also about countries adopting the euro.
Euromasters, an exciting game of questions and answers that will teach you a lot of things.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Turtle Game
description:
Children’s racing game from 1960 with a magnetic board and turtle that alters the movement direction of the player’s turtle pawns. The first turtle to move off the playing board wins the game.

—user summary

name: Little Space Errands
description:
"There was a time, around year 2000, where several bad sci-fi movies predicted that the Earth would become an uninhabitable wasteland, fact known as “we jumped into the lake”. They also predicted humanity would conquer space, seeking for a better place to leave because, well, what else could we do. Who would have said that the better fortune tellers were in cheap sci-fi movies? Maybe it was just a matter of luck.

When we started to surf among the stars, we were too lazy to collect any garbage. Therefore, the space is now full of that trash. Those were the days; we could afford throwing all kind of things though the spaceship wc.

Now resources are limited. That trash, that we threw away so carelessly, is now the most valuable currency in the space. More than gold, more than any other mineral, now plenty in any rock in the space. No one studies how to make a screw, that’s why they cost so much.

Let’s stop talking. Welcome aboard. You probably know something about us, the Those Little Assignments Co. We travel through the space, jumping into the hyperspace, avoiding threats looking for resources and, who knows, maybe a mighty artifact.

Please go to the sign board. Every day there is a new adventure to live. Well, we really have no “days” in the space, but we still count every 24 hours, just not to get crazy. I hope you enjoy your time here."

Little Space Errands is a game for 1 player, with games of around 20 minutes length. You will face a variety of threats represented by cards, using different resources of your ship and using the dice to get some loot. Current art of the game is provisional and for demonstration purposes only.

—description from the designer

name: Ted the Cat: Was geht?
description:
No matter where Ted the cat goes or stands, Rock the dog is on his heels ... Who will find Ted and will be aible to guess his trail by the number of paws? But watch out, if you meet Rock, everything is over quickly.

—description from the publisher

name: Unfundable
description:
Unfundable is a 5-player card game about the competitive yet collaborative world of academic research. It is played in 3 free-form rounds of negotiation. Players negotiate over the division of resources required to obtain a grant, as well as the division of the resulting rewards.

Players balance short-term collaboration with the long-term need to achieve their secret goal and avoid becoming Unfundable, i.e. having the fewest Papers at the end of the game.

Unfundable was designed as an engagement tool between researchers of various levels, from early-stage college students to postdocs. But it is also a quick, casual game that anyone can enjoy. It requires no background knowledge in research or tabletop gaming.

—description from the designer

name: Embolos
description:
Embolos is a multi-player game of tactical combat between the oar-powered warships of the Greeks, Romans, and other early Mediterranean cultures. The game system is easy to learn yet always challenging.Players may choose to fight evenly matched tournaments, historical scenarios, or battles based solely on their own imagination.

—user summary

name: Dracula's Curse
description:
Dracula's Curse is a 1 vs All social deduction game where players take the roles of Villagers in a town cursed by Dracula's powers. The goal of the game for the villagers is to find who Dracula is and kill him before is too late, while Dracula's goal is to turn all the living villagers into vampires and spread his reign of fear. However, villagers won't have it easy. With each night that passes, a new vampire will emerge among them. Villagers will have to work together to kill Dracula before they get turned into vampires and not be able to kill him.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bad or Worse?
description:
Bad or Worse? is a party game for 4 or more horrible people over 18 who like to choose between horrible choices. Do you want to know how sick you and your friends are and how far would you go when pressed between the sword and the wall? In Bad or Worse? you will face the hardest decisions you would ever have to make, only surmountable by having to choose between the same choices in real life!

Players take turns choosing a Choice Card representng something they would never do. Other players then choose another Choose Card that would make the first player choose between either of them. However, there are action cards that modify how the game flows and make everything different. Player compete to reach a number of victory points equal to twice the number of players, or maybe you could make all the other player feel so offended that they leave...

ATTENTION. This game is NOT for people under 18, people who get offended easily, people with good moral values, people that can't make choices, and for good people in general. It contains sexual themes, mature content, offensive jokes, psychological torture, extremely disgusting scenarios, black humor, illegal hypothetical situations, and things only really horrible people would enjoy.

—description from the publisher

name: Cowboys & Commies
description:
A card game about the Cold War, an era dominated by the rivalries between the USA, their allies, and the USSR - between Cowboys and Commies. An era constantly on the verge of nuclear catastrophe.

Cowboys & Commies is a fast-paced card game for 2-4 players. During your turn you're playing a leader of one of the faction (Cowboys, Commies, Resistance or Dictators) and use their unique abilities to hinder you opponents and accumulate power. Each of the abilities are a reflection of the historical figure you're playing!

Each round is modified with an event. For example Chernobyl Disaster is a very bad news for the Commie cards in the game and the players must play accordingly.
After you win a round, you collect the event and you need 2 to win the entire game!

—description from the designer

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Nightmares in Silver
description:
This expansion adds Cybermen from throughout Doctor Who's history to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes ten Cyberman miniatures to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe, from Doctor Who episodes in: 1966, 1967, 1968, 1975, 1982, 1988, 2006, 2011, and 2013.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Table Dodgeball
description:
Using a portable neoprene mat, players will try tossing small cardboard dodgeballs into each other's rings. Once a ball is tossed into a ring, that player is out. The last team standing wins.

HOW TO PLAY
Each player at the start of the game will select a jersey ring with a nickname on it. That becomes their player piece. Each player will also grab a dodgeball. If a dodgeball thrown from the opposing team enters this jersey ring, it counts as a hit and the player with that ring is out. A hit occurs when the dodgeball completely enters the ring or is leaning inside the ring. If the dodgeball is balancing on top of the ring or leaning outside of it, that counts as a catch. That means the person who threw the ball is out and their jersey ring must be removed from the arena. The person who caught the ball can now have a previously out person come back in for their team. Teams go back and forth throwing until one team is left standing.

HOW TO MOVE
Once you toss your dodgeball, you'll need to pick up another one to throw again. To do this, move your jersey piece to a different section of the arena. There are 4 sections for each side. Each section separated by lines and a pattern of blue and grey. You can move to a section that contains a dodgeball to pick one up again or you can move to a section without a dodgeball and won't pick one up. But you must move every turn You can move once per turn.

HOW TO WIN
The goal of dodgeball is to knock out all the players on the other team.

Welcome to the Table Dodgeball League.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Moving Multiple Units, Team-Based Game

name: Space Warriors: The Quest
description:
Aliens have established a secret base on one of the planets of our solar system and their intentions are without doubt hostile. They are servants of the 'Nameless One' from the doom world at the centre of the Empire of Galactic Darkness, a place totally malevolent to all human life, a place alien even to normal cosmic laws. They must be stopped, our only hope are the Space Warriors.

Earth has received eight reports from the planetary/moon leaders stating they are clear of aliens. One of these reports is wrong. The Space Warriors must blast off from Earth, their mission twofold: The Warriors must, by a process of elimination, find out which report is wrong and discover the hidden alien base; and each Warrior must collect a super weapon from the distant planet Pluto. When a Warrior has the super weapon and knows which report is wrong, they must return to earth to expose the aliens and win the game.

Using dice, Warriors select mission cards to decide their destination. On arrival, they look at the top knowledge card to confirm a report. At any time, a player may break away and land on Pluto to collect a super weapon, while avoiding black holes and Planet Doom.

name: Murder at the Fancy Dress Ball
description: At the fancy dress ball, a murder has occurred and the players try to catch the murderer. Gather information from the other players to find out what the murder was wearing, where the murder occurred, and what the murderer’s motive was.

name: Noah & Sons: Master Ship Builders
description:
Noah & Sons Master Ship Builders is a 60 minute 1-4 player cooperative card driven construction game wherein team Noah must complete building the Ark before the Great Deluge. As this is a card driven game players must move to certain locations and roll on the Construction Chart using multiple cards to maximize their chances. The player team wins when they complete all 15 Construction phases required by the Construction Chart within a time limit. But beware, rats and birds can decrease your food supply. Broken wagons and bridges require repair. Market scarcity, labor disputes, errands, and even the dreaded Nephilim are obstacles to overcome.

—description from the publisher

name: 1st Megiddo: Sisera v Deborah
description:
1st Megiddo: Sisera vs. Deborah is a 2-3 player classic hex wargame. The Canaanites have Iron Chariots and can force the Naphtali-Zebulan Tribes into the Hills. The NZ's are usually forced to wait for rain before coming out of the Hills and fighting the Canaanites for the key city of Jezreel. Fast moving and fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Abraham: Father of Nations
description:
Abraham: Father of Nations is a 1-4 player cooperative card driven game wherein Team Abram must pass various Divine tests, dig wells, increase livestock, & increase wealth all within a time limit. As this is a card driven game players must move to certain locations and roll on the Faith Chart using multiple cards to maximize their chances. The player team wins when they complete all 15 events required by the Faith Chart within a time limit.

—description from the publisher

name: JOSEPH: Integrity & Endurance
description:
Joseph: Integrity & Endurance is a 1-4 player cooperative card driven game wherein Team Joseph must pass numerous Divine tests, interpret dreams, build grain silos, & manage the might of Egypt. As this is a card driven game players must move to certain locations and roll on the Faith Chart using multiple cards to maximize their chances. The player team wins when they complete all 15 events required by the Faith Chart within a time limit.

—description from the publisher

name: Fire Emblem 0: Warblade of Heroes Expansion
description:
In Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher), two players go in a turn-based battle between their Main Characters that are set aside from the Deck. By selecting one card that meets the conditions at the start of the game from within the deck built with at least 50 cards (with no upper limit of cards you may have, save for having more than 4 copies of the same card), they each attempt to defeat the opponent's main character by destroying one of the five "Orbs" serving as their life, and winning when there aren't any more orbs.

Each Series contains 100 different types of cards, with rarities for each card spanning from Normal (N), High Normal (HN), Rare (R) and Super Rare (SR). There is also the guaranteed R+ in each box and the off chance of having an SR+ instead. Prior to Booster Set 5, R+ and SR+ have a metallic gold or silver border around the edge, and some have a special foil signature of the character's voice actor. Starting from Set 5, they also have alternate arts for each card.

The first series features characters from Shadow Dragon and Awakening.

name: Fire Emblem 0: O, Courage! O, Soul Aflame! Expansion
description:
In Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher), two players go in a turn-based battle between their Main Characters that are set aside from the Deck. By selecting one card that meets the conditions at the start of the game from within the deck built with at least 50 cards (with no upper limit of cards you may have, save for having more than 4 copies of the same card), they each attempt to defeat the opponent's main character by destroying one of the five "Orbs" serving as their life, and winning when there aren't any more orbs.

Each Series contains 100 different types of cards, with rarities for each card spanning from Normal (N), High Normal (HN), Rare (R) and Super Rare (SR). There is also the guaranteed R+ in each box and the off chance of having an SR+ instead. Prior to Booster Set 5, R+ and SR+ have a metallic gold or silver border around the edge, and some have a special foil signature of the character's voice actor. Starting from Set 5, they also have alternate arts for each card.

The sixteenth series features characters from The Binding Blade, Echoes: Shadows of Valentia, Radiant Dawn, and Heroes.

description: Most Starter Decks come with one booster pack, with Sets 1 and 2 bringing two booster packs and Sets 7 and 8 not providing any booster packs. Each Starter Deck contains 50 cards, with some exclusive cards that can't be found in a booster box.

categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: The Leopard and the Lilies
description:
Across 15 reigns of the House of Capet your family seeks lands, titles, glory and wealth but faces dangerous rivals, external enemies and the ferocious warriors of Islam and Byzantium.

Each turn is the reign of one king whose major policy/event impinges on that turn. The reigns (conveniently 15 of them) are split into five in the Age of Barons, five in the age of the Crusades, and five in the age of the Cursed Kings. After applying that reigns events (perhaps a Crusade or Poor Harvests) the players each have their turn (based on a cube draw). In each turn they may do one thing based on the Three Orders of medieval life: Laboratores, Bellatores and Oratores (Peasants, Warriors and Priests). Each has advantages and disadvantages. Finally, each Baron may attempt a marriage that will bring fresh fiefs into his family.

The Baron seeks fiefs (his knights), peasants (for his new towns) and titles (many minor barons gained impressive titles in the East) as well as money. But kings seek armies in which you serve at your cost as these can eat your reserves or result in yet further success. Additionally they can invest in cards in suites of Military, Cathedrals, Scholars, Queens, Resources, and Culture. For example, respectively, Simon de Montfort, the Basilica of Cluny, St Bernard of Clairvaux, Blanche of Castile, the Fairs of Lagny, and the “Summa Theologica” of St Thomas Acquinas,

Event cards cause a number of historical events to affect play. Victory is decided based on money, fame, titles held, card suites collected and other items.

—description from the designer

name: Fundamental
description:
Fundamental is a game of ever changing rules. When your turn begins, you will be losing the round under the current rule for the game. You must play a card to your card collection and/or change the current rule for the game in order to make yourself the current winner of the round at the end of your turn. If you fail to do this, you are eliminated from the round.

There are seven rules available in the game. Each rule revolves around a fundamental number or set of numbers in mathematics. The winning player under the current rule will have played the most digits of pi, the most prime numbers, or some other collection of numbers of Fundamental importance.

Multiple rounds are played until a player has won the first 5 digits of a Fundamental number.

Knowledge of mathematics is not needed to play Fundamental, but knowledge of mathematics will be gained by playing Fundamental.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: The Eighth Round
description:
In the distant future competing factions with the capability for time travel have discovered that particular collections of artifacts from the past give them a distinct advantage over their current adversaries. As each faction sends a member to the past in search of valuable artifacts, the time travelers become ensnared in a time loop that repeats seven times. In each iteration of the loop, each of the travelers is able to grow their collection of artifacts more efficiently and measure its effectiveness against their adversaries in preparation for a final showdown when they escape the time loop.

The Eighth Round is a hand-building and trick-taking game where players spend seven rounds skillfully growing a hand of artifacts and testing its effectiveness against the hands of the other players. The game is then decided by the results of The Eighth Round.

—description from the designer

name: とびこめ！さきもの！(Take a Plunge! Futures Trading!)
description:
The players are shrewd speculators. Let's make money in the futures market by using the information you have obtained through special channels. Buy the grains which are likely to rise in value while watching other speculators' moves. Their real values will be revealed only at the time of settlement. The player with the highest capital at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: Mission Mites
description:
The tiniest agents. The most impossible missions. Bravely lead your investigation “mites” into the mysterious Cloak City in this dice and card strategy game!

Mission Mites is a brand new dice and card game that combines a unique challenge of card movement, dice distribution, and token management all into one game...set in a world of complete cartoon mayhem.

Each turn, players lead their kid agents—their “mites”—through Cloak City, using their agent's special mission dice to attempt completing missions. It's a race to finish each one, as your opponent is also working to finish the mission before you do!

Move quickly! Agents who make it to end of your mission lane with a secret vault key gain access to your secret vault card pile, the most powerful cards in the game!

Across just 6 intense turns, the player who gains the most points from their missions, wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management

name: Let's Potty
description:
Let's Potty is the only potty training board game on the market. Designed to play with a parent or older sibling, Let's Potty is a positive and encouraging introduction to the basic concepts of potty training & hygiene.

—description from the publisher

name: Sigil Runner
description:
As the evil wizard Weewathrax awakens from his slumber, his sister Galvathrax's apprentice is ready to stop him from destroying the world!
Sigil Runner is a game for one or two players in which each player must utilize the tiles provided to create a complete magic sigil, which will prevent Weewathrax to wake up once again. Each tile provides a fragment of a magical seal, which must be completed by joining more tiles, but pay attention, as the evil mage can use some tiles to hinder your attempts!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Dolcissima Vita
description:
Background. Starting in the mid-1950s, Italy went through an unprecedented industrial and economic growth that lasted well into the mid-1960s. This period in Italian history is referred to as "Miracolo Economico Italiano" (Italian Economic Miracle) or "Boom Economico Italiano" (Italian Economic Boom).
 
The economy runs at full speed, national income grows and people are employment rates reach new records. The reasons for this growth were the favorable international economic situation and the abundance of labor supply. Exports were also a major stimulus for the development of the country's industrial fabric.
 
These years brought extraordinary transformations that affected the lifestyle and customs of Italians, accompanied by a marked increase in living standards. Numerous consumer goods, such as the first washing machines, the first refrigerators and the first television sets, began to enter the homes of Italian families, forever changing the lives of Italians.
 
In Dolcissima Vita 2-4 players are entrerpreneurs who produce televisions, washing machines and refrigerators and sell them in Italy.
Most actions in the game are carried out by a very clever dice selection system. The sum of dice pips allows players to conduct basic and advanced actions, while dice colors let players advance on four different tracks (Workers, Scientific Research, Maintenance and Solidarity), which have various effects on the course of the game.
 
Dolcissima Vita features 35 colorful Event Cards of Italian history from 1955 to 1968. These cards change the conditions of the game, either permanently or temporarily.
 
Dolcissima Vita is the first volume in Spielworxx´ 'Italian Trilogy', dedicated to Italian history after World War II.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Events, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Resource to Move, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Dit Coin Coin !
description:
Dit Coin Coin ! is a cardgame intended for children and adults at the same time playful and pedagogical since it has as its main objective the learning of the different animal cries.

The game contains 40 cards representing 19 pairs of animals (parent and child), 1 carp and 1 hourglass. The cards are illustrated with coloured sands.

The basic game consist in recognising and associating animals with their noise and/or mime. It can be played individually (pedagogical aim) or by team (competitive aim).

It’s also possible to play Memory or Old Maid with the cards of the game (the carp is the old maid in this case).

—user summary

name: T.A.C.O.S. (Trucker Assassin Cowboys in Outer Space)
description:
You take on the role of a trucker, where you deliver various goods to surrounding planets in the "595" system, all the while secretly assassinating targets and trying to avoid the space police, doing your best to get enough credits to retire.

—description from the designer

name: Xenotactics
description:
Xenotactics is a 28mm tactical sci-fi skirmish game where rival warbands face off on worlds far far away.

The gameplay is centered around meaningful player decisions. Among other things, you'll be making tough choices activating your warband, reacting to enemies during their turn, flanking enemies and deciding when to play it safe and when to take risks.

Xenotactics has no modifiers to calculate, tables to look up or tons of counters to clutter the battlefield. A mission lasts under an hour so you can finish a short campaign in an evening. Or play best out of three if you have a competitive craving. As warbands only number a few miniatures they're quick to paint and prepare for battle.

The game is not associated with any specific line of models, instead you use whatever models you like best or happen to own thanks to the character creation rules. This allows you to create balanced statlines with for miniatures from almost any sci-fi miniature range. A warband usually numbers about 10 miniatures.

You can read the rules online on the games webpage. A pdf ruleset is also available which expands the game with campaign rules.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Auditions: The Game
description:
Have you been waiting your whole life for your moment in the spotlight? Well the wait is over!
​
Auditions: The Fun Party game for everyone to enjoy!

Auditions is a brand new fun party game that finds you and your friends presented with two decks of cards 'ROLE' cards and 'SCENE' cards.

Take it in turns to pick a card from both decks and perform them both together using everything you've got- except your voice.

Get through as many as you can in 60 seconds.

ROLE Cards: Celebrities, Animals & Characters

SCENE Cards: Random acts to perform

Completely modern, super up to date and designed to make everyone laugh. With 550 cards in a game who knows what combination you will get?

How about Beyonce eating a hot chilli?
T-Rex doing a inflight safety demonstration?
Harry Potter slipping on a banana peel?
The Hulk walking through a cobweb?
or even Naomi Campbell walking into a lamp post?

Hilariously fast paced, fun for everyone and never the same game no matter how many times you play.

Auditions is bound to get a call back everytime!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Rise And Fight Again: Over Bunker Hill – The American Revolutionary War Game
description:
Rise and Fight Again - the American Revolutionary Wargame is a fast-paced, easy to play game where the Psychological effect of warfare is strongly reflected throughout the game and the rule mechanics.

Command and Control and AWI tactics are firmly rooted in the game. Whilst National Characteristics shape how each nation fights.

Players can use all the modern figure scales available e.g. 6 mm, 10 mm, 15 mm and 28 mm; The game also accommodates numerous model to actual men ratios, with no re-basing required.

The turn sequence makes sure that in Rise and Fight Again your enemy cannot move swiftly across the battlefield and then pour vollies into the ranks of your army that is waiting idly by. In Rise and Fight Again one side moves and then the other fires. This breaks up the classic I go; you go turn sequence in a subtle way. In simple terms the turn sequence is as follows: Side A checks command and moves Side B Fires Side A and B Fight Combats The turn sequence is then repeated with Side B moving and side A firing.

Ring-Bound and Durable.
83 Pages - Including tables, diagrams, colour photographs and army lists.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Dawn's Early Light
description:
On June 1, 1812, President James Madison sent a message to Congress recounting American grievances against Great Britain, though not specifically calling for a declaration of war. The House of Representatives then deliberated for four days behind before voting in favor of the first declaration of war. The Senate concurred in the declaration and the conflict began formally on June 18, 1812, when Madison signed the measure into law and proclaimed it the next day. The war would wage until the Senate approved the Treaty of Ghent on February 17, 1815.

Dawn's Early Light tasks two players to recreate this pivotal war in American, British and Canadian history. As the United States, you will be be tempted to invade Canada while also maintaining the country's honor on the high seas. As the British and Canadians, you will be tasked with keeping the upstart Americans in check.

Dawn's Early Light is a low complexity, card driven game for two players (with solitaire rules). Players relive the decisions and dilemmas of this crucial period in history. Fast setup and a playtime of 45-75 minutes.

—description from the designer

name: Plus+Minus-
description:
Plus+Minus- helps young children practice basic counting and quantity comparison skills, and older children can improve their existing skills as well!

Every player starts with five cards depicting various images that they'll try to match to a face-up card in the middle of the table. However, before they do that, they'll role the die to see whether they'll need to find a match that either adds, subtracts, or equals the symbols on the shared card.

—description from the publisher

name: Mangaka: Decadent Heart
description: Bring an elegant new dimension to your Mangaka games with this mini-expansion containing 3 new Trend Cards & 9 new Theme Cards! Create comic stories of wealth & luxury with "Decadence," celebrate the holidays with "Seasonal," & upend the game with "Inspiration"! Plus 9 new Themes including Steampunk, Desserts & Nosebleeds!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Generation Lite
description:
Welcome to the center of the universe! in this deck-building game, you’ll play a stylish alien called a “Rising Star” and take on your friends! Prove yourself to the Goddess of the universe! Collect legendary items from all over the universe and CRUSH your enemies to gain Volume Points. The player who makes the most noise by having the most Volume Points wins the game!

Generation Lite is a deck-building game where players will move their "Rising Stars" all over a portable board and draft Items into their personal deck called a "Backpack." It's not as simply as picking up a card; players will have to move strategically around the board to get the items they want!

Items will be used by Rising Stars to attack other players, gain more powerful items and do other actions in order to win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Zone of Control

name: Alien Wars: Gravity promo
description:
A promo (15 cards) distributed by the publisher at various conventions.

Rules:
A card can never recover another card neither can it be separated by more than half an inch from another card. During the game, if a card or a group of cards strays more than half an inch from the main group –for example, after a card is eliminated– scoot the marooned card or group within a half inch of the main group before continuing to play.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Science Fiction

name: BrainBox: Myths & Monsters
description: Do you know the legend of the founding of Rome? Have you ever met the horrible Jellyfish known from Greek mythology? BrainBox Myths & Beasts are great brain training and fun for one or more players! Record as much information as you can about the scene on the drawn card within 10 seconds, then roll the cube and answer the discarded question correctly. But don't waste your time, because the hourglass will quickly peel off your eyes! You can check the answers on the card. If you are a good observer and know the animals, most cards land on you!
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Traffic Cop
description:
Simply set out the crosswalk mats to build the intersection and then let the Traffic Cop direct everyone with the spinner.
This game includes a Traffic Cop vest, 36 Crosswalk mats, and 27 Yield cards. The Traffic Cop spins to determine your next movie and yield cards add extra fun to the game.
Try to cross the intersection safely! With Traffic Cop, you can make your own customized playing area with the included foam mats. Play with 2 to 6 players ages 5 years old and up.

—description from the publisher

name: BrainBox Bounce: Animals
description:
BrainBox Bounce is a brand new BrainBox with a twist.

In this game, all players pick a card at the same time, study the front until the youngest player shouts 'Stop!' and then pass the card to the next player. Play is then 'bounced' from player to player as they take it in turns to answer question 1 on their card. Any incorrectly answered cards must be placed in a pile, then each player in turn must answer question 2, and so on, until only one player remains, who collects all the cards from that round. If there is a tie, cards are shared out as far as possible. The winner is the player with the most cards at the end of the game.

Bounce Bonus is a Spot the Difference game.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Junkerdrome: Televised Vehicular Deathsport
description:
Junkerdrome is a game of auto combat in a dystopian future. You build a vehicle and fight it out with other drivers in a televised deathsport. Wastelanders and offworlders alike live vicariously through your struggles in the arena. They want your blood for entertainment. You just want to make it big.

Junkerdrome takes its game play inspiration from several other games of car combat. It uses d6s for play, and features: a streamlined system for vehicle construction, strategic character creation, and quick-to-learn game play.

The game primarily features arena dueling or racetrack games, but campaign play is also supported and has much potential for enjoyment.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bronze Eagles: Wargaming Rules for the Age of the Caesars
description:
A set of simple miniatures wargaming rules for the Imperial Roman period.

Scales:
1 figure equals 20 troops
1 mounted figure equals 5 cavalry or their equivalent troop type.
1 move equals approximately 10 minutes real time.
1 inch equals approximately 20 yards.

name: Bronzed Heroes: Or My Spear is bigger than Yours!
description:
This is a set of beer-and-pretzels miniature skirmish rules for Classical Greece. The rules are short on weapons minutiae and long, relatively speaking, on intimidating your enemy with your superior manliness.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Cute Animals on Fire: Super Art Fight's Party Game of Drawing Destruction
description:
Based on the equally ridiculous Super Art Fight live show, this hilarious party game for artists of all skill levels has players create drawings based upon classic Art Fight topics like MASHUP SUPER HEROES, AWKWARD TEEN MONSTERS, or MAJESTIC FACIAL HAIR.

The Ref chooses a topic. Everyone else draws that topic. They present the results, and the Ref chooses a winner.

So do your best to out-think and out-draw your opponents, but be prepared... it's gonna get stupid.

—description from the designer

name: Blank It
description:
Blank It is a fill-in-the-blank game that presents you with incomplete comedic "poems." Players must decide which word cards on the table best fit in the blanks of poems in categories like “Roses Are Red” and “Haiku.” How racy the poems get depends on the crowd you’re playing with, and how they view words like “balls” and “pork"!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The trouble with men: the game that exposes male behaviour!
description:
This game poses classic sexist questions and asks you to predict the results.
What annoys you most about men..?
That they are selfish?
That they are lazy?
That they are unable to do more than one thing at a time?
Well this game is designed to put men on the spot to show them in their true colours and shame them into changing their ways.
Whatever happens it will reveal the dark conniving condescending crude and sexist side of the male character.

—description from the back of the box

name: Trivia for kids
description:
1800 questions on art,science, tv, movies, history, famous people, super heroes, comics and music.

—description from the side of the box

name: Give us a  break:  radio 1's popular quiz game
description:
Give us a break contains 392 cards in 7 packs and a white die. There are three packs of red questions, the remaining four packs contain the other 6 colours. Red questions are easiest and score 1 point if correctly answered. The scores for the other cards are yellow 2 green 3 brown 4 blue 5 pink 6 and black 7.
Place the cards questions up in seven piles corresponding to their colours Players may read the questions on the top card of any pack at any time but must not remove the card from its pack to read the answers.
To start all the players roll the die and the highest roller goes first. He must play a red card followed by a colour of his choice followed by another red card etc and can continue playing until he gets a question wrong. With each turn, the rules of snooker apply ie. after playing and answering correctly questions on 15 red cards and the following card of his choice the player must then answer one question each from yellow green brown blue pink and black packet in that order.
Before playing a card of the colour chosen the player rolls the die which determines which question on the card he must attempt to answer. The person on the players right checks the answer and places the card question up on the bottom of the pack. The person on the players left keeps the players score. When the player fails to answer a question correctly play passes to the left. The first player to finish his turn with an exact score of 147 is the winner if after his final score turn a players score totals over 147 he must retire.

—description from the back of the box
publishers: BBC Enterprises, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Forfitz
description:
The ultimate game of dares with sticky notes and sticky situations.
Why ultimate because you make them up as you go along. You can be as kind funny wicked sly sarcastic or rude as you like
It's simple land on an empty space and you get to write a forfit, and a points value on a sticky and attach it to that space.
Buuut land on a space with a sticky note on it and you have to do exactly what the note says to collect the sticky note and the points
Refuse to do the forfeit or fail and a sticky note goes to the centre where everyone has a chance to grab it.

—description from the back of the box

name: SUMMONED: The Devil Inside Edition – Curse Ability Deck "Demons Advantage"
description:
Extension Curse Ability Deck for SUMMONED: The Devil Inside

Players will use this deck to give players during their Demon turn special abilities. These Abilities will help Demon players put the Victim players at a disadvantage.

name: Finding Dory: Wo seid ihr?
description:
Help Dorie find her friends. They are under
hiding big, colorful shells. Whoever is first to track down all five friends, wins. But watch out for the whirlpools, because these are dangerous for Dory and finish your search for now.
The goal of the game is to be the first to bring in the five friends (Nemo, Marlin, Bailey, Destiny and Hank) under the colorful shells.
How to play:
Roll the color-dice and swim with Dory to a shell with the same color. Turn the shell and see what friend it is. You have two options. Option 1: You take the exposed shell and put it for everyone Player visible in front of you. You replace the missing shell with a new one from the stock. This ends your turn and it"s the next player's turn.
Option 2: You leave the shell exposed and try the same to find another friend. Again you roll and swim with Dorie to a shell of the color and turn it around. Is there a different friend than before? Luck! Now you can put both friends in front of you. You replace the two shells by two new ones from the stack. If you want, you can do both leave the shells and continue to roll the dice. It"s up to you,how many times you want to roll the dice. Attention: If you face the same friend twice, your turn ends immediately and you go with nothing this round. If you have a friend twice or more, you can change it with another player. Winner is the first to have all five friends.

name: Classic Western Standoff
description:
Make alliances, destroy your foes, and claim victory over the Old West in Standoff

This 2 to 6 player, “Take-That”, light deck building game, is super simple to learn, yet strategically deep in play, And it offers over 1700 game deck combinations.

Each turn a player will simply build their hand, Discard what they don’t want, And lastly choose an action. Actions can be: Attack, Preforming a Double tap, Pull out a surprise Specialty Card, Or simply Standoff.

When trouble comes your way, thats when you can pull out some of those Defence Cards you’ve been saving up to foil their plan. But don’t coward in the corner waiting for trouble to pass by, because before you know it, you’ll be out.

This game is full of bluffing, social strategies, card ratio counting and will always be changing because of those dreaded Specialty cards in each game. Are you ready to duel?
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation
mechanics: Alliances, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Track Movement

name: Székely Aktív
description:
The aim of the teams is to correctly guess a word that is being drawn, explained, or mimed by a player. The game tries to introduce players to the colourful word of the Székely dialect of the Hungarian language.

—user summary

name: Code Crackers: The Enigma
description:
The year is 1942, and World War 2 rages on. You are the head of an elite team of cryptanalysts tasked with breaking the infamous Enigma code. But you're not the only one working towards this goal. It seems that rival teams are trying to decipher it as well - and only one can gain the fame and recognition that comes with deciphering this near impossible cipher. It seems the fate of the war rests on your shoulders.

You better get crackin'.

Objective:
Players work on a combined code with a maximum of 100 points. The game ends when the point value reaches 100, and the winner is whoever has contributed the most.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Number, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Take That, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Colo-Rolo
description:
A dexterity dice game of color matching - one player rolls the dice, and all players rush to be the first to grab those tokens that match the color combinations rolled.

—user summary

name: Soragoto
description:
In 空諺 (Soragoto) players mix and match the first and second halves of Japanese proverbs to conjure up new wisdom. For example, "The shrimp is mightier than the sword."

Each round one player will lead with a card and other players will build off it to create new proverbs. After every other player has created a proverb, the starting player picks their favorite and the player who made it collects the cards as points.

At the end of the game the player with the largest collection of selected proverbs wins, but even the losers go home wiser.

—user summary

name: Return To Sender: The Mail Game
description:
Also styled as “Return To Sender” The Mail Game and The New Post Office Game!

This appears to be a reasonably straightforward 'roll and move' style game - or more accurately 'spin and move' since a spinner is provided with the game - it is assembled in the centre of the board itself. It contains a fold out board, instructions, and playing pieces in (at least) five colours - one for each player. It is themed on the delivery of mail through the US postal service.

Players each start their letter tokens on the "Sender - start here" space on the outermost coil of the spiral, and move around a spiral course of 61 spaces, until reaching one of the blue "Mail delivered - game won" space. Unusually, the innermost coil of the spiral contains five of these winning spaces (interspersed with hazard spaces), and there is one more winning space at the end of the second coil. There are two kinds of hazard spaces (yellow = lose a turn; red = go back), as well as green 'do nothing' spaces, and further blue spaces on which nothing happens when landed upon, but which serve as location markers for some of the 'go back' hazards.

The box states "A Thomas Game - manufactured by American Game & Dice manufacturing Co., Cleveland, Ohio", and the rules leaflet says "A Thomas Game, 4191 Weymouth Road, Medina, Ohio, 44256-9247".

—user summary

name: Carbonfighters
description:
Carbonfighters is a resource management racing board game for 2-6 players simulating a five Grand Prix formula racing season during which you constantly develope your racecar and pitcrew while competing to be the champion by winning the most GPs.

Grands Prix take place on five different modular tracks made up from hexa tiles. As the season evolves tracks become more and more complex. There are two kinds of resources: tyres and fuel. You spend them according to the racetrack tiles you move onto and the development state of your vehicle. You need to pick a driver too who’s resource saving abilities you fancy.

At the beginning of each Grand Prix you choose from two strategies. According to your decision movement cards are dealt to you with movement points on them to move forward on the track. Your strategy decides if you can use higher or lower numbered movement cards.

Qualifying determines the starting order of the players’ cars. A Grand Prix consists of rounds until someone reaches the final tile. Each round consists of the following steps:

Choosing a card or using the slipstream card.
Spending resources
Resolving action situation when cars are in front
Announcing pit stops to refill your resources and activate driver abilities


After the Grand Prix is finished medals are given to the first three players. All players get also victory points according to how many tiles they have reached. These are for developing your car and/or pitcrew before the next Grand Prix.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Race, Simulation, Track Movement, Variable Phase Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 6つの祭壇 (The Six Sacred Altars)
description:
6つの祭壇 (Muttsu no saidan) The Six Sacred Altars is a Japanese game for two players. During the game, players play cards to the table, trying to control the total value in play. The deck contains number cards and action cards which affect the results.

Each player is dealt 6 cards to their hand. They then take turns to either play a card face up or discard a card (drawing a new card from the deck each time), or discard all six cards and redraw.

Once six cards have been played, the round ends and the total worked out from the cards on the table.

If the total is equal or over 10, the start player (attacker) scores 2 points. Otherwise, the second player (defender) scores 1 point. The players now swap roles of attack and defence and continue.

The first player to win a 2 point margin wins the match.
user summary

A Card game, two players compete changing offense and defense on each round. Each player plays a card from hand alternately. Once six cards has played, a winner will be chosen according to the sum the numbers on them. The action cards will be the key to victory!
It's a compact but full-of-compete-feeling game.

攻守交代しながら戦うカードゲームです。
手札を交互に出し6枚目が並んだ時点の場の合計値で勝敗決定します。
アクションカードが、場を揺るがす勝敗の鍵に！
コンパクトながらしっかり、バトルしてる感を味わえます✨
publisher's summary

name: You Don't Know Me!
description:
This addictively entertaining game is an excellent conversation starter and a great way to muse over your life experiences, relive forgotten memories and humorously revisit your youth! You Don’t Know Me! will revolutionize your social get-togethers forever! This multi-generational game makes sharing YOU--your interests, your likes and dislikes, and your life experiences--with your friends and family exciting and fun! Learn to know the people in your life in a way you never thought possible! With over 500 questions to choose from You Don’t Know Me! probes into the depths of each player and breaks down the walls of conversation to find out exactly who does know you! You Don’t Know Me! is a must-have addition to any game collection--perfect for game nights, family reunions, holidays, teachers, ice-breakers, slumber parties, co-worker functions, or couples outings!

—description from publisher

name: Das grosse Schweizer Hüttenspiel
description:
A Mountain Adventure in the Swiss Mountains. It's a funy Dice Game about the huts in the Swiss Alps.

—user summary

Ein Bergabenteuer in den Schweizer Alpen. Spannendes Würfelspiel für zwei bis sechs berg- und hüttenbegeisterte Spielerinnen und Spieler ab acht Jahren. Wer schafft es am schnellsten, in jeder der sechs Bergregionen seine Hütte zu besuchen? Neben guter Ausrüstungsplanung und dem nötigen Wetter- und Würfelglück ist richtiges Verhalten im Gebirge und in den Hütten hilfreich, um das Abenteuer gut zu bestehen. Dazu erfährt man viel Interessantes über die einmalig gelegenen Hütten des Schweizer Alpen-Clubs und Privathütten in den Schweizer Alpen. In brenzligen Situationen greift auch der Rega-Helikopter ins Geschehen ein. Viel Spass auf der grossen Hüttentour!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Hail the King: F'r evil shall cometh
description:
A fierce two-player card game to save the kingdom of Samavia from an imminent evil that has risen to ravage and claim all.

STORY:
It revolves around the medieval times where a heinous and wicked creature has risen.

The old prophets of Samavia have foreseen this crisis and reckon that a battle between many Guilds or Houses of the kingdom must take place to find the One that will face, fight, lead and hopefully triumph over the beast(s).

HOW TO PLAY:

Choose one of the houses
First player draws 3 cards while the second draws 4 cards
Choose a location or the enemy to conquer - Press your luck with dices - strategize using the cards and give yourself an edge.
Resolve the battle and place your token on the territory
Win by conquering 3 territory

name: ブラウメア (BLAUMARE)
description:
ブラウメア (Buraumea) BLAUMARE is a Japanese co-operative word game.

Mito is trapped in her bad dream. To escape from it, she must gather images of the reality by asking herself how the reality looks like. But the nightmare might be showing her false images to misdirect her.

In the game of BLAUMARE, players divided into two forces. One player is the nightmare who try to misdirect opponents. The others represent one girl named Mito who is trying to escape from her dream. Mito's side wins if they successfully make three pairs of cards of different symbols.

At the beginning of the game, players are secretly assigned their roles. One player is the nightmare, and the others are Mito. Each player is dealt a certain number of image cards and one clue card. Such as 'number', 'color', etc. is written in clue cards. If you have 'number' clue card, you may only ask about numbers, such as "is the reality related to six?"

When you try to make a pair, you try to find another player who has the identical image of reality (namely, who has the identical card as one of yours). First, you ask everyone else what the reality is related, complying with your clue card. Other players say "Yes" or "No". Then you target a player who said "Yes". Both you and that player place the card which they think is identical with each other face-down.

In a later turn, you may reveal the two cards. If these are identical, Mito's side takes the pair which can count toward victory. Otherwise the nightmare takes these two cards.

Mito's side wins when they successfully make three pairs of cards with different symbols. The nightmare wins when they have taken three pairs of cards with different symbols or six cards with the same symbol, or when the image deck runs out.

As the nightmare, you should try to misdirect Mito's side indicating that you have the right image, even if you don't have. But you shouldn't be obvious.
user summary

「手がかり」カードに記載された種類の「質問」だけで「記憶」カードのペアを作ります。
３つペアができればミトは無事に夢から抜け出して青いおうちに帰ることができます。
ただし、ミトの帰りを邪魔するナイトメアに気をつけながら…。

正体隠匿系でありながらワード系であり、ワイワイ楽しみながらプレイできるゲームになっています。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Communication Limits, Hidden Roles, Pattern Building, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: サマータイムメモリー (SUMMER TIME MEMORY)
description:
サマータイムメモリー (Sama- Taimu Memori-) SUMMER TIME MEMORY is a memory game with card-specific effects. Its theme is enjoying summer vacation.

At the beginning of the game, ten cards are placed on the table face-down.

During your turn, you draw a card from the top of the draw pile. If the card has special effect, you may reveal the card to activate the effect. Otherwise place it on the table face-down.

Then you reveal two cards on the table. If these cards match, you take them and score victory points. Repeat the process until you reveal different cards.

The game ends when three cards "お", "わ", and "り", which form the word "おわり (end)", are revealed, or when the draw pile is depleted. The highest scorer wins the game.
user summary

テーマは夏の日の宝探し。
シンプルだけど奥深い神経衰弱をカスタムしてスーパー神経衰弱に！！
効果を使いこなして優位に立とう！
publisher's summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Pattern Recognition, Sudden Death Ending

name: BannerWar
description:
Tabletop wargame for mass battles, historical or fantasy. The 2 versions of the rule share the same principles for orders, combat and fire.

3 levels: from tactical to strategical.

Standard : ~13 units / ~1h
Epic : ~30 units / 2h
Legend: ~50 units / 3h

BannerWar is a fluid and balanced system. It incorporates combat and fire resolution suitable for tactical battles.
On a strategical level, the rules add orders and deployment principles.
It takes into account a wide variety of troops while keeping the rules simple.
Its army lists offer real options on a tactical as well as on a strategical level.
Faster than most, it does not require more figures than other rulesets.

—user summary

BannerWar comprend une version de règles Historique et une version Fantastique. Les deux versions utilisent les mêmes mécaniques de jeu pour les ordres, les combats et les tirs, cependant la version historique est plus détaillée sur la formation des armées, les manoeuvres stratégiques et la psychologie ; alors que la version fantastique est plus accentuée sur la diversité et l'originalité avec quelques règles spéciales qui donnent beaucoup de caractère aux unités.

La version historique offre des champs de bataille variés et très agréables, qui rendent les parties fortement stratégiques. Elle apporte la possibilité de garder des troupes en réserve, en renfort, en embuscade ou de les mettre en avant garde ou arrière garde. Cette version est accés sur le réalisme grâce aux règles d'ardeur et de résistance. Les unités se déplacent et combattent de manière historique sans être noyées de règles spéciales.

La version fantastique est allégée sur la stratégie des terrains et des corps d'armée. Les contraintes de déplacement et certaines phases de jeu sont moins détaillées pour faire place à des règles sur les Monstres, les Créatures Volantes, les unités mythiques, les Héros et la Magie.

Bien entendu comme le système de jeu est commun, il est tout à fait possible (et même recommandé à terme) de jouer la totalité des règles de BannerWar. Cela ne rend pas les parties bien plus longues ni moins fuides; et cela permet d'avoir un jeu historique ou fantastique d'un grand réalisme avec une diversité de troupes trés élevée qui se joue autant sur la partie tactique que stratégique.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: エクスフルーツ (EXCLUSIVE FRUIT)
description:
エクスフルーツ (Ekusu Furu-tsu) EXLUSIVE FRUIT is a card game with a theme of exploration for fruits.

A rumor says that there are three islands in the distant ocean, where secret fruits grow. You try to collect fruits in these islands, but only one can enter each of these islands at a time.

Each player has four cards in their hand: three fruit cards (Red, Green, Blue) and pass.

Each round, three victory point cards are placed on the table face-up, attached to each island. Then players simultaneously play one card from their hand. For each island, if only one player played fruit card of that color, that player gain the victory point card attached to the island. If more than one player played the same island, no players gain the victory point card. If any player plays pass, that player gains two points.

After the sixth round, each player adds up their victory points, and conditional victory points awarded. The highest scorer wins the game.
user summary

３つある絶海の島にはそれぞれに秘密の果実が採れるという噂。
島の入り口は一つだけのため、同じ島に向かうプレイヤーは一人だけ…
他のプレイヤーと被らないように島を選びながら高得点を狙うバッティングゲームです。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: キャリーピース (CARRYPIECE)
description:
キャリーピース (Kyari- Pi-su) CARRYPIECE is a game for children, in which you learn one-digit addition and carrying.

Each turn, you draw two cards from the deck and add up these numbers. Advance your pawn a number of spots equal to the ones digit of the total. You win the game if your pawn landed on the goal spot. You lose the game of your pawn passed through the goal spot.

This game has an advanced game mode.

Rules are simple enough for children, but adults can enjoy the game. Suitable for your children's first board game.
user summary

キャリーピースは１ケタの足し算と繰り上げを学びながら遊べる、低年齢向け知育ゲームです。
シンプルなルールで大人も楽しめる「計算すごろく」になっています。
親子で遊んだり、こどもだけでも遊べる手軽さなので、はじめてのボードゲームにご活用ください。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Aetherium: Wardens of Tianran Core Collective
description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. They are the guardians of that path.

Core Collectives are the fundamental building blocks for an immediate, game-ready Collective. Each Core Collective contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This set contains 10 models including: The Eternal (Avatar), Seneschal (Function), Unspoken (Function), Tengur Blades (Subroutine 3), Unbound (Subroutine 4), 5 Data Cards, 5 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This set contains 11 models including: The Elementress (Avatar), Temple Guardian (Function), The Immeasurable One (Omni 50mm base), Jade Spears (Subroutine 5), Condemned (Subroutine 3), 5 Data Cards, 5 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. They are the guardians of that path.

Auxiliary Sets contain 1 Avatar, 1 Function, and 1 Subroutine and are designed to supplement your favorite Collective with new and extraordinary strategic options. Each Box Set includes both PAD and Data cards for all programs.

This set contains 7 models including: The Ascendant (Avatar- Omni 50mm base), Recurrent (Function), Astraels (Subroutine 5), 3 Data Cards, 3 PAD Cards.

The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. 48-page full color rulebook includes details of the mysterious Wardens origins, 3 new Operations, description and rules for all 13 programs in the faction, as well as all faction specific rules.

—description from the publisher
