mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: God Fodder: A Mint Tin Skirmish
description:
A fast furious game of facing off with an Elder God! Can you stay sane long enough to win?
Welcome to a time of Gods and Gangsters.
God Fodder is a fast fun Mint Tin Skirmish game for 1-4 players. With 5 characters to choose from with differing abilities, you face off against an Elder God! Each battle will take place in a location with different artifacts (Physical, Magic, Sanity) you can attempt to get to use against the Elder God.

Be careful though, if you lose your mind, you are no longer in control of your fate and may damage the Elder God, Damage your allies, or even heal the Elder God. You might even just gain some of your sanity back! Grab your buddies, get a change of underwear ready and take on God Fodder!

—description from the publisher

name: Beat Street
description:
Beat Street is a board game based on the break dancing craze during the late 1970s to the mid 1980's. As players land on squares, each one has a value and a specific dance move. The player hopes to get a result higher than that number, if not they can attempt to physically attempting that move to get "Beat Street Credits". There are territories on the board, should you advance into another dancer's territory and not beat a move you go to detention or to jail.

—description from the designer

name: Kryptogram
description:
Kryptogram is a TableTop word game where you race to spell 4-letter words.
It is a roll & write game where the placement of your letters is more important than the words you spell.

Unlike traditional word games; Kryptogram plays fast, as players race to get the high score each round.

name: Greif zu!
description:
The playing figures are placed in the middle of the table, one less than players are playing. Each player gets a hand of cards, again according to the number of players.

The players take turns, giving cards to their neighbor to the left. If a player has collected 4 cards of the same number he may toss them on the table and cry "Greif zu!". Now all players try to grab one of the figures. The player who doesn't get one loses a wooden stick. If a player loses all his sticks he is eliminated from the game. Now two last turns are played to determine the first and second winner (the first players to toss a set of 4 cards).

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Das Gritzner-Nähmaschinen Spiel
description:
The players start on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder of benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monster Hunter Hunting Card: Fang Rage Expansion
description: Monster Hunter Hunting Card is a trading card game based on the Monster Hunter video game franchise. In it, players compete to fulfill quests by hunting specific monsters using teams of hunters and other resources at their disposal. The first player to reach 2000 Guild Points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Squadron Commander: Small Naval Actions 1700-1830 – 2nd Edition
description:
Squadron Commander' is designed specifically to play with the 10mm Crew miniatures from Capitan Games, and the Gunboats & Ships made by Laser Dream Works for Capitan Games.

The main elements of the game are the gunboats and ships, along with their crews.

Gunboat, our original Napoleonic small naval action rule set, has grown and, with this second edition, has become Squadron Commander in an updated form. The game has been re-scaled for a better playability and is supported by a whole range of miniature crews and ships that are available in 10mm scale.

With this re-scaling, players will be able to play on a smaller game table with smaller gunboats or on, a larger table, with cutters, brigs of war, sloops, corvettes, frigates, Xebecs, and much more. Also in this 2nd edition we have introduced two new kits from the great “Hearts of Oak” Ships of the Line a 4th rate (50 & 64 gun) and a 3rd rate (74 & 80 gun).

We are investigating the introduction of 2nd and 1st rate vessels later, together with a merchant or “Indiaman” vessel. As a result of these moves, we have made a small adjustment to the rules.

With these changes, the rules have been expanded and cover all ship types and there is a full set of ship characteristics and crew charts ready to play straight from the book. By including the great “Ships of the Line” and Frigates, players will be able to recreate the famous frigate actions of the Napoleonic wars, with Privateers or take the role of a captain of the Royal Navy, like Lord Cochrane on HMS Imperieuse, the French Privateer, Surcouf, with Le Confiance, Stephen Decatur who fought against the Barbary pirates or Spanish Captain Barcelo and his gunboats attacking Gibraltar… all this using a single rule set… action on the high seas, coastal landings, shore actions, cutting-out operations… plenty of enjoyment and history in one book…

As a tactical game, Gunboat – Squadron Commander is designed to be played with a few ships per side, but ships which provide a strong visual experience as well as quick exciting game play, Squadron Commander is a new concept in naval games, emphasising the individual action of ships and crews rather than those of fleets.

—description from publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Company Commander: Tactical Napoleonic Rules Company & Squadron Level Actions
description:
Company Commander is set in the XVIII & the first half of the XIX century. During this period there were many great battles with large armies and thousands of men but there were also many smaller actions where the use of a musket, ability in fencing, riding skills, personal courage and charisma were decisive.

Company Commander rules are designed for games between small units of men such as reconnaissance patrols, convoy escorts, intelligence missions, border attacks, and other missions which were given to small groups of selected troops. The actions of small groups of soldiers and the direct commands of their officers are the most important aspects of play. The system simulates the frantic rhythm of an encounter. The “human factors” of individual initiative, speed and leadership are worth more than the grand tactics of larger battles.

The rules are designed to use with 15/18mm figures. Figures can be based individually or in groups. But other scales as 28mm could be used.

For command figures, standard bearers, musicians and officers, one figure equals one man. In all other cases one figure represents three soldiers. 8-12 figures represent a section and three sections represent a company.

Each game turn represents about 3 minutes of time.

Ground scale is 1:100.

During 6 years the game has been developed with the suggestions of many players, clubs and hours of gaming.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Trireme Commander: Ancient Naval Tactical Combat Wargame Rules
description:
Trireme Commander is a game of tactical naval combat, focused on the simulation of combat between small fleets of galleys, rather than great naval engagements.

The objective of the simulation is combat between a few galleys in situations such as combat patrol, merchant escort, counter-piracy actions, and pirate assaults, etc. A game is best played with two to four galleys per player.

—description from the publisher

name: Marlburian Commander: Tactical Wargames Rules for the Marlburian Wars
description:
Marlburian Commander is an adaptation of Napoleonic rules Divisional Commander, the tactics of Marlborough era develop the Seven Years War tactics and later on the Napoleonic’s.

In this years the linear formations and rigidity of the units were the rule in the battlefield, but wars develop very quick the tactics and strategy, in this case the Spanish Succession War develop this linear tactics to more flexible formations, to gain in firepower and control.

The art of Command formations in the battle was developed too in this war from a rather informal chain of command to a more developed chain of command and staff as the war goes on.

Included Army list for all the Major Nations of the era.

—description from publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Proelium: Wargaming rules for 3000BC to 1901AD
description:
This is the latest set of wargaming rules from Hordes of Models and Buckets of Dice. The rules facilitate phalanx, warband, company to regimental level games from 3000BC to 1901AD with a focus on command and control. Larger games can be played depending of the scale and size of the table available. The design philosophy of the rule set provides a simple approach that can be used to play wargame battles, irrespective of the figure scale (6mm, 10mm, 15mm, 25mm and even 1/32 scale). These rules have been designed to provide the player with challenges based around the manoeuvre and the management of their army in an easy format while still maintaining a feel for the specific period being played. The rules use a number of bases, depending on the size of formations. These are then grouped into distinct command groups. A formation has between two, four or six bases to represent the different formation sizes. The bases are placed side by side to represent a line, skirmish line or a column/block deployment. A base can have any number of figures on it according to the players preference or current basing arrangement. To represent scouting or skirmish formations, the formation bases are spaced out in a line, with each base having a gap equal to one base width. I personally, use blank bases to show clear formation definition. Artillery formations are based slightly different. They are always on a single square base of two base widths wide to two base widths deep, always counting as a standard size formation. When playing with scales of 6mm – 28mm, a base size of 60mm x 60mm is used, although the equally popular 40mm wide bases could be used instead. For a scale greater than this, bases of 100mm x 100mm are used. This is the base size I use for my 54mm games. The rules use a measurement of one base width equal to one range/movement distance measurement. The rules have been designed to provide capability options for each base. These bases are then grouped into formations. Each formation cannot complete all of the traditional actions/phases (shooting, moving, charging and reforming etc.) during a turn, with a specific formation. Each formation has two action points per turn. The players then decide which combination of actions to complete. The players complete all actions on a specific formation alternatively. This makes the style of play more of a conversion, keeping players engaged through the whole game. The framework used in the game looks at the different formations capabilities compared to that of compatible enemy formations in period. Or put more simply: “Was the specific formation any better or worse on the battlefield compared to their opponents, for the period?”. This enables the player to apply their own knowledge of the historic period to represent the way they believe a specific type of formation would have performed.

—description from publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Pike and Shot, Post-Napoleonic, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Gunpowder Period: Quick Play Wargames Rules 1560AD - 1885AD
description:
Gunpowder Period: Quick play wargames rules for 1560AD - 1885AD

The design philosophy of the Gunpowder rules provides a simple approach that can be used to play wargame battles at brigade or higher command levels, irrespective of the figure scale (6mm, 10mm, 15mm, 25mm and even 1/32 scale) with your own current models and common basing formats currently in use. There are many very good rule sets aimed at a specific period in the hobby which provide a detailed simulation of warfare in that period. These rules have been designed to provide the player with challenges based around the manoeuvre and the management of their units in a quick play format while still maintaining a feel for the period. An army within the game is typically 20 units as side broken down into distinct command groups. A unit is a single base. The rules use 100mm equal to one range/movement unit and a unit has a footprint of 120mm wide by 30mm – 80mm depth depending the formation and unit type. The rules have been designed to provide capability options at the unit level, while still presenting the dilemma to the player that they cannot complete all the traditional phases (shooting, moving, charging and reforming) during a turn with that specific unit. These rules instead of using a traditional system of very distinct detailed weapon factors and micro-managed movement rates, they provide a game framework that looks at the different unit’s capabilities compared to that of the unit’s opponents for the period. This enables the player to apply their own knowledge of the historic period to represent the way a specific unit should perform with in the game. The rules also do not use the IGUGO turn approach, but instead each action, (reform, charge, move and shoot) can be done in any sequence and up to twice in a turn. This keeps both players engaged throughout a turn sequence. A unit has a limit of two actions in any turn. The players take it in turns to complete these actions by unit. Also, the rules do not focus on detailed weapon factors and actions within a specific game turn time frame, but use the approach: “Was the specific unit any better or worse on the battlefield for the period?” For example, all units could have used volley fire, but was this specific unit any better/worse at than anyone else? The rules manage this through a unit being given a selection of capabilities. The rules make a difference between the plug and socket bayonets. This is handled by the unit completing a distinct action to counting them fitted. This means when a plug bayonet is fitted, the unit cannot shoot. This formation is called “Foot cavalry defence”. This also covers the use the of foot squares as an anti-cavalry defence. The rules have to make a comprise and when a unit is claiming “foot cavalry defence” they also count as a deep formation even when a unit is in line with bayonets fitted. All units break at the same point, regardless of if the unit is veteran, regular or militia. What is managed within the rule set is how quickly or slowly a unit reaches that point of failure. Generals are used for command and control only. Units must be organised into command groups. An army for the game is organised into a number of these command groups with an overall army commander. Generals can only command units within their group and the army commander can command any units across all command groups. Typically, a command group is a brigade, division or corps depending on the scale you have adopted for the army. Games can be played over a two-hour time limit with a scoring system based around the number of units that one side has managed to kill. The rules reward aggressive play; thus, hopefully avoiding a static game. For a specific historical battle use the objectives of the actual battle to decide the winner. These rules cover the period from the end of the dominance of the Swiss Keil to the end of The Mahdist Wars in the Sudan.

—description from publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Night Fire board game
description:
Don’t just the thought of forest fires scare you?

Most wildfires are caused by careless humans and putting them out is hard. Imagine what happens when a mischief-maker like Kirik Veera knowingly sets fires to forests? Enter Kutty and his team of forest Rangers, out there to save the forest and its wildlife. They will do all it takes to put out those fires before they cause much harm. They are also always keeping an eye on Kirik, trying to put an end to his mean ways by sending him behind bars.

Night Fire is a battle of wits between Kirik and Kutty’s team. Kirik knows the forest inside out and how to make off in an instant. Kutty’s team is ever ready with their copters, fire trucks, jeeps and other gizmos to fight fires. And this means we have plenty of action in waiting!

This game is a tribute to these brave men who guard and protect our forests. It has been designed incorporating various elements of this cat and mouse game between the Rangers and the Brigands

A board game for four players, Night Fire will make you think, plan and act with lightning reflexes. It calls for excellent teamwork from the side playing Rangers and high survival skills for the player who stands in for Kirik. A game loaded with high drama and suspense till the end, right from the word go. Win or lose, fun and excitement guaranteed!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move, Team-Based Game

name: Rainbow Ralph
description:
Join Rainbow Ralph on this roller coaster ride of fun! Spin him around and around until he gets dizzy. With a bit of luck, he’ll get sick. If he “Ralphs” on your turn, collect the string. The first player to collect 3 piles of string wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Feed Ze Troll: Jeton Massue
description:
This new club token replaces at the beginning of the game one of the two decoys. The troll standing on the cave tile with this token revealed picks an additional apple.
This promo comes with the corrected version of two tiles.

name: The Peninsular War: Paper Soldiers for Wellington's War in Spain
description:
The Peninsular War - Paper Soldiers for Wellington's War in Spain.

The second title in The Paperboys on Campaign series, some 46 pages of artwork enabling you to make French, British, Portuguese, Spanish, and several other countries’ troops which fought for and against the Iron Duke in his epic campaign against Napoleon’s forces.

—description from the publisher

Rules are available on the publisher website

name: オムそばすけっと (Omusobasket)
description:
オムそばすけっと (Omusobasket) is a set of cards with ingredients on them that you combine to make food in four different games.

In the base game there's a card in the middle to start, and on your turn you play a card from your hand so that the middle card and your card can be used to make a food item. So if the middle is "tomato" you could play "bread" to make pizza, and then the next person could play "curry" to make nan and curry. You go on this way until someone runs out of cards. An important rule is that you can't just invent some kind of food on the spot, you have to use an existing well-known dish.

The other games use the same principle of making food out of ingredients. In "Cooking Poker" the hands are based on combinations of food, so for example a "straight" is where you use all your five cards to make a course meal and can explain the order the courses are served in. In "Indian Food Cooking Poker" you play with your hand visible only to the other players, and "Tanuki Soba" is like Old Maid.

What food will you come up with?

—user summary

name: Le Kriegspiel Napoléon
description:
Le Kriegspiel Napoléon is a miniatures simulation of combats during the French First Empire, at the Grand Tactical level.

Sequence of play is semi-alternate:
player A moves while player B can do limited reactions

Brigade / Division level
distance unit or hexagon = 150 m
turn= 20 min
Miniatures: 6 to 28mm
Compatible with other rules basing standards
Army list: 16 armies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Hitm!Sal
description:
A tactical soccer game on a 21x17 board.

Soccer in a different way.

Two teams of 5 players (pawns) and a ball (cylinder). Markers for scoring, possession and hits.

Players play a soccer match, trying to score goals and defend during an agreed amount of time. Players have two actions per turn. An action can be either run/shortrun, hit or counthit.
Every square on the board is one meter.

Running can be in a maximum of 3 meters in every direction, changing direction 45 degrees once if desired.
Hitting shoots the ball a maximum of 4 meters sideways of forward (diagonal or straight.
Counthit is passing for a maximum of 5 passes.

Intercepting the bal is also possible. So is dribbling.

No dice/luck involved, just thinking and planning.

name: Micro Martians
description:
Micro Martians is a pocket-sized tile drafting game about building a colony on Mars.

Players compete to provide the most benefit to the colony by building modules depicting a variety of resource symbols.

To start the game, 32 double-sided tiles are shaken up and scattered on the playing surface.

Each turn, a player may gather a resource, or spend resources to build one of the available modules.

When one player can no longer complete an action, the game ends, and players score based on how many kinds of symbols they collected, as well as collecting the most symbols of each kind.

The game officially supports 2-3 players, but is manageable with up to 5, and as a solitaire puzzle, wherein the player(s) try to place all of the modules before the resources become deadlocked.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Kosmonaut ärgere dich nicht: Wettflug zum Mond
description:
Translated into English as 'Cosmonaut, does not annoy you - race to the moon' This space theme roll and move dice game has players travel a path from earth to the moon with space stations along the way.

Certain spaces on the board help the player while other spaces hinder their progress to the moon. First player to get to the moon is the winner

The game was a supplement to the book "Cosmonauts Primer" by Horst Hoffmann, The Children's Book Publisher Berlin, 1964. Publisher: Der Kinderbuchverlag Berlin (Germany)

—user summary

name: The Battle of Trafalgar 1805
description:
In the first of a potential new series Florian Richter presents colour profile models of every ship on both sides in this epic battle. In a change to previous paper soldier titles, these ships can be cut straight out of the book to create the British, French and Spanish fleets.

IGOUGO sequence,
during each turn:

Maneuvre phase
Combat phase
Boarding phase

name: Vortex
description:
A deep space mission to study an imploding star has met disaster and now the science team and ship's crew face the threat of a forming blackhole. 1 - 6 players can choose to play as either a competitive scientists trying to claim the new discoveries for yourself or as cooperative crew members struggling to survive together. Or you can try to survive alone in solitaire play. Begin your journey trapped in the gravity pull of the vortex. Once free you must reach the rescue ship before becoming permanently trapped in vortex. Game features randomly assigned characters, each with a unique ability, and a dwindling oxygen supply for an added level of difficulty. Players decide the overall difficulty level of the game; from Novice to Madness.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Indépendance !
description:
Simple rule set to simulate the battles of the American War of Independence 1776-1781.

Sequence of play:
Alternative

Moral tests resolution
Movements inc. charges and counter-charges
Fires are declared, then resolved
Mêlées


Scale:
- Brigade level
- 1 mini ~ 20 men
- 1cm = 10m

Rules published in Vae Victis Hors Serie N°1 "Armées Miniatures", in French
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Im Fluge um die Erde
description:
Game 1 (Middle Europe)
Each player gest a flight plan card and has to get his plane from indivated starting point to destination point. Movement is determined with two dice. Between some cities a unlucky number is indicated in the game board. If a player rolls this number with one of his dice while passing this point, he has to undertake an emergency landing and is eliminated from the game.
The first player to arrive at his destination wins the game.

Game 2 (World)
Each player hast to follow 1 of 6 flight plans, determined by the roll of a die. Movement is determined by two dice. If one die shows the number of ones flight plan, the plane is moved according to the second die. If a plane gets on a black dot, it iss lost and the player is eliminated from the game. The first player to arrive at his destination wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: "Stern mit Biene"-Spiel
description:
The players start on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder of benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trade Secret
description:
This is a strategy game about strategy. Trade Secret will challenge your foresight, decision-making, and competitive spirit. It is designed for the seasoned game-lover, continuously learning leader, and business student alike. There is more than one way to learn something by playing this game. All of the strategies in this game are real and promote best practices in Organization Development. Read each strategy description as you introduce new strategies to the game.

Imagine you are the CEO of your new start-up, a strategy guru, ready create the direction for your organization. Your industry is complex and changing. Just last year, the biggest player in the industry unexpectedly collapsed. The first order of business is to gain awareness about your Management, Environment, Communications, Innovation, and Culture. These are five of the most important influences on strategy.

The game itself mirrors a common strategic planning exercise in the business world: the SWOT Analysis. SWOT stands for Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats and the exercise is designed to increase your awareness of your internal and external environment. A good SWOT Analysis then takes the following critical step. You must take that newfound awareness and implement useful strategies for your organization.

But beware, no competitive advantage lasts forever—Except the ability to adapt. Welcome to the world of business psychology and strategic planning.

May the best strategies win!

—description from the designer

name: Wise Up!
description:
The game is provided as an 11" x 17" magazine centerfold. All instructions and the playing board are provided on the centerfold; a required six-sided die is not included. Players form two opposing teams with at least two players per team recommended. The two teams assume the function of the Biblical wise men, traveling from their home to Bethlehem and gathering gifts along the way.

Play alternates between the teams, with each rolling and moving the rolled number of squares. Squares have game instructions for completion. Many squares incorporate 6 separate actions, one of which is randomly selected by die roll. Most game instructions direct some type of trivia exercise, based in Biblical or Christian knowledge of the birth of Jesus Christ and, especially, the visiting wise men. Successful completion of the trivia activity yields a gift for the team.

The first team to acquire all the needed gifts and then complete the journey to Bethlehem wins the game.

The game is published in the New Era magazine, a publication of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, primarily directed at youth ages 12 to about 18. Print and PDF copies are available.

—user summary
publishers: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

name: Color Addict: Édition 10e anniversaire
description:
Discover the anniversary edition of the classic Color Addict game!

Even more color cards, red glasses to annoy your opponents ...

Get rid of your cards as quickly as possible by superimposing the words, the colors, the two or the opposite ...

Not to mention the beautiful red glasses, which will change your vision of life (and cards), but especially make you look a bit ridiculous (to distract your opponents ...)!

If you already own the classic version of Color Addict, you can combine the games to play even longer and / or with even more players!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Découvrez l'édition anniversaire du classique Color Addict !

Encore plus de cartes couleurs, des lunettes rouges pour embêter vos adversaires…

Débarrassez-vous de vos cartes le plus vite possible en superposant les mots, les couleurs, les deux ou l’inverse…

Sans oublier les superbes lunettes rouges, qui vont changer votre vision de la vie (et des cartes), mais surtout vous donner un air un peu ridicule (pour déconcentrer vos adversaires...)!

Si vous possédez déjà la version classique de Color Addict, vous pouvez combiner les jeux pour jouer encore plus longtemps et/ou avec encore plus de joueurs!

—description from the publisher

name: Kinderlieder-Memo
description:
This game comes with 72 memory cards and a CD and you. An Play it in two main game modes:


Normal memo-game
Using the CD you can play a reaction game. Play the CD in shuffle-mode. Then grab the associated tile of the song as fast as possible.


On top of that the rulebook holds all texts from the 36 children songs to sing them along the instrumentals on the CD.

—user summary

Diese Kinderlieder-Memo ist ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Gedächtnisspiel für die ganze Familie.

Wer findet die meisten Paare? Und wer errät die Kinderlieder, die auf den Memo-Karten dargestellt sind?

Im Begleitheft sind Texte aller 36 Kinderlieder aufgeführt - zum Mitsingen zur beiliegenden CD.

—description from the publisher

A card game inspired by a detective drama of the Showa era.

The player becomes one of the "five unique detectives" and investigates the case by allocating 24 hours each. Five cases are set at the same time, and a five-row, plot-type auction is held. Scores will be given to the 1st and 2nd place "in the time allotted" for each case. Do this for 3 hands.

Detectives work together to investigate the case, but often go to stand, play to seek credit, or settle with the culprit. As a result, you may get deeply involved in the incident and get seriously injured or you may be killed!　Moreover, even if you get a line of duty, the game is not over, and if you can get a line of duty at a good show, you can earn a high score. Produce your own line of duty scene well and decide "What's this !!!!"

The basis of the game is a "5-row, plot-type auction".　A total of 24 common cards will be given to the player as a hand, and one card will be placed in each of the five cases, for a total of five cards. After placing, reveal the cards, and after seeing the result, arrange the remaining 5 sheets in the same way and judge by the total value. Therefore, it is important to avoid competition as much as possible and get more cases efficiently, because it is possible to guess to some extent who wants which case with the first placement.

Then, shouldn't it be better to hide the information by arranging as few numbers as possible for the first placement? Of course, that's one strategy. However, if the numbers are the same, there is a rule that the one with the larger number placed on the first sheet wins, so it is not always advantageous to arrange the smaller numbers.　In addition, each person has a ticket called hero time, and you can win regardless of the number unless the heroes spend time fighting with each other. Where to use this hero time is also important.

name: the dead: SHOOT 2 SURVIVE
description:
the dead: SHOOT 2 SURVIVE is a Japanese horror game, following up the designer's previous game 'the dead: beloved one'.

Shaun and Edo are childhood friends, and wish to become famous U-Tube stars! They love posting hot dog eating live feeds, video games, and boring videos. Today, they were having trouble shooting a video in the garage of Shaun's grandpa's house. (By the way, how long can you withstand a bunch of live crayfish in your body?) But that has nothing to do with this story. Instead, everyday life had collapsed due to a sudden zombie pandemic. The dead resurrected and ate the living. The army and police could not keep up, and the zombie population continued to expand day by day. The threat has arrived in the country town where Shaun and Edo live.

As the evacuation activities proceeded, the two thought, "Now is our chance to become top U-Tubers? Let's film a zombie and upload it!" A fool is a big deal in a small town. Thus, the two idiots headed to the city center full of zombies. Shaun packed Grandpa’s keepsake revolver and ammunition in his backpack, as well as a smart phone and a lot of donuts. In this way, two stupid people began to stream an endless battle with the zombie pandemic to the world. "Share zombie videos with the world and become famous! I'm getting out of this shabby town!"

Achieve a total of 1 million likes (acquire all 8 Like cards) to clear the game. The game is over when the threat level reaches 20 or the barricade durability reaches 0 in any location.

A cooperative zombie defense game, balance the life of your four barriers against the need to shoot and film the attacking zombies. Internet fame awaits!

ショーンとエドは幼馴染。
動画配信サイトU-Tubeで有名になってやろうと、ホットドッグの大食いやら
ビデオゲームの実況配信やらつまらないネタ動画を投稿する日々を送っている。
その日も2人はショーンのおじいちゃんの家のガレージで動画の撮影にいそしんでいた。
ちなみに内容は生きたザリガニのハサミを身体中に付けてどれだけ耐えられるか？
というものだったのだが、それは今回の話に全く関係がない。

そんな代わり映えのしない日常が崩れた。
突然のゾンビパンデミック。
死者が蘇り生者を喰らう。
軍や警察の対応も追いつかず、その勢力は日に日に拡大を続けていった。
その脅威はついにショーンとエドの住む田舎町にも。
避難活動が進む中、2人はこう考えた。
『今ってトップU-Tuberになるチャンスなんじゃね？ゾンビ撮ってアップしようぜ！』
バカもここまでくると大したものである。
かくして、おバカな2人はゾンビで溢れる街の中心地へと向かった。
ショーンはじいちゃんの形見のリボルバーと弾薬をリュックに詰め、エドはスマートフォンと大量のドーナツを手に。

こうして雑居ビルに立てこもりつつゾンビパンデミックを世界に向けて配信する、
というバカ2人の終わりなき闘いが始まった。
『ゾンビ動画を世界に配信して有名になってやる！ このしょぼくれた町を出るんだ！』
非対称な能力を持つプレーヤー同士で協力し、ゾンビパンデミックを世界に向けて配信しろ！
ゾンビは無限に迫って来るぞ、バリケードを修理し、頭を撃ち抜け！
ただ立てこもっていても有名にはなれない、動画を配信するんだ！
​100万いいねをゲットして有名U-Tuberを目指せ！
publisher's summary
publishers: Latent Mellon Games (ラテント・メロン・ゲームズ)

name: Victory
description:
This wartime jump and move game has the objective of players to move men across an open field past enemy guards and into an opposing fort.

5 Guards sit along a row in front of their fort. Opposition players can move and jump over the man in front (like checkers) to proceed towards the opposing fort but must follow a line connecting the next space.

When the enemy men enter the lines of the fortification the guards attempt to eliminate and remove them by jumping over them.

Whoever gets the highest number of men into the enemy's fort wins the game.

The national Archives of Australia cites registration of a design by Evan Joseph Roy Simpson for Parlour game entitled The Victory V Game in 1941

—user summary

name: Bones & Banners
description:
Bones & Banners is a fantasy field battle game played with dice and cards. Each player commands their own army deck of unit cards that are used to defend allied lands and conquer enemy lands to be victorious. Players can also hire advisors and construct practical buildings to better their odds in winning the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: Renegade Legion: Reinforcements
description:
Includes new ships stats! Updates on the TOG, the Commonwealth, and the KessRith Empire!
Over 50 4-color Ships & Tanks!

Adds 2 scenarios and 12 Ship variants for INTERCEPTOR
Adds 2 scenarios and 10 Grav Tanks variants for CENTURION
Adds 2 scenarios and 7 Ship variants for LEVIATHAN

—description from the publisher

name: Battle Toons: The House Of Jive
description:
In the city of Kokomo, the ruffian know as “The Jazz Man” has opened up a shady casino called The House Of Jive. The residential toons of Kokomo aren’t too happy about this and try to get the casino shut down. They however do not succeed as The Jazz Man is protected with the magic of “The Great Kokkino” and the might and insanity of “Jack De Lune”. Our heroes “Vega O’ Dar”, “Darla Dwolf”, and “Coyote Pete” have been alerted by The Jazz Man’s actions and are teaming up with YOU to stop him and get his casino shut down! With the magic of The Great Kokkino, he is holding all of these other toon’s against their will and are being forced to fight and protect the casino. Will you defeat The Jazz Man? Or will you succumb to his game?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Lose a Turn, Market, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Double Ditto: Expansion Pack
description: Features 300 brand new cards and a new scoresheet.

name: A Luminous Flame in The Darkness
description:
A Luminous Flame in The Darkness (LFID) is innovative Board Game for sharing and learning. The LFID is Homemade Integrated Design. It is also suitable for a solo game at home. The player can share and learn about ethic, goodness, moral, and core cultures while they adventure and explore with many experiences on the map of a community. Some happenings tend to be worse. How do they live? How do they make a decision? or How do they take an action?

Each Player can create Core Culture and a story together, including modify rules. In the game, the player may see a picture emerge of inter-relationships with multiple factors that are connected, such as causes that lead to multiple degenerations or the existence of individual forces against outer contexts. Preservation and recovery of life is more difficult than destruction. Creativity, life, people and the maintenance are essential for the existence of a core culture. The environment is not for the individual to exploit, but for all lives to enjoy. This game simulates incidents happening in a world of fantasy in which virtue and ethics are crucial to the survival of humanity. Each player will be able to perceive an overall concept of the core culture which they created together in the game.

Note : In case of using for eduacional game, an experienced adult or parent is required to teach and guide.


BACKGROUND :
I graduated in Ph.D. of Arts and Culture Research from the Faculty of Fine Arts of Srinakarinwirot University in Bangkok, Thailand. My research of Green Culture for Ethics Through Documentary Films, found out the issues of many problems and wide ranging effects, including the realisation that the relationship between natures and ethics are complementary in both the individual and public contexts. The complimentary nature of living in accordance with an ecological system leads to a balance between the physical and subjective, the concrete and the abstract, human behaviour and the mind which can be seen as the foundation of ethics for peaceful and sustainable mutual living.

A Game Story :
After humanity has destroyed nature and the environment in many areas, some of the areas have been restored and rejuvenated. Nevertheless, many people turn to violence to hurt and destroy each other for fame and wealth, focusing on dominating the land which causes many problems and adverse living conditions. People have lost trust for each other : no faithfulness exists. They have lived in unsafe place and lead insecure lives. At the same time that pollution has dominated and deterioration also spreads widely into several areas. In one remote district, a city that was once full of happiness, many things have began to change. However, the last thing that still keeps faith and hope and that will not be destroyed so easily, the GOODNESS OF PEOPLE

OBJECTIVE
All players help most members in their community to stay away from evil power before most terrible things appear. They try to cultivate goodness and ethics in the land of loss before the darkness comes. At the end of game, all players consider successful future and present outcomes together.

GENRE
Fantasy game,
Solo Game,
Co-operative game,
Strategic game,
and Educational game

COMPONENTS
1. 16 Miniatures / 16 Character Markers
2. 3 Draw Bags
3. 12 Intelligence Dice
4. 12 Conscience Dice
5. 6 Open-Mind Dice
6. 8 Sincerity Dice
7. 12 Tolerance/Endurance Dice
8. 12 Evil Dominance Dice
9. 2 Protection Dice
10. 20 Moral Cards (5 Principles)
11. 47 Happening Cards
12. 4 Ending Cards
13. 6 Random Quality Cards
14. 76 Encounter Cards
15. 6 Item Cards
16. 15 Special Person Cards
17. 11 Monster Cards
18. 1 Devil Card
19. 5 Mechanical Move Cards
20. 59 Person Tokens
21. 89 Merit Tokens
22. 224. Virtue Tokens / Strength Tokens
23. 156 Evil Tokens
24. 36 Dice Modification Tokens
25. 20 Time Interval Markers
26. 20 Friendship Markers
27. 40 Round Sequence Markers
28. 12 Obstacle Markers
29. 8 Fire Markers
30. 82 State Markers
31. 30 Relationship Markers
32. 28 Internal Drive Markers
33. 4 Storage Marker
34. 7 Monster Markers
35. 59 Person Indicators
36. 24 Place Indicators
37. 4 Mind Quality Boards
38. 4 Characteristic Board
39. 1 Investigation Board
40. 1 Game Board
41. 1 Rule Book

WARNING : This is not a toy. Not for use by children under age of 4 years old. The game contains small parts that can be swallowed.

—description from the designer

name: Cryptic
description:
Cryptic is a party game whereby you create a rule to guide other people in the game through a series of cards with quotes and images on them. Players simultaneously receive a rule and path of cards, give a rule and path of cards, as well as try to deduce the rules on other's paths.

A word of warning, one must take caution with your choice of rule. It must be obvious enough to guide someone correctly through the path of cards, but cryptic enough to not be easily guessed by onlookers...

—description from the designer

name: Hit the Moon
description:
The game is a variation of the Tailless Donkey where players take turns in trying to stick a rocket on the moon.

Players select a rocket which has a sticky adhesive on the tip and places a cardboard space mask on. After a couple turns the players tries to stick the rocket on a thick paper chart with a large central moon.

If successful they win a prize

The chart has other planets such as Mercury, Venus, Mars, Saturn, Jupiter and Pluto and sticking your rocket on these requires the player to act out or make a strange sound.

—user summary

name: Bejinx: Crazed Coopeition Booster Pack
description:
Bejinx Crazed Coopertition Booster Pack is not meant to be paired with a game by itself. This booster pack is meant to be combined with the Bejinx Basic Deck.

This booster pack expands the base deck by adding more cards to change your current favorite games.

name: Bejinx: Whale Surfer Booster Pack
description:
Bejinx Whale Surfer Booster Pack is not meant to be paired with a game by itself. This booster pack is meant to be combined with the Bejinx Basic Deck.

This booster pack adds new and more cards to expand the base deck to play with your favorite games.

name: Monomyth
description:
Monomyth, the Hero's journey. A fantastic adventure where a group of adventurers will seek to face fantastic beasts that are recognized as the greatest heroes in history. A deck building game where we will be building our future fighting together (or not) against everything that faces us.

The game consist in players that choose their Champions for a great variety. Each one has it's owns skills an abilities. Each on has a set of initial deck of movements (Protection and attacking).

Minimum 3 players. The Setup is made buy two others decks of cards (enemies and situations/places). On the player turns, 1 Monster card and 1 situation/places card is Show. The cards show the enemies's handicap, the initial deck that this one has, and the situation/place will make a Stronger or a weaker enemy.

The player in the turn decide to offer to others players that someone joins him in this particular adventure sharing the prizes that the enemy offers (Victory points and treasures).

The negotiation begins and only one player could join him. The other one Will act as the Enemy, moving it by him.

The winner will be the player that hits an amount of Victory Points previously defined.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: くさったバナナ (Kusatta Banana)
description:
The trick-taking game くさったバナナ (Kusatta Banana), roughly translated as "Rotten Banana", was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Autumn 2019 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット５ (Trick Taking Set 5).

In くさったバナナ, players will stack a series of wooden banana tokens in front of them in a line, and their score at the end of the game will be the largest line of non-rotten banana tokens, counting from the bottom of the line.

At the start of the game, each player receives a few non-rotten banana tokens and one rotten banana token, and may order them in any order they like. When a player wins a trick, they collect the top-most banana token from each other player that played a banana card, and add them in an order of their choosing to the bottom of their line of tokens. The deck consists of mostly banana cards, but also a few leaf cards.

The rules also allow for a player with no remaining tokens to collect tokens from another player.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Sock Ninjas
description:
A ninja-powered card game where you steal, sabotage, and sock-block your friends!

The game is simple: steal the most socks to win.

Draw cards and attack opponents UNLESS they SOCK-BLOCK you with a counter card.

Balance your chakra to unleash overpowering hidden techniques on unsuspecting victims.

Sound easy? It is. If you got family or friends that love to fight, direct that energy into a uniquely competitive battle over socks.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trading

name: Halcon
description:
Halcon is typical roll and move board game.
Players are flying over an authentic and detailed map of the Iberian Peninsula, over all the countries and provinces that form country of the same. They fly over their cities, their villages, their rivers and their seas, their mountains, their plains, their ports and their islands. Playing this new game, the Iberian geography is reviewed with pleasure.

In this fun game there are 12 planes of 4 different colors, 3 planes with the Spanish colors, 3 with the Portuguese colors, 3 with the Moroccan colors and 3 with the Andorra colors. All these planes have to go around the Iberian Peninsula, strictly following the marked circuit and return to the base aerodrome from which they had left at the beginning of the game.

The player (country), who comeback to his aerodrome first - wins the game.

—user summary

name: Arise: The First Colony
description:
You are galactic colonists who have crash landed on your destined planet. You must work together to survive, rebuild and defend against the aggressive aliens hellbent on your demise.

Thrive is a 1-6 player cooperative game that is a 1 to 2 hour immersive experience. Each player takes on the roll of a crew member venturing out to the planet to complete tactical missions, and rebuild the colony. You will feel the tension as you race against time to keep your colony safe and provide your crew food and resources

The game is broken into various Seasons. Each Season is comprised of a Mission Phase and a Colony Phase

Thrive really feels like a race against time. Threats increase as moral erodes. Food runs low as the number of alien activity increases. You really feel like you're working to protect and build up your fledgling colony, on the verge of a breakthrough or total defeat.

During Mission Phases players choose a mission together. Every mission will provide different opportunities to gather resources and complete objectives to score victory points. Victory points represent your ability to eliminate the aliens, and secure your territory. They can also represent your ability to study and understand them enabling you to live alongside them or even communicate with them!

The goal of winning the game is to earn 15 victory points. Simple. But, in order to do this you must survive the threats and perils of this new world, while maintaining the healthy morale of the crew.

Morale is one of the three tracks that affect gameplay. The game will be lost, if morale drops to zero.

The second track is the Threat track. As Threat goes up, more morale is lost every Season. Players can improve these two tracks.

The final track is the spawn track. The Spawn track increases every Season. It shows players how many aliens spawn from spawning points during the battle for each Mission Phase.

After each Mission Phase, crew members must return to the colony to complete the Colony Phase. A random event card is drawn that either adds more challenge, or provides a small benefit. Each player then places their crew tokens onto one of the 7 colony stations to perform its action.

All 7 stations can be accessed by any two crew members, or by one of the four specialists linked to that location, either a Commander, an Engineer, an Agritect or a Medic. The Perimeter lowers Threat level. The Training Grounds improves morale. The Med Bay creates medicine and regains lost health. Stasis Pods awake new crew members that can help in the colony next Season. The Bio-Dome is used to grow food. The Command Center earns valuable victory points. The Workshop is used to make new weapons and equipment. Every station can be improved to be more efficient.

Thrive has a fast-pace single die combat and skill system. It just takes one roll to determine if a hit is successful and how much damage is done. Damage and success are inversely represented on the dice, giving great balance to every roll.

Aliens are controlled by a clever and easy to use AI algorithm. The AI is predictable, but adapts automatically to the combined tactical choices of the players, creating a challenging puzzle of movement.

All player actions in are taken simultaneously, allowing for minimal downtime between turns.

Characters are all unique and balanced with 3 basic attributes, 3 pools of trait cubes used for actions, focusing and health. An expansive selection of skill tokens also improve each character after each of the first 3 missions.

The variable event deck, the randomly selected skill tokens, and the randomly drawn missions ensure that no two games will ever be the same.

The spawn track is a natural gameplay timer. It increases difficulty and provides thematic tension, making every game fun, fresh and exciting.

The most satisfying element you will find in Thrive is the interconnected puzzles between every Mission Phase and Colony Phase. They are challenging and rewarding. It is a great balance between tactics and strategy. Every choice is meaningful to the team’s end results
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Pattern Movement, Relative Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Serpentino
description:
Each player sets his tiles on row A of his color. The players roll the number die and the letter die together. The tile indicated by the rolled letter is moved criss cross wise according to the result of the number die. If a blank side of the letter die is rolled, the player may move any tile. On the roll of a 6 the player may roll again. The goal of the game is to reach the spaces of the same color and letter in row B on the opposite side of the game board. Tiles of an opponent may be thrown out an may get brought back into play with the roll of a blank. spaces with the letters of the word "SERPENTINO" are safe. The first player to get his tiles to their destinations on row B wins the game. Spectators may bet on the winner of the game, using the TOTO spaces (win/place).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Into the Box
description:
Your gloves are on, seconds are out, the bell has rung, the crowd is screaming. Engage your rival, make your best moves, and hit first. Now you are on your own.0

Into the Box is a simulation of a boxing fight for 2 players, focused on the strategy involved. Your goal is to have more points than your rival after 9 or 12 rounds or, alternatively, knock him out before he does it to you.

Each player has a deck of cards representing their boxer's skills, including punches, guards, and special moves. Players take turns to play their cards from a limited hand. In general, punching does damage, and guarding prevents that damage. Boxers may kiss the canvas as a result of a strong unguarded punch and may be knocked out after sustaining too much damage. You will have to manage your hand wisely, knowing when to attack and when to defend and try to take your adversary by surprise.

At the beginning of every round, each boxer is granted 10 points from ring judges and must subtract one point for each time they kiss the canvas. At the end of the round, the most damaged boxer must subtract one additional point from his/her score.

—description from the designer

name: Goblin Grapple: Bethany
description:
Promo Goblin Card that reads

"Discard this card and draw a card
If it is a Mage or Brute, end the round"
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: BIASED: ¿Cuántos días más?
description:
How many situations will you overcome in a biased world?

This game challenges your strategy skills to choose how to act in each situation. With a large variety of characters, BIASED tries to entertain and to raise awareness about biases at the same time.

BIASED is a Print & Play game developed by a group of university students, not motivated by financial gain. As easy as download, print and play!

—description from the designer (translated)

¿Cuántas situaciones lograrás superar en un mundo sesgado?
En este juego se pone a prueba tu capacidad estratégica para decir cómo actuar en cada situación.
Con una gran diversidad de personajes con la cual enfrentarte a las diferentes situaciones, BIASED pretende entretener al jugador al mismo tiempo que concienciar sobre los sesgos en la sociedad.
BIASED es un Print&Play desarrollado por un grupo de estudiantes universitarios, totalmente gratuito y sin animo de lucro. ¡Tan fácil cómo imprimir y empezar a jugar!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bias, Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Death To The Soviet!: The Panjshir Valley Cauldron, May 1982
description:
Panjshir Valley V is a simulation on the 5th battle for the valley conducted by the Soviet 108th Mechanized division (and others) that began May 16, 1982. In all of the previous battles to subdue this Mujahideen infested bastion, the Soviets either stalled in advancing or suffered losses beyond their expectations. They never were able to control the valley that stretches for 90 miles and has a narrow valley floor and 10,000 foot mountains astride the dirt road. This type of terrain seemed to nullify much of the Soviet raw military strength.

—dscription from the designer

name: Telken Lost
description:
Telken Lost is a science fantasy tabletop RPG that uses a card building system for powers/skills. We've finished our first adventure; it's called Shadow of Pharos. You can download it for free at TelkenLost.com.

Our intent is to continue creation of a series of stories.

The free download has original art, premade gender neutral characters, a rule system, and an engaging and immersive adventure. The game design is intended to keep focus on story rather than complex rules.

We hope you'll try the game and leave some comments on our boards.
Thanks for playing.

name: Li'l Tupper's Travels
description: Similar to Chutes and Ladders - first to the end of a path wins

name: March on Rome: Expansion
description: Adds 5th and 6th player plus a replacement map with extra areas and 26 extra cards to accommodate them including 2 new types that can be used with fewer players.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Magnus Opus: A Magnus Rex Expansion
description:
This expansion adds 14 additional factions and a new ability/building, Magnus Opus buildings, to the base game!

These Opus buildings give your civilization powerful new unique action cards. Each Opus building is unique and buildable only once in a game with a unique mix of resources.

As the game progresses and new resources become available, stronger Opus buildings will also become available!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: The Digital Agency Game
description:
Run your own agency in this easy to pick up and learn card game. With over 100 unique cards you'll never know what's going to happen next though.

The game consists of three card types: Projects, Employees and Events. Take on Projects and attempt to assign the right mix of Employee cards to them in order to win points.

Played either from your own hand or a common "Resource Pool", Employee cards represent a diverse workforce, each with their own artwork and unique mix of skills.

Each turn you must take and play an Event card which may either help or hinder you (for example by stealing an Employee from another player or by making a Project more difficult to complete). Once all Event cards have been drawn, the game ends and the final scores are tallied.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Hong Kong: Summer 2019
description:
Hong Kong: Summer 2019 is a miniatures tabletop game based on the series of events started since summer 2019 in Hong Kong.

In the game the players act as the protesters against Extradition Law Amendment Bill Movement in Hong Kong. A lot of videos taken by the protestors showcased the unnecessary violence exerted by the police force, the events keep going for more than half a year till the time of written.
We hoped to let the players experience what ridiculous events had happened in Hong Kong during this time in the form of a tabletop RPG board game.

This is a miniatures RPG game mixed with deck building elements.

Players construct their own action decks which consist of different attack moves, defensive moves and other special moves. They can also acquire new moves through the missions. They are free to take out cards and add cards to their decks for the next missions. Remember, a bigger deck size also means it is harder to draw some wanted cards. Players must consider and make effective decks instead of adding all the cards they get.

The game is turn-based. Every player performs different actions like these:

Move – move the player on the map based on its speed, sometimes they can have special moves with some special action cards.

Attack – Players can play cards from their hands to perform different attacks, they have different attribute requirements and the players often have to roll a set of dice to determine the attack strength.

When an action card is used once, it is discarded. When the player runs out of action cards, he needs to find a safe place to rest to replenish the deck! But they come back automatically once the current mission is over.

Search – Players can search the objects on the map and will trigger sudden events, often they have to choose between two options, but sometimes they don't have a choice, it is instead determined by some current conditions.

Specials – There are many special moves, like healing wounds, dealing with tear gas, take videos, etc.

Save Others – In some missions there are NPC protectors spawning on the map, the players can save them by moving to them and clear the enemies nearby.

As this is a coop game, the enemy’s turn would be played according to the AI deck.

Remember, do not advance to the very front line always as this is a very hard game.

There are different objectives in different missions, like saving protesters, surviving for some turns, protect the Lennon walls, setting road blocks, collecting police violence evidence, expose to the mass through the six months.

Those are just what would happen in one mission, between the missions the players can use the experience earned to upgrade their attributes, get more action moves and construct their own action decks, etc. And remember the final goal is to survive through the missions till November, and increase the mass supports (an in-game value) by that time.

—description from the designer'
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid

name: Spoker
description:
A combination of the gambling game of Texas-Hold'Em poker and the word making game of Scrabble.

Contents:
The spoker™ pack of cards (98 letter cards + 2 'Joker' cards - blanks)
The spoker™ playing mat for up to 6 players
The 300 branded hexagonal spoker™ chips (made from wood and in 5 denominations)
The spoker™ carry case
The spoker™ rule book and other games that can be played with the spoker™ pack

The aim of a game of spoker™ is simple. A player tries to put together the highest scoring word from the eight letter cards available to them (unlike Texas Holdem Poker which makes the best 5 card hand from 7 cards available). The word is made from the 3 letters that were privately dealt to each player (hole cards) and the 5 turned over on the spoker™ playing mat (the 3 'flop' cards, the 'turn' card and the 'river' card -community cards as in Texas Holdem Poker). Players can use the hexagonal note pads provided to write down and juggle the letters around to help make up words. Players bet in a series of rounds, exactly as in Texas Holdem Poker (with small and big blinds). The winner of the 'Pot' is the player who reveals the highest scoring word at the end of the 4 rounds of betting, or the last player left in the game, as all other players have folded their cards.

spoker™ therefore, places the intellectual and vocabulary expertise of word making, within the exciting arena of gambling and gives you the opportunity to make a profit from your combined skills. A word expert could beat a skilled gambler on many occasions, however a skilled gambler could very well beat a top word player too, due to their knowledge of gambling strategy and bluffs. An expert in both these fields would find spoker™ an exciting and refreshing concept and an excellent opportunity to make a good profit through spoker™ gaming!

—description from the designer, Jonathan Stone
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Magnus Rex: Orient Mysticum
description:
In this map pack for Magnus Rex, the modular map is replaced by 2 bi-fold boards. The map contains East Asia and the Indian subcontinent, and has "true start" starting locations for these factions:


China
India
Japan
Mongolia


Also included are playing mats for these four factions not included in the base game, and 5 unit shards each, for these unique faction units: Samurai (Japan), Keshik (Mongolia), and Indian Elephant (India).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Tyrants of Yitar
description:
In Tyrants of Yitar up to seven players are tyrants in the land of Yitar trying to become Priest King. This is done by gaining ten Fame points, venturing into the Desolation of the Claw to find the Sword of Yitar, and presenting oneself at the Citadel of Yitar for judgement (rolled on a table).

Each tyrant starts with randomly-determined attributes (Survival, Guile, Faith, and Generalship), gold, household garrison, warrior bands, and slayers (specially trained assassins). They move around the map to attack the other players, the Merciless Horde of Yin, and the Humanoids of the Claw. This can provide fame and, when attacking other players' households, gold.

Tyrants can also adventure into such places as the Vale of the Prophets and the Caves of the Necromancer, which may result in gaining magic items or other benefits, but may also have negative effects.

Each turn a tyrant must also roll for a random event; there is a 1/6 chance nothing will happen but otherwise a player may be ambushed, raided, given gold, etc.

One unusual rule is that a player is allowed to write a secret message to another player, but it may not be delivered properly; based on a die-roll the message may go astray and a different player may receive it.

—user summary

name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – The Miracle of Mars Promo Stratagem Card
description: This promo card was included in the December 2019 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 3 other games. It is a "Tricks and Tactics" Stratagem card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Une Nounou en Fer
description:
Une Nounou en fer ("An Iron Nanny") is a board game for all the family.

All players are babies that do not want to stay at bed, and want to cross the room to eat candies.
They will have to find their path through lying on the ground toys, avoiding dirty diapers and bad tricks from others players.
And most of all, be careful of the nanny that will try to catch you !

The use of the app is not mandatory but it will add more fun and surprises all along the game.

When it is your turn to play you have to choose 2 actions from 3 (actions must be different).

Unveil a tile
Orientate a tile already unveiled
Move forward


Some tiles just show a path through toys (blue tiles) some other show a path and give you an extra bonus when you stop on it (orange tiles).
Bonus could be to jump over toys, do another action, move a diaper and so on..

When done, you can roll the nanny dice and move her accordingly. When nanny comes to a baby, she pushes him back from one tile.
When a baby come back to his bed, he is so pissed off that he can launch a new dirty diaper on the boardgame.

First player to arrive on candies tile wins the game.

name: Rumbbell FatDragon Invasion
description:
Rumbbell FatDragon Invasion is a cooperative deck building game for 2 to 4 players. Players represent a group of Rumbbell Rangers, by using variety of sports and exercise cards, combined with the unique ability from each character to defend our world by eliminate the invasion of FatDragons attack with all kinds of overwhelming amount of food. Players can work together toward the goal, and pick up useful knowledge and information about exercises.

With thousands of FatDragons marching into our planet, now is up to the Rumbbell Rangers to save our world by promoting different type of sports and exercises. Stay healthy before it’s too late!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Black Seas: Royal Navy 1st Rate
description:
A Royal Navy 1st rate is a particularly dangerous foe in Black Seas, especially true when using the National Special Rules. In the game, 1st rates have the best access to customisation and upgrade options. Combine certain upgrades (we're fans of Master Gunner) with the British 'Drilled' special rule and your 1st rate will truly be an unstoppable force - but don't go into battle unsupported!

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Black Seas: USS Constitution
description:
USS Constitution was one of six Heavy Frigates commissioned by the United States Congress in 1794 to protect American shipping against Barbary Pirates in the Mediterranean. These frigates were designed to outmatch the frigates of any other nation while remaining nimble enough to slip away from larger ships-of-the-line.

These six frigates (Chesapeake, Constitution, President, United States, Congress, and Constellation. Chesapeake, Constitution, President and United States) were armed with 44 guns, normally a mix of long 24-pounders and 32-pound carronades. Across their service life, these ships would often end up over gunned, carrying upwards of 50 guns into battle.

Revolutionary construction techniques gave the six frigates much thicker hull planking than their British or French equivalents, allowing them to soak up a tremendous amount of punishment. It also allowed them to carry a much heavier armament relative to their size, as seen by the arrays of 24 and 32-pounders carried on the 44 gun vessels.

In the Game:

USS Constitution should be in the thickest fighting on the table, leading the charge into the enemy battle line, using her exceptional survivability to weather the storm of shot and shell while blasting away with her own guns.

While she might not be able to tangle with larger First Rates like Victory, she can hold her own in frigate actions, tying up the enemy fleet while the remainder of your ships go after other objectives or gain a more advantageous position.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: An Adventure in Science
description:
An electronic question and answer game where the board has 24 contacts - 12 for questions and 12 for answers. When the player matches the correct answer with the question a light bulb will flash. Questions relate to the sciences, human body and the natural world. The questions sheets are changeable on the board.

—user summary

name: Vorwärts und rückwärts
description:
The players have to move their pawns from their starting spaces to the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. To enter a pawn into the game a 1 has to be rolled. On the roll of an even number, the pawn moves forward. An odd number causes the pawn to move backwards.

If a pawn has reached it's own spaces marked with a "+" it doesn't have to move backwards anymore. The spaces marked with 1,2,3 or 6 eyes have to be reached in sequence by a roll of this number.

The first player to get all 4 pawns to their destination wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 2d6vs2d6 Dice Baseball
description:
Baseball as simulated by four standard six-sided dice, for one or two players. Two dice are designated as the "Away" team, and two dice are designated the "Home" team. The game starts with Away team as batter/runners, and Home team as pitcher/fielders. In the outcomes grid, Batter/runners values designate the row, the Pitcher/fielders designate the column, with the resulting cell determining the outcome.

—description from the designer

name: Caveman Clash
description:
A simple set of miniatures skirmish rules allowing bands of cavemen to fight against one another or prehistoric megafauna.

—user summary

name: SDG Architect
description:
SDG Architect is a competitive strategic game where players develop and implement a strategy to achieve sustainable development in their country by making efficient use of limited resources. SDG Architect supports public education about the Sustainable Development Goals.

—description from the publisher

How to Play
Players act as the leaders of neighboring countries responsible for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) as quickly as possible. At every round, players get resource cards based on their progress, and use them to implement interventions aimed at achieving the SDGs. By way of those interventions, players advance from level 0 to 3 for each SDG or “Goal”, and receive more resources to invest and further their progress.

Basic Setup
Distribute 17 tokens of the same color to each player; divide the resource cards by type and stack them on the outer part of the board; and place the Technology token on the globe in the center of the board.

To determine their starting level, players roll the die. The player with the highest roll rolls the die again and positions an initial token on the first intervention for the corresponding SDG number. The other players follow in a clock-wise direction, rolling the die in turns until all players have placed six tokens.

End of the Game
At the end of the game, the player who has progressed the most towards the SDGs wins: each level achieved for each Goal is counted as a point, and the first player to fully achieve any Goal is awarded two extra points. The game can be limited in time, in rounds, or can end when the first player achieves a certain level for all SDGs agreed by players at the start of the game. Reaching Level 1 for all Goals typically requires about 1 hour of play time; Level 2 two hours; and Level 3 three hours.

name: Wynalazcy, Odkrywcy, Przemysłowcy
description:
In the game Wynalazcy, Odkrywcy, Przemysłowcy players compete for the title of the best inventor! During the game, players will earn cards from various fields of science that will allow them to create inventions. Each of the inventions will bring the creator points, and the one who collects the most of them will be the winner.

In his turn, the player draws one card and decides whether to add it to the cards on his hand or to risk and pull another card. If new card game repeats an existing category, the player's round ends. Players will play sets of identical cards that create real inventions and crazy inventions.

name: Black Seas: U.S. Navy Fleet
description:
The Naval Act of 1794 established a permanent standing navy on 27 March 1794, in the US. Prior to this, a US Naval military presence had been left wanting for 10 years. By October 1797, the first three of six frigates launched; the USS United States, USS Constellation, and USS Constitution. Between 1798 and 99, several engagements took place between the US and France - though this was not a declared war. The First Barbary War of 1801-1805 saw actions against the Barbary pirates.

The fleet would then see substantial action in the War of 1812 - achieving victory in 11 single ship engagements against the Royal Navy. British forces were forced off Lake Erie and Lake Champlain, effectively preventing the invasion of New York State. The fleet was, however, unable to prevent British blockades of US ports, the British Navy being significantly larger.

Why sail the US Navy?

The largest ships of the US Navy may pail in size in comparison to other nations, especially when using the National Special Rules (being unable to field any large or extra-large vessels). However, their frigates were exceptionally reinforced with many guns. To represent this, US fleets gain discounts to both the Over Gunned and Sturdy upgrades. They are both able to better weather punishment whilst dealing out a substantial portion themselves.

Additionally, in a similar vein to British crews, US crews were routinely drilled and always receive the +1 bonus to hit rolls. This makes US frigates, the core of your fleet exceptionally dependable, though remember if you do purchase both upgrades on all your ships (even at a discount), you may find yourself outnumbered.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Mastermaths
description:
The board is a 10 x 10 grid of squares numbered in order from 1 to 100. These squares are of different colors, and each color has a different point value, e.g. red squares are worth 13 points, and the red squares include 13, 26, 39, etc.
Each player has 10 square pieces of a different color which he places on the squares on the board and receives the number of points given for the color of that square. Whoever has the most points when all the pieces have been placed is the winner.
Which squares players may place pieces on is determined by a roll of 3 dice; the numbers rolled may be put into an equation involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division. For example, if a player rolls a 2, 3, and 4, he may place a piece on the 9 square (2+3+4), the 24 square (2x3x4), the 10 square ((3x4)-2), etc. He may not place a piece on an already occupied square unless the occupying piece is one of his own piece.

name: Der Jäger und der Fuchs
description:
The hunter starts at "A" and the fox at "B". Movement is one red dot per turn. The fox wins, if he espapes to "A". The hunter wins if he herds the fox back to "B" or manages to reach a red dot next to the fox.

—user summary

name: Jackaroo Teasing Game
description:
The Jackaroo board game, took two years from the publisher to create and design the game, it is a game based on teasing for non-ending laughs when teasing your opponent in different ways!It is a fun group game suitable for 2-4 players, and is perfect for kids, teens and adults, as well as the whole family.

How to play:

Use your personal teasing techniques to win the game with your friend in your team and get all your stones to safety zone; the more you tease your opponent, the funniest the game will be, guaranteeing that you will enjoy their angry faces.
You have to eat opponent stones, dispose their cards, block their way from reaching their goal and swap their stones far away from their zones to be able to get your stones to your safety zone as fast as possible, and then help your friend to get their stones too to win the game.
Players receive their cards and move their stones in turn according to card command, each team cooperate together to reach their safety zones and to prevent opponent to reach their goal. The game may take 1-2 hours depending on used TEASING techniques.


—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Moving Multiple Units

name: Speedy Car Rally
description:
A simple and entirely luck-based game contained in the book Speedy the Mini by Tim (author's surname not given). Players roll a die and move the number of spaces shown on the die. There are 44 spaces; to reach the 44th space and win one must roll the exact number to reach the 44th space. There are several spaces with instructions to go forward or back to a certain space and/or to miss one or two turns.

—user summary

name: Neues aus Büttenwarder: Das Ergänzungsset zum Spiel
description: Das Ergänzungssset adds 250 new cards in the familiar beermat-design to the game, again created by the same people who design the cards of the base game.
