Naval Thunder: Dreadnought Battlefleets expands the scope of your tabletop naval warfare in the golden age of the battleship! It includes seven new navies to supplement the fleet lists for Great Britain and Germany found in the original Clash of Dreadnoughts core rules.

Dreadnought Battlefleets includes complete fleet lists for the following nations:

America
Austria-Hungary
France
Italy
Japan
Russia (Baltic Fleet)
Russia (Black Sea Fleet)


Taken together these fleet lists comprise over one-hundred and sixty new classes of warship - more than double the number contained in the Clash of Dreadnoughts core rules. From dreadnoughts to destroyers, these new vessels of war will enable you to expand your World War I naval battles into a global conflict!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Victory! Fighting & Sailing Instructions: Naval Wargame Rules from Medway to Trafalgar & Beyond 1660-1820
description:
Victory! Fighting & Sailing Instructions

Age of Sail naval wargame rules usable with either model ships or counters to represent them.
Bookkeeping is kept to a minimum and this is very much a landlubber’s set of rules - you don’t need to be a sailing expert to enjoy games using this set!

Despite this unusual craft such as galleys and galleasses as well as xebecs and fireships are covered, and the rules include game design notes, a scenario, rules for boarding and grappling, tacking and boxhauling, &c.

Differences in ship and naval development over the period (1660-1820, so including the Napoleonic Wars) are also covered!

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: At War
description:
The end of the world is here. We just don’t know it, yet.
As the living kill each other, another challenger arises, The Dead.

At War is a twist on the classic card game War. Four factions will fight each other, and then the Dead. Will the living survive or will the dead overwhelm and be victorious?

Each player checks an attribute indicator card and then compares their cards stats against their opponent, the highest number wins. When living cards are defeated, flip them over to reveal "the dead". If a dead card is defeated, it is removed from the game. The game ends when only one player has cards left.

name: Fireteam to Fireforce
description:
Fireteam to Fireforce is an easy to learn, fast paced combined arms wargame ideal for squad to platoon level skirmishes.
It offers combined arms gameplay and a modular set of rules, so that players can pick it up quickly and add on more complicated concepts as they feel ready.
Fireteam to Fireforce is not locked on any one miniature line and allows you to choose how you want to represent your forces on the table.

Fireteam to Fireforce comes with an armory of modern weapons and vehicles, as well as generic weapon guidelines to enable you to create battles among the WWII hedgerows or distant worlds with Power Armored Orbital Droptroopers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: A Year In The Valley: Fireteam To Fireforce Campaign Supplement
description:
It was supposed be an easy mission.
Take your platoon, recon the village, meet with the tribal elders, maybe share a cup of tea.
All that went out the window the moment an IED exploded beneath the vehicle in front of you.
As your driver skids to a halt RPGs and machine guns begin to fire from the high ground. The first vehicle is in flames, your men are in a killing zone, and air support is at least 15 minutes away. What now sir?

Welcome to the Valley. It's going to be a long year.

A Year In The Valley is a campaign supplement for Fireteam To Fireforce tasking a platoon sized force to conduct counter-insurgency operations against a dug in and determined enemy. Develop your force into eagle eyed troopers to spot dangerous IEDs, or into tough veterans ready to lay down their lives for each other. Then, take the fight to the enemy with new rules for on board light mortar support, recon drones and Quick Reaction Forces.

A dozen new missions, a host of new traits for your troops, and a system for generating personalities for the enemy leadership, the campaign supplement introduces robust solo-play options for Fireteam To Fireforce players.
Weigh the needs of increasing popular opinion against the safety and fatigue level of your troops, and try to survive A Year In The Valley.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Divisional Ops
description:
Divisional Ops

A Set of WW2 Wargame rules to fight Divisional Level Actions

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Brigade Ops
description:
As with the other sets of rules they use the same format , this set plays at a level lower than divisional ops.

The rules cover a period from the 1950's up to today

—description from the publisher

name: Army Ops
description:
A set of rules converted form Brigade ops to allow multiple corps actions to be fought out from the 20th and 21st centuries

—description from the publisher

name: Company Ops: A Set of Company Level WW2 and Spanish Civil War Wargame Rules
description:
As with the other sets of rules they use the same format, this set plays at level where each unit is a company

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Frigate Engagements: Rules for Frigate Engagements in the Age of Sail
description: A set of rules to allow engagements between small numbers of ships of frigate size and lower with crew , sail and gun management
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Insurgent Ops
description:
A set of large scale skirmish rules for 15mm figures where 1 stand is a fireteam/squad or vehicle.

—description from the publisher

name: Laser Ops
description:
Based on a similar system to the other sets of rules but for 6mm sci-fi models

—description from the publisher

name: Coaling Stations: Rules for Pre Dreadnought Naval Fleet Actions
description:
A set of pre-dreadnough naval rules with some interesting and different mechanics and keeping paperwork to a minimum

—description from the publisher

name: Oiling Raiders: Rules for WWI Naval Fleet and Squadron Actions
description: A WW1 set of naval rules similar to Coaling Stations but with a upgraded system to allow for developments of technology for the period
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Gentlemen Generals: War in the 18th Century
description:
Gentlemen Generals: War in the 18th Century

Rules for wargaming the battles of the 18th Century on the European and North American continents.

The rules are easy to learn and even easier to play.

D6 game mechanics.

Games can be completed in an a single evening of play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Forty Dead Men: Small Action American Civil War Combat
description:
Forty Dead men is an easy to play set of American Civil War Rules.

The rules are simple to learn and very easy to play.

Regimental sized actions are at the core of the rules and the basic maneuver element is the company (represented by up to 10 figures).

The rules use D6 mechanics and an I go U go format with plenty of player interaction.

The rules allow for a flexible unit scale that will allow larger scale actions.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Micro Baseball
description:
Micro Baseball is a micro version of the game of baseball using dice, tokens and 9-cards. As the pitcher you decide your pitch with one of six pitch cards. As the batter you pick your batting style card but hide it from the opponent. You roll four colored dice to prepare for the pitch and then determine the amount of dice to adjust your swing and for power based on your batting style. You can then roll dice to adjust the swing to match the pitch. If you match you get a HIT and then determine how much power you put into the swing. The power determines how far into the field the ball travels. When there is a HIT, the opponent must place his player’s “up to 5 dice” on the field in zones to see if they make the out.
You can play a full game solo against an A.I. Bot or 2-player. All the same rules apply to actual game of baseball with pitching, hitting and fielding but I removed balls and strikes to speed up play.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cartographia: Multi-Player Map Campaigns in Chevauchee
description:
Multiplayer campaigns can be an entertaining way to kill a weekend, or last weeks and weeks as players struggle for supremacy.

Cartographia builds on the extensive suite of narrative campaign tools contained within Chevauchee and builds upon them to put each player in charge of a medieval fief rooted in a realistic medieval landscape, easily represented on a hex or grid map.

Cartographia requires a copy of the Chevauchee core book to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: FiveCore System Pack: New Rules and Options to customize your FiveCore Games
description:
Welcome to the FiveCore System Pack.

Intended for tinkerers and scenario writers, this provides the following new options to customize your games of FiveCore or Five Men in Normandy.

Materiel can be adapted to Five Men at Kursk with minimal difficulty.


Simplified turn sequence (for non-random turns)
Bonus actions (A variant of the simplified turn sequence using the action dice to provide bonus actions)
Careful aim (A new tactical option)
Ambush (A new option when reacting to nearby movement)
Terrain movement reduction (A more conventional terrain system)
Action Point System (A new turn sequence allowing more fine-control over what your characters do each turn)
Melee dice (Replace the opposed Brawling roll with Kill and Shock dice)
Observation test (A dice-based spotting system)
Alternative combat dice (8 new attack dice types to build futuristic and alien weapons, including toxin, web and disintegration)
Squad traits (A skill system for an entire squad, for quick scenario building)
Diceless recovery (A non-random method for recovering figures that are Down or Panicked)
Skill challenges (A simple skill system for roleplay oriented scenarios)
Battle exhaustion (Put more pressure on your characters in a campaign, forcing you to push them harder or operate below strength)
Wounds (An in-battle wound table adding bloody detail to your games)


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: FiveCore Pulp Adventure
description:
Ancient treasures, crumbling ruins and evil Nazis trying to get the loot before you do.

This is FiveCore Pulp Adventure, hope you kept your Mauser pistol loaded.

This is a complete, stand-alone game using a modified FiveCore system to power exciting adventure campaigns.

Build a party of characters with their own backgrounds and set out to find great treasures.

Gain skills, face off against angry tribes and sinister government agents, fight off looters and more in the style of classic pulp fare such as Indiana Jones and modern takes like Tomb Raider and Uncharted.

The game engine has been expanded to feature a new turn sequence, more dynamic reactions and the new Cinematic Movement system allowing characters to jump, swing, climb and scamper around the terrain features like never before.

Other included features include multiple character classes from dashing heroes to hopeless hangers-on, solo guidelines and an encounter generator.

The game uses individually based figures and is suitable for any scale you like to use.

All dice in game-play are D6 but D10 are needed to use the encounter and campaign tables.

The rules are compatible with all FiveCore products but are completely stand-alone and do NOT require any other purchase.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sandbox: Infantry Patrols in occupied territory – A campaign system for FiveCore
description:
Up ahead, it looks like a bunch of the locals are gathering.
Could be a sign of trouble, could be they need help with something. Never know in advance.
Second team goes to take a look while you hang back to keep an eye on things.
Suddenly shots ring out from across the street. We have contact!

Sandbox is a mini-campaign system for FiveCore games (though it can be adopted to others as well) focusing on infantry patrols in an occupied city.

Inspired by infantry actions in Iraq and Afghanistan, it could be applied to theoretical, fictional or even futuristic peacekeeping operations as well.

Command your infantry squad as you move across the table, investigate designated points and try to roll with the punches.

If you get in over your head, you'll be able to call in support... if HQ approves it.

Sandbox uses random rolls to generate encounters, giving an unpredictable experience crafted to be particularly useful for Solo players and can be easily incorporated in a conventional wargames campaign.

Features include:

Rules adjustments for FiveCore to fit the setting better.
Three different levels of enemies.
A set of skills to acquire, specifically suited to the environment.
Advice on how to scale up the campaign game to include bigger actions.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: From Shako to Coal Scuttle: Quick-play Battles from Waterloo to the Marne
description:
From Shako to Coal Scuttle lets you get the feeling of a big battle, without memorizing hundreds of pages of rules and having to paint a thousand figures first.

Covering roughly a hundred years, starting with Napoleon and Washington and ending as the old world romance dies in 1914, an army consists of 8-12 infantry units with a few supporting cavalry units and artillery units representing the entire army taking the field.

Intended for 15mm figures and below, each unit consists of 4 stands (infantry/cavalry) or a single gun stand, meaning that a full army won't typically require more than 50 stands.

Commanding your army is done through the Command Dice mechanic:

Your troops will carry out basic movement and combat automatically, but you will have a limited number of rallying and shock actions each turn, based on unit quality and the luck of the Command Dice roll each turn.

If you need additional actions, your army leadership can be committed to give you additional actions, but this puts them at risk. Lead from the front and be rewarded.. or shot from your horse.

Combat uses a single-roll mechanic: Roll a pool of dice (typically 3-4) and check each die for results.

That single roll will tell you everything you need to know, without any additional rolls required: Is the enemy in Disarray? Being pushed back? Taking losses? One roll.

Finally the rules offer simple campaign rules, options to help you set up creative scenarios and a standard "meeting engagement" battle plan you can use to set up.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Rules Pack Alpha: for the No End in Sight game system
description:
The anti-tank gunner is down, screaming his head off, the men are getting anxious while trying to figure out how to set up the rocket launcher and the enemy seems to just have gotten their second wind.

Why didn't anyone tell you what to do?

Welcome to the first supplement for No End in Sight. Rules Pack Alpha contains a selection of optional rules to add more detail, change elements of the game or enhance a scenario. Some are major changes while others are small, quick tweaks.

Whether you play campaigns, scenarios, solo games or randomly generated encounters, you will find something in here to interest you

The list of options are:

Quick task check
Battle fury
Combat endurance
Deploying into position
Desperation
Fanatic troops
Gruesome injuries
Hatred
Improvised tank assault
Knocked out soldiers
Long turns
No cross training
Simplified ammo rule
Spontaneous initiative
Squad level skirmishing
Untested troops
Weapon loss and repair
Won't someone do something?


18 new rules options for the cost of a coffee.

Please note this is a supplement and requires a copy of No End in Sight to use.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: The Second Kharkov Campaign: May 1942 – A Pair of Pint-Sized Campaigns for Chain of Command and a Campaign for What a Tanker
description:
The Second Kharkov Campaign is a pair of Pint Sized campaigns for the TooFatLardies rule set Chain of Command. These platoon level scenarios are perfectly usable for other rule sets and provided the necessary information to make adjustments.

The first campaign covers the initial Soviet attack on German lines in May 12th of 1942. It follows the advance of the Soviet 38th Tank Brigade and the 226th Rifle Division in their attack on the German 294th Infantry Division which was blocking the main roads leading to the city of Kharkov. The campaign has seven scenarios and involves British Lend-Lease tanks. The entire campaign spans a single day of this battle where the Soviets made significant gains and in many cases broke the German lines.

The second campaign covers the German counterattack on May 13th of 1942. Having released the armored divisions that were being held in reserves, the German 3rd Panzer Division pushed up from Kharkov and cut through a number of Soviet units. This campaign has six separate scenarios and covers the time from the 13th to the 16th of May 1942. This campaign has scenarios that may be played out with the What A Tanker rule set as well due to their armor heavy nature.

The third campaign in this book is a What A Tanker Campaign. This allows the player to create a map based campaign to move their forces in a kriegspiel type manner until their forces make contact, then play out the scenario using the What A Tanker rules.

Lastly, the book provides some sketches of other units and actions that can be used to create your own campaigns with. The maps are based on period maps from German and Soviet armies. Each scenario has a game map and a picture of the table that I used to game these out.

The PDF comes out to 105 pages and includes a short history of the campaigns to provide the player with a background on the action that they are fighting.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Élan: Brigade to Divisional level Great War combat rules
description:
Élan is a set of Brigade to Divisional level scenario driven rules for the European theatre during The Great War.

Designed as a two-player game using 6mm figures, with little adjustment it can be played solo, or in any scale from 2mm to 20mm.

The basic mechanism used in this game - élan, distills a number of factors - morale, training, leadership, fatigue, "friction" - into a single numerical value. Whenever a unit tries to perform an action, its score is rolled against. Failure not only results in the attempted action failing but a fall in the élan score, as the unit begins to succumb to the stresses of the battlefield. Under this system, even the most motivated troops will eventually be worn down and break.

In the game, much of the minutiae of combat has been ignored. As Divisional or Brigade commanders, the players only see the results of actions, not the process on the ground by which those results are determined. A commander will know only that a unit has not advanced, not which one of the multitude of reasons why it hasn't. This absence of precise control at the company level, is mirrored further up the command structure by using a non-sequential turn sequence to simulate communications failures (and initiative) within the command system.

Élan contains army lists for 22 nations involved in the Great war and instructions on how to convert any MicroMark army list for play in the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Resistance Is Futile (Version 4): Science Fiction Wargame Rules
description:
RESISTANCE IS FUTILE VERSION 4
Expanded and radically revised!

Fast and fun game play, revamped morale and control rules, flexible units, heroes; usable with 40k or other sci-fi armies, includes optional background fluff!

SCIENCE-FICTION WARGAME RULES

THIS IS THE fourth version of the rules, which have radically changed and developed to be virtually an entirely new set. What’s changed? There's been lots of minor developments, but also fluid rules for unit coherence which combined with new unit morale rules work in a unique way. If your grizzled captain leading a unit of conscripts is shot, you could be in trouble!

Shooting has been revamped into a quick and easy system, both for direct and indirect fire. Sequence of play is much more flexible, vehicle and monster hits have variable results, going prone, suppression and overwatch rules have been integrated, etc.

Finally, and while certainly optional since you can use whatever game universe background you like, we’ve beefed up the fluff about our own universe. There are numerous lists giving examples of various troop types which you can use as they are, or as examples to show you how to create troop profiles for you own wargame armies.

—description from the publisher

name: Code 7: More Rules & Inspiration for Resistance if Futile 4 Sci-Fi Rules
description:
Code 7
Supplement for Resistance is Futile 4 wargame rules!

New rules and ideas for lots of cool things like fighting in snow blizzards, or in zero-G conditions, adding booby traps and using poisonous plants!

Full feature list:

cynical troops,
stealth,
bombers,
giant robots,
faulty weapons,
ECM,
cloaking,
mind control,
hallucination,
propaganda,
negotiation,
trackers,
medical facilities,
civilians and refugees,
neutral militias,
animals,
space-to-planet drop,
sensors,
minefields,
barbed wire,
tank traps,
booby traps,
poisonous plants,
unstable structures,
hidden tunnels,
zero-G combat,
night fighting,
rainstorms,
sandstorms,
snow blizzards,
strong head winds,
electrical and ion storms,
thin ice.


Resistance is Futile 4 rules are required to use Code 7.

Please note: Code 7 is the update replacement for the withdrawn Heavy Support supplement which was for version 3 of the rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ultima Ratio Regum (2nd Edition): The List of Arms – Army Lists Supplement
description:
LIST OF ARMS 2nd edition is not a standalone product, but the army lists to accompany our grand tactical wargame rules ULTIMA RATIO REGUM 2nd edition.

Armies covered are as follows:

Portuguese
Imperialist
Bavarian
Spanish
Russian
French
Crimean Tartars
Japanese
Swedish
Dutch
English/British
Polish
Prussian
‘Other’ German and Italian states
Scots Jacobite
Abyssinian
Irish Catholic
Ottoman Turkish
Moorish
Chinese
Indian
Sudanese
‘Other’ African states


So as you can see, quite an eclectic mix!

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Conquering the Skies
description:
Conquering the skies board game (all in Japanese). A sugoroku game (a Japanese game which might be compared to backgammon) of graphically striking design encouraging players to make their way around the world along aviation routes of various types (e.g. the Zeppelin route.) Japan lies at the center, with countries identified by national flags. Around the border of the map are black and white images of people, animals, and historical buildings relating to the different stops along the way. The text boxes at the bottom give directions for playing the game, and important things for children to learn. It was a New Years newspaper supplement to Mainichi Shinbun, dated Showa 5 (1930).

Text in Japanese. The subtitle on the right reads: Educational Games for a New Age; the subtitle on the left reads:New Years Supplement to Osaka Mainichi Newspaper. Map title: World Flight Routes. Lower right: Directions for playing. "The easiest way" "Here are instructions for the easiest way to play. Around the map are assembled the world's interesting and well-known places. Most likely, these are all places that everyone wishes they could visit sometime. Departing from Osaka [1] and moving to all the places in order of 2, 3, 4, you then return to Tokyo [52]. The player who reaches there first is the winner. "Throw the dice and proceed as many places as the number you cast..." Upper right text informs players of distances between locations, with basic geographic facts. The legend, toward the bottom of the map oval, shows 5 types of red lines & 1 square: 1. Well-known large aircraft route (refers to zeppelin, seen center of map) 2. First-class limited time route 3. Liner air route 4. Air route already mastered/controlled/ conquered 5. Planned route. Main localities [red square inside black square].

—user summary

name: All American: The Battle at La Fière, 1944 – A Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
All American - Battle at La Fière

American Airborne and German Heer forces clash at the key La Fière bridge during the Invasion of Normandy.
Will the American’s hold the bridge until help arrives, or can the German tanks smash through and move on to Utah Beach?

This campaign is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies' Chain of Command and can also be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

Contained in this book you will find:

Complete campaign setup, duration, and special rules to add variation to play
Platoon layouts for both Allied and Axis forces, as well as campaign-specific Support Lists
Four scenarios based on period maps and aerial reconnaissance
Pre-generated character names, custom Patrol Markers, and optional blinds rules


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Holding Out at Neuville-au-Plain: A Scenario for Chain of Command
description:
Chain of Command: Holding Out at Neuville-au-Plain is a one-off scenario based on a delaying action at Neuville-au-Plain on the morning of D-Day June 6th, 1944.
An American Airborne platoon is tasked with holding a much larger German force pushing towards Sainte-Mère-Église.
Can the Americans stop this looming threat?
Or will the Germans manage to break through and threaten the Allied invasion?

This scenario is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies' Chain of Command, however it can be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Shootout at Dead Man's Corner: A Scenario for Chain of Command
description:
Shootout at Dead Man's Corner is a one-off scenario based on the struggle around the crossroads South of St-Come-du-Mont on the days following June 6th, 1944.
American and German paratroop forces fight to control the vital position, with the arrival of a Stuart tank adding some much needed support for the Allies!

The scenario is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies' Chain of Command, however it can be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Action At Ustilug: A Pint Sized Campaign for the TooFatLardies Chain of Command Rules
description:
The Action At Ustilug is a pint sized campaign for Chain of Command.
It contains a half ladder campaign with a variable support system that adds an extra level of friction to your support choices.
The campaign covers the opening day of Operation Barbarossa. The German 289th Infantry Division crossed the Ukrainian border at the bridges near Ustilug and encountered the Soviet 87th Rifle Division and elements of the 41st Tank Division.

The scenarios cover rural as well as urban engagements. The Soviet defenders acquitted themselves well and delayed the German advance through the town at every opportunity.

The booklet weighs in at 22 pages with full maps for each scenario.
This does not have the same production quality as the Pint Sized Campaigns published through TooFatLardies as it has no graphics other than game maps.

—description from the publisher at Wargame vault
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: The Battle for Kharkov: October 1941
description:
The Campaign for Kharkov contains two pint sized campaigns designed for the TooFatLardies Chain of Command rules.
They are easily converted to any skirmish ruleset such as Bolt Action.

One covers the advance of the German 57th Infantry Division and the other the German 101st Light Division. The attack came in October of 1941. This city would be the site of three major battles for the city. The interesting aspect of the October 1941 battle is in the nature of the troops involved. The Soviets had superiority in armor. The Germans advanced with only a single STUG battalion in support of the 57th ID. The Soviets fielded the T34 as well as several improvised armored vehicles such as the KhTZ-16. While not a success on the battlefield, it demonstrated the Soviet inventiveness under the extreme pressure of the blitzkrieg.

There are twelve total scenarios in the campaign.
Full force lists are available for both German Divisions and the Soviet troops present.
Maps are based on aerial reconnaissance photographs taken by German troops in September 1941.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Star Encounters: The Zodiac Game
description:
Hundreds of questions and answers generates lots of laughs as players try to collect different sets of cards to win the game. Answer the question on a card correctly and you win that card! You'll be amazed how much you can learn about yourself and those close to you as you enjoy the game!

—description from the back of the box

name: A Question of Sport:  Booster Pack Celebrity Cards
description:
Booster Back for the "A Question of Sport" board game based on the popular UK BBC television TV-show. This contains Celebrity trivia questions to be used in the game.

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.

name: A Sergeant's War: Rules for Wargaming Small Unit Combat in WWII
description:
Your platoon has clawed its way forward under heavy fire---but can they make it the last few yards and kick the enemy off the hill?

Find out with a Sergeant’s War, a WWII minatures game which emphasizes morale, unit quality, and small-unit leaders. A typical force is a platoon of infantry backed up with heavy weapons and armor. Units of maneuver are individual vehicles, squads and half-squads of infantry, and heavy weapon teams. A free introductory version of the game is also available for download.

Major features of the game include:

Fast play—2 hours or less
Easy combat mechanics—infantry fire, anti-tank fire, and close-range firefights all use the same basic to-hit mechanic
Importance of leaders—your squad and platoon leaders are critical to keep your force fighting, but every time they do something significant, they might get hit by enemy fire
Solo-friendly
Emphasis on units over individuals—players focus on the placement of squads, tanks, and heavy weapons, not individual riflemen
Can be played with any scale of miniatures and any type of basing


This book contains:

Rules for infantry and vehicle combat
Artillery and air support
Special terrain rules for bocage, urban combat, fighting in forests, and more
Special combat rules for human wave assaults, night fighting, chaos and confusion, and more
Tips for designing scenarios
7 scenarios
Orders of battle the US, German, Soviet, British, Italian, Japanese, and French armies
Vehicle and gun stats for 1940-1945
Markers for pinned, broken, and other game conditions


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: A Sergeant's War: Free Intro Version – Rules for WWII Small Unit Combat
description:
Your platoon has clawed its way forward under heavy fire---but can they make it the last few yards and kick the enemy off the hill?

Find out with a Sergeant’s War, a WWII minatures game which emphasizes morale, unit quality, and small-unit leaders. A typical force is a platoon of infantry backed up with heavy weapons and armor. Units of maneuver are individual vehicles, squads and half-squads of infantry, and heavy weapon teams.

This is the free introductory version of the game, which includes the basic rules for infantry and two starter scenarios. It is a stand alone game. The full version is available on the Wargame Vault.

Features of the game include:

Fast play—2 hours or less
Easy combat mechanics—infantry fire, anti-tank fire, and close-range firefights all use the same basic to-hit mechanic
Importance of leaders—your squad and platoon leaders are critical to keep your force fighting, but every time they do something significant, they might get hit by enemy fire
Solo-friendly
Emphasis on units over individuals—players focus on the placement of squads, tanks, and heavy weapons, not individual riflemen
Can be played with any scale of miniatures and any type of basing


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Row by Row: A Wargaming Campaign for Normandy, 1944 – For A Sergeant's War and other WWII rules
description:
Somewhere in the hedegrows, Normandy, 1944…

The artillery falls silent and you order your platoon to cross the hedgerow. The men are jittery; most are replacements, on the frontline for less than a day.

The rip of a German MG cuts through the air. Screams follow and the battle is joined.

You step up to the firing line, to urge the green replacements forward and direct fire against the Germans. Today might be your last.

This is Row by Row, the first scenario/campaign back for A Sergeant’s War. Players can use the pack for stand-alone games or as a series of linked scenarios, in which your casualties and victories have cumulative effects.

The book is written for A Sergeant’s War, but is playable with any WWII rules set. The scenarios feature platoon-sized battles.

The scenarios all play on 4’x4’ or smaller tables (for 15mm/20mm scale) and usually feature 30-50 troops and several vehicles per side. The book includes:

Historical Background
Information for using the scenarios with other rules sets
6 Scenarios, featuring bocage-fights, German counter attacks, and a two-part street battle
Color maps


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Another Day on Okinawa: A WWII Campaign Pack for A Sergeant's War and other rules
description:
Another Day on Okinawa is a fictional 5-scenario campaign based on the brutal battles fought to overcome the Japanese fortifications on the hilltops and ridges of that island in 1945.
One side commands the US Marines, with plenty of firepower and excellent leadership, while the others play the Japanese, heavily fortified and prepared to sell their lives dearly.

Each scenario has an effect on the next through “campaign bonuses,” rewarded for particular achievements.

Overall victory is determined by victory points, awarded for winning scenarios and for achieving specific missions in each scenario.

To play the game, you will need:

5’x’4 table
Hills, shellholes, destroyed trees, and brush
Two Sherman tanks
Approximately 70 US Marine infantry
Five bunkers
Approximately 50 Japanese infantry
A set of WWII rules—this campaign is written with A Sergeant’s War in mind but it can be adapted to other systems


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Armored: Armored combat scenarios and additional rules for A Sergeant's War – and other WWII games
description:
The platoon of Sherman tanks, down to three tracks thanks to landmines and breakdowns, emerged from the wood and accelerated across a clearing. Immediately, the crack of a high-velocity gun cut through the air. Sergeant Glen, peeking out of the turret hatch of Daisy Darling, reflexively ducked. He scanned the far side of the field, looking for an AT gun emplacement or an enemy tank. Another round cracked and Mobile Macy, about fifty yards to his right, lurched to a halt and leaked flame and smoke.

A third round cut overhead. Over the intercom he heard the driver say a prayer and his gunner curse. There was a killer out there, and they hadn’t even managed to spot it yet…

Armored contains scenarios and special rules for use with the WWII small unit game A Sergeant’s War (ASW). The scenarios are perfectly compatible with other wargame rules, of course.

The special rules included here are intended to spice up armor-only games and to add more detail to combined arms games of ASW.

To play all the scenarios in this booklet, you will need a 6’x4’ table (or 3’x’2 if using 6mm figures and half-inch game scale), terrain, and some vehicles:

At the end of this booklet, A Sergeant’s War stats for these vehicles are provided at the end of these rules for convenience, as are simple, printable hidden unit counters.

New special rules include:

Vehicle Leaders
Infantry manning Vehicle MGs
Movement in Tight Spaces
Tank vs Man: Overruns
Tank vs Tank: Smoke Dischargers
Tank vs. Tank: Positions in Cover
Tanks and Pinning
Vehicle Special Rules


These various rules add historical detail to different types of vehicles.

Hidden Unit Counters
Simple “limited intelligence” rules so that both sides can use hidden unit counters.

Scenarios: This booklet includes six scenarios in two mini-campaigns. Most of the scenarios feature alternative forces, to increase replay value.
Campaign 1: Tanks and Panzers, somewhere near the Franco-German Border, 1944
Scenario 1: Thrust - US tanks engage the forward elements of a German kampfgruppe.
Scenario 2: Parry - A platoon of Panther tanks plays cat-and-Sherman with a group of 75mm-M4s.
Scenario 3: Lunge - Shermans and M-10s meet Panthers and Panzer IV’s in close terrain.

Campaign Two: Tables Turned, Eastern Front, Summer 1944
Scenario 1: Road Cut - Mixed Soviet armor cuts a road against a weak German blocking force.
Scenario 2: Panzerschlact - Panthers and StuGs counter-attack against defending T-34s and SU-85s.
Scenario 3: Kill the Cat - T-34s hunt a lone Panther.



The booklet also includes hidden unit markers, which add to the 23 page length.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Pop Music Trivia: Top of the Pops
description:
Hundreds of brain teasers in 6 categories. Complete on its own or as a great add on to other trivia games. Score points for each question answered game ends when a player has at least one of each category.
Categories of questions:-
Miscellaneous
Classic pop
Artist and titles 1980's
Artist and titles 1990's
Lyrics & Albums
Pop pickers
publishers: BBC Enterprises, Character Cut-Out Company Ltd

name: Kakazu Ridge: A WWII Mini-Campaign for the Battle of Okinawa – For A Sergeant's War and other games
description:
SOUTHERN OKINAWA: DAWN, 9 APRIL, 1945
The American 383rd Infantry Regiment has successfully infiltrated Kakazu Ridge and holds the crest, catching the Japanese completely by surprise. But the men of the 13th Independent Battalion won’t let go of the ridge without a fight.

In this mini-campaign, command either beleaguered American infantry, under constant attack and cut off from their heavy artillery, or lead Japanese troops in ferocious attacks up the slopes of Kakazu Ridge.

Historically, the American companies were decimated and thrown back, but not without mauling the Japanese battalion that faced them. How will you fare?

Kakazu Ridge is a 3-scenario mini-campaign portraying small-unit infantry combat during the Battle of Okinawa. It has been written for A Sergeant’s War, but can easily be adapted to other WWII rules sets.

The campaign includes:

Historical background, with maps and contemporary pictures
Campaign special rules
3 linked scenarios, with overall victory determined by holding terrain, overrunning the enemy, and inflicting casualties
A painting tutorial for 15mm Japanese infantry


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Sports Review of the Year: The official BBC quiz game
description:
A game for 2-4 players
Players or teams place a movement peg next to the die symbol on the playing board and it scoring peg below the BBC logo
Players or teams move their movement pegs round the board on throws of the die and answer the appropriate sporting questions
By correctly answering questions players or teams move there scoring pegs to spell S.P.O.R.T in turn and finally land on the Trophy symbol.
When the trophy question is answered correctly that player of team wins the game.
A great way of finding out over 1,000 fascinating facts on many different sports

—description from the back of the box

name: Word Mania
description:
A Hidden Word game
The object of the game is to list within the time limit as many correct words as possible. Words are formed from the assortment of letters arranged in the cube tray.

words are written down against the clock. from the cube which is randomised for each turn.

name: Grand Fleets (Third Edition): King & Kaiser – The Great War in the Atlantic, 1914-1915
description:
King & Kaiser is the first scenario book for the third edition of Grand Fleets. Within these pages, you will find everything you need to fight out the near-run thing that was the Great War at sea.

While great armies slogged through the Flanders mud and clashed over a sun-dried patch of Anatolian rock, the course of human affairs was directed by the men and machines that steamed the oceans of the world. Across the Atlantic, the Mediterranean, and the North Sea, two powerful navies battled for supremacy, a life-and-death struggle that resonated throughout the twentieth century.

King & Kaiser includes half a dozen scenarios from the early years of World War I.
Take on the role of Spee, Beatty, Hipper, or Admiral Sir John Jellicoe: the only man who could lose the war in an afternoon.
Also included are 160 individual ship cards from over 50 different classes of the Royal Navy and Kaiserliche Marine, along with every major warship in the service of the Austro-Hungarian navy during the Great War.

Do you have what it takes to keep the German threat bottled up at Kiel, making the seas safe for democracy?
Or can you break the back of the Grand Fleet and provide for the German Empire her place in the sun?

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Impondo Zankhomo: The Horns of the Bull – Rules for Fighting the Anglo Zulu War of 1879 With Miniatures
description:
Impondo Zankhomo, The Horns of the Bull is a set of rules for fighting the Anglo Zulu War of 1879 in miniature.

You will need:

some six sided dice (D6),
a pack of normal playing cards and
a few ammunition and shaken counters
as well as miniatures and
scenery


to play.

This book contains:

Comprehensive rules for fighting engagements involving British and Zulu forces.
Four scenarios with maps and orders of battle; Rorke's Drift, Crossing the Nyzane River, Isandlwana and the disaster at the Intombe.
A construction guide for building the mission at Rorke's Drift.
A guide to painting Zulus.
As well as further articles on scenery making and miniature painting.


—description from the publisher

name: The Natives Are Restless Tonight: A Set of Tabletop Miniatures Rules for Recreating Colonial Sieges
description:
The Natives Are Restless Tonight containing complete rules for recreating colonial siege games, an all-new pritable action card deck and a comprehensive guide to making a 28mm model of Rorke's Drift.

Although this version of the rules concentrates on the armies and units of the Anglo Zulu War these rules can be used for any similar conflict such as the Boxer Rebellion or the French Foreign Legion in North Africa.

—description from the publisher

name: Invasion of the Saucer People
description:
Invasion of the Saucer People is a set of tabletop miniatures rules for a multiplayer game of alien invasion and government interference set in America's heartland.

This pdf contains:

full rules,
a printable action card deck and
a template for you to make your own Alien Stowaways cards.


Lavishly illustrated with drawings and photographs.

—description from the publisher

name: Over the Hills & Far Away: Rules for Skirmishing in the Napoleonic Age
description:
Over the Hills and Far Away

Skirmish rules in a cinematic vein for fighting encounters in the Napoleonic wars.

Suitable for 2-6 players each controling 6-10 individual characters.

—description from the publisher

name: Tune into ... Nursery rhymes
description:
With beautiful illustrations and rhymes sung by children, the enjoyable and flexible games in this pack offer ideal opportunities to familiarise children with a range of nursery rhymes and develop aural memory. There are games at a variety of levels that can be played with individuals or small groups.

The players turn over the picture cards when they hear the corresponding nursery rhyme played on the CD. The winner is the first player to turn over all their cards. The various levels uses different ranges of pictures and tracks on the CD.

name: The Clemson Tiger Game: Death Valley Football
description:
Death Valley Football is a football strategy game in which you execute your offense by answering questions about Clemson football; everything from bowl games to record holders to rivalries to interesting facts about players, throughout Clemson's storied history.

In Death Valley Football, the object of the game is to gain yardage and score touchdowns by answering questions. All rules of football apply. Are you ready to play in Death Valley?

—description from the publisher

name: Enterprize
description:
Enterprize is a free preview of the upcoming second edition of Captaincy.

It is a complete and self-contained miniatures game about frigate encounters in the Revolutionary and Napoleonic wars.

It offers a new, streamlined introduction to the innovative Captaincy system and a carefully researched view of the frigate service at the end of the age of sail.

Wind, fire, fear, and determination are seen in new ways.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Narrow Seas: A Scenario Generator and Campaign for Small Actions in the Age of Sail
description:
Narrow Seas: A Scenario Generator and Campaign for Small Actions in the Age of Sail is a generic version of the scenario generator and campaign rules for Captaincy.

It's a meta-game that supplements whatever Age of Sail rules you currently use.

It depicts small fight-or-flight encounters between patrols, cargo ships, and raiders, using novel terrain generation and scoring rules to make these encounters very different from fleet battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Chaos Risk
description:
Risk has been a staple of the board gaming scene since it's original debute in 1957, and alongside Monopoly it's seen more variations and reskins that any other product available. But have you ever wished it were a bit more . . . insane?

Chaos Risk is a free downloadable supplement for Risk, a tactical board game produced by Hasbro.
As such it requires a standard (sometimes referred to as ‘classic’ or ‘traditional’) copy of the game that features the 42 territories divided into 6 continents.

Chaos Risk is not an officially licensed Risk game, and was developed as a free supplement to an official, boxed version of the game.

It has been produced and distributed digitally by Cascade Studios at no profit under their ‘Print and Play’ range of games as a high-resolution PDF document.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Diverse City
description:
The Queen has challenged two rival leaders to build a city together where all factions can live in peace. Each faction brings unique abilities, and more actions become available to players as the city grows. You'll need to build a diverse set of locations to win and become the new mayor. Can you unite the people and create Diverse City?

Diverse City is a fantasy-themed, worker placement, city building game for 1-2 players. The players are rival leaders competing to build and visit locations. As the city grows, more actions become available, but players must race to claim the diminishing real estate. Specialists can be hired, granting powerful abilities to combo and enhance player actions. Points are awarded for locations, specialists, and the diversity of factions represented. Whoever has the most points wins.

You and your rival take in turns placing workers on the border locations of the city. Where your workers intersect you place additional workers - place them on empty spaces to build new locations there, or on existing locations to perform new and powerful actions. Instead of placing a worker, you can recall all of your workers to perform the action of those spaces, including harvesting resources, building locations for new actions, and hiring specialists to improve productivity.

All cards that you build and hire are worth points. You gain bonus points for sets of different factions, building adjacent to other factions, and increasing the city’s population. As the name suggests, diversity is key to victory and becoming the new mayor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Bamboozle
description:
Test your powers of invention and bamboozle the other players by making the most plausible answers to some difficult questions. Score points for guessing the correct answer and persuading others that your answer is correct.
players take it in turns to roll the die and read out the corresponding question on the card. Every one except the card holder write an answer to the question and these and the correct answer are given by the card holder. Other players then vote on the answer they believe to be true.

name: Coca-Cola: Music Trivia Game
description:
Trivia game played on a 6x6 grid with players trying to get a line across categories:
70's
80's
groups
soloists
singles
america
coke

name: Host Your Own: New Year's Eve Games
description:
Comes with a CD for timing the games for the evening.
games include Trivia race CD track with questions for every one to try to answer
Manic memory game a CD track listing 30 items how many can you list afterwards
Who and where in the world from the given audio who can guess the location of the character
Rock and pop trivia CD track with questions for every one to try to answer
That was the year that was questions for you to guess the year
Audio snap each player owns a "shop" players try to name some thing beginning with a given letter that would be found in the current players shop.

—user summary

name: 人生ゲーム MOVE ! (Jinsei Game Move!)
description:
This Japanese version of the classic spin-and-write "The Game of Life" introduces four moving gears that can change the game state for all players every turn.

This is a Japanese game and is heavily language dependent. Instructions, board and components are entirely in Japanese.

—user summary

For the first time ever in The Game of Life, four moving gears change life for everyone!

In addition to the gears impacting the weather, marriage and employment, the course itself also changes. Each turn change your own life and other players' ... who knows what will happen!

—description from the publisher (translated)

人生ゲーム史上初！歯車（ギヤ）が全員の生活を変えてしまう！４つのギヤがそれぞれ運動！
景気、結婚、就職に影響を与えるほか、コース自体も変わってしまうので、過去最大級のどきどき感を味わうことができます。他人に人生を変えられたり自分で生活を変えたり、何が起こるかわからない人生を楽しめます。

—description from the publisher

name: Beer & Pretzels: The Napoleonic Wars
description:
Beer & Pretzels: The Napoleonic Wars

This rules set is designed for battalion-level Napoleonic war gaming engagements.

Many 15mm wargames are extremely cumbersome to learn, need a lot of paperwork and require a long time to play.
These rules are intended to provide a fast, fun game for both veterans and novice wargamers alike.
Obviously, house rules can be added for additional complexity – but this way you can build your own complexity as you go.

The game itself was designed by Napoleonic historian Robert Epstein.

—description from the publisher

name: Battle Fortress
description:
Battle Fortress is a tabletop war-game with two big differences:

NO DICE; Battle Fortress uses a Diceless mechanic;
RTS style gaming; You train/build the units you want to use in the battle.


The game was originally designed with younger players in mind, but we soon found experienced players enjoyed Battle Fortress just as much as any other wargame.

Battle Fortress can be played using any scale, post WW1 models.

Battle Fortress is a game that can be played anywhere, from the dining table to tournament size war gaming tables.

Now with dedicated rules for infantry, vehicles and super weapons for forces from WWII, and Science Fiction, no two games are ever alike.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Let's Play All Units Engage: Basic Infantry Operations
description:
Here is your free introduction to All Units Engage!

All Units Engage is a set of simple rules for skirmish games for two or more players. Play can be based around a handful of minis or include multiple squads.
The game plays equally well with 15mm or 28mm miniatures.

All Units Engage is a solid “old school” game with a modern perspective. It is a game that flows very well from turn-to-turn and player to player.
Games are intended to be short, with an emphasis on achieving objectives inside of a brief span of turns.

All Units Engage is a toolkit that invites you to play with the minis and models you already own.
The focus is on sci-fi, near-future and post-apocalyptic gaming, but the mechanics are flexible enough to support a wider variety of settings such as Cold War and even WWII.

All Units Engages uses ten-sided dice.
No templates are required and only a few basic markers are needed to track pins and reserve actions.

All Units Engage is casual, but complete. This introduction is only a taste of what AUE has to offer.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Sector Commander: World War II – Rule Book
description:
Sector Commander is a turn based WW2 board game based at Divisional level.

Steeped in historic units and equipment this game brings together elements from LCGs, board games and table top war games to create a realistic battle environment that will test your strategic prowess.

This is the main rule book for Sector Commander WW2 board game.
It takes you through all the basic and advanced rules for picking up and playing the game. In full colour with hundreds of diagrams and examples to walk you through the various stages of the game so you can learn it easily and quickly.

—description from the publisher

name: A Foreign Field
description:
A Foreign Field

A skirmish battle in the mud and blood of World War 1.

Imagine a small section of the front, with nothing but the lowest ranks involved on both sides, attacking the enemy at range and hand-to-hand, once the Hell that is No-Man's-Land has been crossed.
There is no mercy to be had or given and the only way is forward, whatever you're walking into.

A print and play game with all you need (except dice and pencils) in pdf format.

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom
description:
Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom is a novel historical miniature rules system for simu­lating the violent clash of armies in the American Civil War.

Designed for large-scale battles and with an emphasis on strategic planning, Shouting the Battle Cry of Freedom is a Corps and Division level simulation intended to be played by 2 - 10 players.

Players maneuver brigades and batteries, alternating movement and combat in turns that represent 30 minutes of real time.

The table scale is 18” to a mile or about 100 yards per inch.

Features:

Extensive fog of war allows you to deceive the enemy as to your actual strength....
Grand tactical charges with up to an entire corps....
Division commanders seize the initiative, interrupting their opponent’s moves....
Tactical firefights in addition to fire, charge and melee....
Unique rules for extra tactical movement, passthrough and disorder....
Unknown effect of battlefield terrain until units actually move into it....
Reconnaissance in force by cavalry gives it a valuable role....


—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Clash of Galleys: Large Fleet Battles in the Ancient World
description:
Clash of Galleys!


Fleets crash together in this simulation of large ancient naval battles.
Maneuver your squadrons in tight formations to:

Hurl Greek fire at your opponents!
Blast them with archers and ballistas!
Ram and rake them!
Grapple and board to capture them!


Clash of Galleys is a set of miniature naval rules for the era of oared warships, covering roughly 500 BC to 400 AD.

The rules are written to be played with 1:1200 scale miniatures on a one and one half inch hex grid. (But components that allow Clash of Galleys to be played as a board game are provided in an Appendix.)

The rules are intended for large battles of up to 50 or more ships on a side.
Ships are organized into squadrons of 5 - 8 ships each.
Each player normally plays one or two squadrons although experienced players could play more squadrons.

Several scenarios are included with the rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Aerial Battles 1915-1918: Air Wargame Rules for the First World War
description:
Aerial Battles 1915-1918

WARGAMES RULES FOR AIR COMBAT IN THE FIRST WORLD WAR

Recommended scales: 1/144 TO 1/300; 1/72 OR 1/600 possible
Complexity: 4/10

A SET OF QUICK REFERENCE SHEETS IS AVAILABLE THROUGH THE PUBLISHER'S WEBSITE

These rules are intended to allow two or more Players to have a fast and simple game representing tactical air combat during the Great War in the period from 1915 to 1918; at this time air combat was in its infancy.

Model aircraft of any scale from 1/600th to 1/72nd, can be used. If necessary you could also use card counters.

Minimal bookkeeping is required because Markers or Tokens are used to indicate the status of aircraft during the game. Furthermore you do not need to use a hex mat.

The capabilities of aircraft within the game have been calculated, taking a common aircraft type of average performance as the base line, in this case the Albatros D.III. All other aircraft capabilities relate to how they compare with this aircraft. It is possible that the performance of this or that aircraft might not match your expectations based on anecdotal evidence. We make no apology for this as we are not trying to create a simulation. The resulting data has been kept to a simple format, which enables a Player to control several aircraft during a game, and the overall gaming experience will be improved if multiple Players attempt to “co-operate” on each side.

The abilities of pilots and crew are represented by having Skill Factors. These determine how well they fly their aircraft, their chances of hitting the target when shooting, and avoiding serious damage if their own aircraft is hit. Pilot skill is vitally important in air combat, and Players will need to learn where to position their best pilots, as well as to protect their novice aviators . In the case of aircraft with several crew members, Skill is determined for the crew as a whole. You do not need to keep track of individual crew.

To carry out any action other than level flight requires the expenditure of one or more Orders, which may also require a successful Skill Test. Orders are generated each turn and better leaders generally mean more Orders.
While air combat is probably what most players will want play, there are also rules for Ground Attack, Bombing, Photo Reconnaissance and Balloon Busting.

Altitude represented during the game assumes that the main combat is taking place in roughly the same area of the sky, and it is possible to climb or dive to gain an advantage, or try to escape.

Players alternate the activation of their aircraft. Optional Tactical Cards can be used during the game to provide additional detail.

Data is provided for most aircraft that were in action during the First World War.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Naval Warfare: Battleships to Dreadnoughts – Squadron & Fleet Action 1895 to 1920
description:
Naval Warfare: Battleships to Dreadnoughts - Squadron & Fleet Action 1895 to 1920

Naval Wargaming rules for the period around 1895 through to 1920 covering the Pre-Dreadnought and Dreadnought eras.
The rules are illustrated throughout with examples of play to aid learning.

Included are:

The rules (57 pages including ship data)
two sheets of game record counters - to aid game play.
Three 'Quick Reference Sheets' for eras 1895-1908, 1909 - 1914, and 1914 +
An Excel file on which you can deploy data for your owned ships to make information counters to place by them
Word files giving alternative formats for recording your ship data on a single table or individual 'card sized' tables that can be placed in plastic card sleeves.


Gunfire is in factors: Ships have four states of damage/ deterioration and Critical hits.

Simple command and control rules allow for the poor communications that existed in this era.

Data is included for ships for the period for:

German,
Great Britain,
Italy,
France,
Japan,
Russia, and
the USA.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Naval Warfare: Age of Missiles
description:
Naval Warfare: Age of Missiles

A game of modern naval warfare.

The set includes all you need to play including:

an illustrated rulebook,
Counter sheets of ships, missiles, aircraft, Helicopters, and
record counters and
data cards.


In addition there is a Spreadsheet to aid the design of your own ships.

The game can be played with models or using the counters provided.

The rules cover:

Detection,
missile,
gunnery,
torpedoes, and
defensive fire,
Electronic warfare,
helicopters, and
airstrikes


using a simple d6 system, with symbols for each weapon system.

A single A4 full colour starter sheet of counters provides all that you need to get you started. Other counter sheets provide a range of NATO and Soviet vessels from the 1980s-90s, and all of the record counters needed to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Devil's Pact
description:
Who will succumb to the temptation of the Devil’s Pact?
Try to guess it to win the most points!
Devil’s Pact is a party game with simple rules.
Play hilarious and devilishly crazy games!

A game is played in several consecutive rounds divided into two phases:

The Choice
Read the Pact proposed by the Devil and choose if you accept it...

The Judgement
Earn points by guessing who succumbed to the temptation of the Pact!
The player with the most Victory points wins the game!

name: FourWord Thinkers
description:
Four Word Thinkers is a simple strategy game of grabbing letters and making secret words - four-letter words to be exact. This spelling game is good for both adults and children five and up.

Play in rounds, each round comprises four "grabs", where players strategically grab a single letter tile. At the end of exactly four rounds, players reveal the word(s) they made.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Grendha: Origins
description:
Grendha: Origins Expansion is the prequel of Grendha: Search for Lost Triumphs. The Origins is a wondrous story of Arnorus's fight between vicious predators of Meru and with his confederates Mirgoth, Kondu, and Genu. Grendha: Origins gives a sneak-peek into both Arnorus and Meru's past. This addon is a standalone game and an entirely co-op/solo gameplay for 1-4 players.
The game starts with the exploration of arnoru with his allies to dominate the planet Meru. Four heroes combine their strength to destroy the creatures on the planet. The territories have a strange connection with one another, to capture an area, the four heroes should explore and find the territories which are interconnected. The dangerous creatures have many odd powers that can only be defeated by great strategy. The primary power source of each dangerous monsters lies in different territories. The clue for destroying each creature lies within the hands of many wizards and witches. You have to draw each event card in the time of gameplay to see the clues hidden.

Attacking a territory and conquering it doesn't mean the dangerous monsters are fully annihilated. They can always come back, so spend your energy wisely before you exhaust. The provinces on the planet have many mysterious behaviours. By using the combination of technology, magic, weapons, and armies, you should dominate the planet.

Gameplay overview:
The four warriors start from their home base. An event card is used to see the current situation of the planet. The event cards will tell how crucial it is to make a journey to any territories. For example, the event of the day states that now there is heavy rainfall, which causes you to exhaust your energy two times more than your usual travel. The event card will also indicate the connection of the territory with another territory. There will be certain symbols for showing the links of territories.

Green skull symbol: shows a connection with one territory.
Orange Skull Symbol: Shows a connection with two territories.
Red Skull symbol: shows a connection with three territories.

To destroy a monster in a territory A, the players should place their diplomacy card or resistance card(depends on the type of monster you are dealing with) in the linked territory to diffuse their mysterious power. For example, if Arnoru have to destroy a monster in the territory 'A,' which is of green skull symbol, the other warrior should place his diplomacy card or resistance Card in the other territory 'C.' If its done, Arnoru can give a perfect strike to the monster, and the beast will destroy.
If there is only one player, The player should deploy his Resistance or diplomacy card in multiple territories and should target the regions he/she should attack later.
Thus you should capture the celestial city and make the planet Meru a real heaven.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Events, Movement Points, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: FourSight Word Game
description:
Four Sight is a fast-paced literacy/spelling game of assembling four-letter words from an everchanging assortment of tiles comprised of three-letter words and single letter tiles. Convert a three-letter word into a four-letter word by adding single letter.

—description from the designer

name: Rally Round the Flag
description:
Rally Round The Flag is a fast paced easy to understand game system for use in the time of The American Civil War 1861 to 1865.

Scott Monsour has captured the historical flavor of one of America's bloodiest conflicts and in doing so has created a truly unique game system for use with miniatures (both 15 mm and 25 mm scales).

This book supplies the gamer with army organizations and morale rating for regiments, brigades, divisions and corps for both Confederate and Union armies.

Command structure and leadership are an integral part of the system design.
Movement and Combat are deftly handled in a simple yet accurate method, easy to understand and fast in play.
The reader is supplied with two game scenarios which include orders of battle, command ratings and battle maps.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Pike Hack: The Road to Dunbar
description:
In the 17th Century, three English civil wars produced a new and truly Great Britain. In the first and second wars (1648-49), supporters of King Charles I clashed with the supporters of the Long Parliament, while the third war (1649-51) pitted supporters of King Charles II against supporters of the Rump Parliament. It all ended with the execution of King Charles I, the exile of his son, King Charles II, and the shifting of the seat of government power. The outcomes of these battles are well documented, but what would be different had the troops of King Charles II prevailed at the Battle of Worcester or if Sir John Hotham failed to keep Charles I from entering Hull?
Pike Hack: The Road to Dunbar may have some plausible answers.

In this fun and fast-paced game, players use D-10 dice for casualty and morale calculations and D-6 dice for additional movement (evades and pursuits). The D-10 system for casualty and morale eliminates the endless modifiers that tend to make each move a monotonous chore.
Basing figures, a common practice in many other popular game systems, is not essential to Pike Hack: The Road to Dunbar, since movement and engagements are based on numerical and figurative representations. For example, the system allows for infantry ranging from six to twelve figures and cavalry from four to ten figures; both are representations of much larger forces.
Players are not, however, limited to small representations, as the game is designed to accommodate complete armies.

An added wrinkle in this system is the use of directional dice for command control and first artillery fire. We found that the use of directional dice for these functions keeps the game streamlined, fast-paced, realistic and fun.

The appendix contains tactical information, color illustrations to better explain tactics, and four pages of suggested army compositions. Because there are several different types of units, players are also provided with sample army lists and blank templates for composing custom lists.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: The G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Compendium: Quick Start Rules
description:
Since it's initial publication in 2000, Glorious Adventures in Science Loosely Involving Generally Historical Times (G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.) has been the standard by which all other sets of rules for Victorian Science Fiction games are judged.

The G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. Compendium includes all the material from four books:

G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.,
Battles by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.,
Adventures and Expeditions by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.., and
To Be Continued… by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T.


In addition The Compendium includes new rules for airship fleet battles and more detailed rules for aerial vehicles in G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T. or Battles by G.A.S.L.I.G.H.T..
The vehicle hit charts have been revised and combined, and there are specific vehicle hit results for walking, driving, flying, and legged vehicles.
The record sheets used during game play have been completely revised.

With the Compendium you can play Pulp and VSF games from the large battles, through skirmishes, to role playing. It's all here in one volume.

The GASLIGHT Quick Start Rules are a way to easily jump right into your first GASLIGHT game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Spring in eine Pfütze!: Das Brettspiel
description:
In 2020, Viktoria and Sarina are the hosts of a YouTube channel with more than 1.6 million followers, and they're the authors of the book series "Spring in eine Pfütze!" ("Jump in a Puddle!")

Spring in eine Pfütze! – Das Brettspiel gives readers a chance to jump in the world of these books, competing in four different task categories — "Gift", "Friend Battle", "Imagine", and "Friend Assessment" — to see who knows their friends well and will use that knowledge to increase their odds of winning.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Blast Tactics
description:
A battle to the finish! Blast Tactics is a tabletop take on your favorite strategic bomber battle royale video game series!

Blast Tactics is a rebrand with new mechanisms of former officially licensed Super Bomberman R: Blast Tactics that was cancelled upon IDW Games closure.

A turn-based tactical take on your favorite video game series!

A simple to play ruleset that allows for millions of ways a game can play out. A shrinking arena allows for an exciting finale with a finite end! A custom arena with extra variant components and arena pieces allow for a large amount of replayability.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Command Cards, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Sudden Death Ending

name: Commit the Garde!: Waterloo
description:
Commit the Garde! - Waterloo

The first add-on scenario for Commit the Garde!

The classic final battle of the Napoleonic wars.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Above the Clouds!: Missile Age
description:
Missile Age is an expansion product for Above the Clouds! (which is required for use).
Missile Age takes air combat beyond the age of gunfighters which fought in the skies over Korea, incorporating early missile armed air combat.

In addition to expanding the rules to cover missile combat between aircraft (including RADAR, rudimentary ECM, etc.), Missile Age also adds ground-to-air combat including mass FlaK battery barrages, individual anti-aircraft artillery (AAA) sites, Surface to Air Missiles (SAMs), and Man-Portable Air Defense missiles (ManPADs).

While we were at it, we decided to incorporate some optional rules for Above the Clouds, some based upon suggestions from veteran players. These include an alternate maneuver order, limitations for tailing friendly aircraft, and non-simultaneous gun combat resolution.

Missile Age includes the first scenario package, Route Pack 6, which covers the air combat which occurred in South-East Asia from the mid 1960s and 1970s.

Route Pack 6 contains aircraft performance displays (APDs) for 28 aircraft, 4 models of Air-to-Air Missile (including 20 versions of those missiles), and one SAM system, the SA-2 (in 4 versions)

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Above the Clouds!: Shark Mouths and Blood Chits
description:
Shark Mouths and Blood Chits is an expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

It covers the early period of World War II in China, during the American Volunteer Group’s (AVG) fight with the Japanese Army’s air units from December 1941-July 1942.

Shark Mouths and Blood Chits includes:

18 historical encounters,
2 hypothetical encounters, and
19 all new Aircraft Performance Displays (APDs)


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Across the Yalu
description:
Across the Yalu is the most ambitious expansion for Above the Clouds! to date.

Across the Yalu expands the game beyond World War II into the dawn of the jet age, featuring the air battles of the Korean War.

Across the Yalu includes twenty-nine APDs including twenty-four completely new aircraft.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Above the Clouds!: Blitz!
description:
Blitz! is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Blitz! provides the aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the epic aerial battles over France and the Battle of Britain.

Blitz! includes the following 24 new APDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Pointblank
description:
On June 14th, 1943, the Combined Chiefs of Staff issued the Pointblank directive, which authorized the initiation of Operation Pointblank, the code name for the primary portion of the Allied Combined Bomber Offensive intended to cripple or destroy the German aircraft fighter strength, thus drawing it away from frontline operations and ensuring it would not be an obstacle to the invasion of Northwest Europe.

Pointblank provides the Aircraft Performance Displays (APDs) required to fight the air engagements over Western Europe during 1943-1945.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Road to Rabaul
description:
Road to Rabaul is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Road to Rabaul provides the aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the encounters of the Pacific Air War during 1943-1944.

Road to Rabaul includes 19 APDs

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Desert Falcons
description:
Desert Falcons is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.
