Desert Falcons provides aircraft performance displays (APDs) for the Italians as well as additional Allied and German APDs used primarily in the Mediterranean and North African theaters.

Desert Falcons includes 21 APDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Fall Weiss
description:
Fall Weiss is the first expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Fall Weiss covers the earliest period of World War II, the Polish campaign (1939), the "Winter War" between Finland and Russia (1939-1940), and the "Sitz-krieg" (the waiting-war between France-Britain and Germany from 1939 through early 1940).

Fall Weiss includes 6 historical encounters and 39 new Aircraft Performance Displays (APDs)

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Setting Sun
description:
Setting Sun is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Setting Sun provides the aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the encounters of the last year of the Pacific Air War, from July 1944 - August 1945.

Setting Sun includes 17 APDs including 11 completely new APDs

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Above the Clouds!: Cactus
description:
Cactus is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Cactus provides the aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the epic aerial battles over Guadalcanal and the Solomon Islands.

Cactus includes 8 new APDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Elastic Warfare: Rubber Band of Brothers
description:
It’s Saturday morning, with the cartoons on the television and adventures running through your head. With grim determination, you pull back the elastic band and take aim. The tension builds and your fingers begin to tremble as the army man is centered in your sights.

The plastic soldier stood still, believing itself to be safely in cover behind the couch leg. It doesn’t even hear the snap of the elastic as he sails into the air from the force of the blow.

Welcome to Elastic Warfare.

Elastic Warfare is a ruleset for tactical miniature wargaming to be played with a standard set of army men and a set of rubber bands designed to be played in your existing living room.

The ruleset is inspired by "Little Wars" by H.G. Wells in creating a ruleset for children and adults using toys they already own. The rules are extremely simple-to-learn utilizing only simple measurements and dexterity based shooting.

The advanced rules add strategy, without adding complexity in the form of a tactical deck. Move as many soldiers as you want, but the more you move the greater the risk of falling for an enemy ploy.

Features:

This ruleset does not require anything past a measuring device, a set of army men and a handful of rubber bands
It requires no specialized terrain, as it's designed to use your existing tables, chairs, and furniture as the battlefield. Or play on your tabletop using the included Tabletop-Scale rules.
Accuracy in this game is based on player skill with a rubber band and terrain is physically placed. This means combat is quick, and simple to learn even for children.


—description from the publisher

name: Tales of Murder: A solitaire game of crime-solving and storytelling
description:
A gathering of guests from afar, a stormy night and a deathly scream that fills the halls. The guests rush towards the sound to find themselves standing over a corpse… their host has been murdered!

But, unbeknownst to the killer, you’ve made your living and your fame as an investigator.
Can you find the murder weapon, narrow the list of suspects and accuse the killer before the storm ends and they escape the scene?

Tales of Murder

A playable murder-mystery for one player
Mechanics that are structured enough to maintain gameplay flow, but focus on telling unique stories with every game
6 possible murder weapons, 11 Area's of Interest, 15 types of suspects, 36 events makes for unlimited stories
Each suspect has unique behaviors and effects on the story
A simple pre-made tutorial case to teach you the major rules through play


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Fireteam: Tactics – Sci-Fi Brick Combat
description:
FIRETEAM: Tactics (FTT for short) is a tactical tabletop war game designed for small-scale battles with plastic brick models and figures.

The action takes place in the near future where aliens are invading Planet Earth - or, as a matter of fact, anywhere you want it to, as long as there are battles involved.
Gameplay is mission-based and allows advancement for any surviving characters, adding RPG-elements into the mix.
There is no requirement for measuring tapes or rulers. Most dice rolls in FTT are made with twelve-sided dice.

Except for the hexagon-patterned surface of the battlefield itself, which you can have printed on vinyl, canvas, or any other suitable material at your local printer, everything on the table is represented through plastic bricks and compatible figures. Units as well as obstacles and terrain pieces will look amazing, given you are a skilled enough builder and have some Lego or other brick building toys at your disposal. As one might easily figure out, there's a significant advantage over using traditional glued and painted miniatures in a game like this: When something falls and breaks (you know it WILL), there's no reason to suffer a nervous breakdown over the amount of elaborate work that went into it. Instead, putting things back together will take just a couple of seconds.

Just like the building brick toys that inspired me, FTT is a modular system designed with expandability in mind. This means the core document will provide you with mostly basic rules, but other content, such as units, weapons, and missions, is kept separate, making it easier to customize the game and add more content. While you will quickly realize how accessible the creation of your own material is, I probably won’t be able to resist providing you with extra content in the long run, as well. Expect more settings, scenarios, game modes, units, weapons, powers, and rule expansions from me in the future, as my building brick collection grows and evolves.

Download your core rules PDF for free. I don’t intend to make any money off this project, and I will do my best to keep fine-tuning and updating the rules and other downloadable files according to any feedback I receive.
In addition to the core rules, you will need the following to play the game:

DIY printables: battle mat, stickers, unit cards, and weapon cards – included with your download
Unit spreadsheet: Required for creating custom units by yourself – included with your download
Dice: 4-sided, 6-sided, 8-sided, 10-sided, 12-sided, 20-sided, at least one of each
And last but not least, fitting plastic brick building toys to make the game pieces and matching figures.


For the standard flavour the core rules where designed in mind with, I recommend using contemporary or futuristic-looking soldiers, aliens and robots – figures best found in various Lego sci-fi themes, such as “Alpha Team”, “Exo Force”, “Space Police”, “Alien Conquest”, and “Galaxy Squad”. Weapons and gear from third-party manufacturers such as Brickarms or Brickforge work like a charm on these.

For best results, customizing figures by mixing and matching their components is key. Obstacles and other terrain pieces are simply built from bricks.

—description from the designer / publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Fireteam: Tactics – Agency VS Invaders
description:
FIRETEAM: Tactics (FTT for short) is a tactical tabletop war game designed for small-scale skirmish battles with building brick models and figures.

In this additional PDF, you will be provided with gaming resources on two opposing factions for the game: The Earth-defending Agency and the alien Invaders.
In the second part of the document, you can find suggestions for various mission setups.
When organized into a campaign, the outcome of each battle has an impact on the remaining conflict and its final resolution.

This product includes brick building instructions.

—description from the publisher

name: WW2 Clash of Patrols
description:
WW2 Clash of Patrols

is a simple skirmish game where patrols of 8-12 figures clash between enemy lines.

Could be played with 20 or 28mm figures or even 54mm figures.

Rather than using a fixed points value for each side you simply create your force and the difference in points value between the opposing forces becomes extra victory points for the weaker force.

There are example forces for all the major powers and many of the minor nations involved in the war.

The rules could easily be used in other conflicts such as the Spanish Civil War and the Korean War.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Spec Ops: A Gruntz Module
description:
SpecOps is a Gruntz Module that brings the exciting second-to-second action of Special Operations missions and campaigns to the tabletop.

NEW RULES: New rules for stealth operations, contact blips, hacking enemy soldiers and more!

NEW WEAPONS and EQUIPMENT: Specialist grenades, expanded weapon lists and more armor types to outfit your operatives. Hack enemy cybernetics with SLAM modules!

NEW MISSIONS: Eight new missions along with a branching campaign make running your games easy and interesting.

NEW TEAM TYPES: Choose from eight different types of teams with their own unique perkz each and further customize your troops with Species Traits to represent Aliens and Humans.

NEW OFF-BOARD RESOURCES: Light up your enemy with a UAV drone, or maybe an orbital strike with your new off-board resources.

NEW CAMPAIGN MODE: Advance your skills, build up your equipment stores and nurse your wounds with the new campaign mode that keeps your operatives from game to game.

Includes Supplement #1: Squads, Solo and Co-op!
This Supplement contains rules for using regular squads in your game as both additions to your force, as opposing forces controlled by the other player, or as non-player controlled forces in solo and co-op play.

This supplement also contains a solo/co-op scenario which pits two SpecOps operatives trying to escape from indigenous personnel.

The Gruntz Ver 1.1 rulebook is required for this module.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: COPAN
description:
We are in the city of Copan that quickly grew during the Maya period. The Maya leader Yax Kuk Mo, came from the area of Tikal (Petén) and arrived in the Copán Valley in 427 AD.
He started the dynasty that transformed Copán into one of the great Maya cities.

Each player controls a Caste of Architects and Workers: your goal is to form Partnership with the other players Caste for building various buildings and temples, increasing in this way the social prestige. The Caste Architects try to create alliances with the Caste of Workers and vice versa, so the Players, send their Priests and Warriors emissaries to occupy temples and other buildings constructed to handle the politic, culture, worship, and the pelota game. They will be ready to human sacrifices too.
The human sacrifices, the expansion of buildings for the construction of Copan, the increase of social prestige, and of the pelota game, should have the right balance to earn Maya points.
At the end of game, the player who has more Maya points wins, and becomes the first of the sixteen Kings of Copan.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Go Waterloo
description:
Go Waterloo

Combining the elegance and simplicity of a Napoleonic wargame with the gritty realism and historical accuracy of the classic board game Go, Go Waterloo is likely the worst game designed in decades.
Improbably playable but lacking in any of the redeeming values of its dual inspirations, only hard core fans of either Go or Waterloo Historical Wargames will find it even minutely attractive.

Interesting for the novelty of a game so badly off the mark that it is hard to describe. Truly one must endure a session of play to appreciate how these two genres have been mixed!!

Go stones not included.

—description from the publisher

name: Scum of the Earth: Rules Pack
description:
Scum of the Earth: Rules Pack

This expansion pack to 'Scum of the Earth adds rules for new unit types:

Pistoleer cavalry, Swordsmen, Musketeers, Frontier infantry, Forlorn hope and Partisans.

You also get optional and variant rules covering:

Cavalry pursuits, Forced marches, Street fighting, passage of time and commander blinders.

We round out the content with 8 new traits including "Glory hound commander" and "Living off the land".

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play

name: Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805
description:
Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805

Super simple and fast, introductory game of naval combat in the age of sails and black powder.

To play Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805 you will only need:

a piece of flat surface (perfect is 3x3' / 90x90cm),
printed counters,
universal movement template and rules, and
few six sided dices.


Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805 is ship-to-ship, i-go-you-go battle game which doesn’t need to be played with any specific scenario. However, it was created to replay battle of Trafalgar and at the end of our short rulebook, you can find historical setting for both British and Franco-Spanish fleets.

So grab a friend, some dices and sail for glory!

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Sails & Powder: Cape Finisterre
description:
Welcome to the Sails & Powder: Cape Finisterre - expansion to the game Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805.

This expansion replaying part of Trafalgar Campaign - battle of Cape Finisterre (22 July 1805) where British fleet under Admiral Robert Calder fought an indecisive naval battle against the combined Franco-Spanish fleet returning from West Indies, and introducing new class of battleships: frigate (Class 5) - also available in mini expansion Sails & Powder: Cape Ortegal.

To play this expansion, core game Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805 is required.

Whats inside:

41 ships counters together with historical setting
stats for new class of ships (frigate)
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Sails & Powder: Cape Ortegal
description:
Sails & Powder: Cape Ortegal
- mini expansion to the game Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805.

This expansion replaying final act of Trafalgar Campaign which was battle of Cape Ortegal and introducing new class of battleships: frigate (Class 5) - also available in expansion Sails & Powder: Cape Finisterre.

The Battle of Cape Ortegal (known sometimes also as Strachan’s Action) took place on 4 November 1805 and was the final action of the Trafalgar Campaign, fought between a squadron of the Royal Navy and a remnant of the fleet that had been destroyed earlier at the Battle of Trafalgar.

To play this expansion, core game Sails & Powder: Trafalgar 1805 is required.

Whats inside:

12 ships counters together with historical setting
stats for new class of ships (frigate)


—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Above the Clouds!: Flat Top
description:
'Flat Top' is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the Above the Clouds! air-combat miniature wargame rules.

Flat Top provides the aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the epic carrier battles of 1942 in the Pacific and Indian oceans.

Flat Top includes 25 APDs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: ပုစ္ဆာ (Pote Sar)
description:
One player is the Clue-giver and looks at the images of the cards in their hand. From one of these, she makes up a sentence and says it out loud (without showing the card to the other players).

Each other player selects the card in their hands which best matches the sentence and gives the selected card to the storyteller, without showing it to the others.

The storyteller shuffles her card with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player has to bet upon which picture was the storyteller's.

If nobody or everybody finds the correct card, the storyteller scores 0, and each of the other players scores 2. Otherwise the storyteller and whoever found the correct answer score 3. Players score 1 point for every vote for their own card.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: It's Been Emotional
description:
It's Been Emotional a new strategic card game; unleash powerful emotions against your opponents, ride the emotional roller coaster, fend off attacks, survive the onslaught.....

The game includes over 160+ playing cards, 80 powerful emotion cards split into 10 different families identified by unique colour themes and power traits. Features game-changing Pick-Me-Up’s & Putdown’s, which boost or hinder your chances. Change the course of the game with random DRAMA cards, because who doesn't like a bit of chaos and let's not forget the all-powerful BRAINFART cards to block your opponents at every turn.

Up the ante by playing MISSION mode with specific win conditions for the ultimate test. Expansion packs including NSFW and new armies and new powers that will literally blow your mind!!!

How to Play
Ensure to separate out the MISSION and RULE cards (White back Image) from the rest of the main playing cards.

Shuffle the deck (all black backed cards) and deal 4 cards face down to each player to form their initial playing HAND. Put the remaining cards into the center of the playing space to form the DRAW Pile.

Each player takes a turn moving clockwise and each turn is made up of 4 different phases:

START: Activate powers from the MOOD
DRAW: Take 1 card, forgot power .. Too Late!
PLAY: Play 1 card or DRAW 1 card
END: DISCARD cards over the HAND limit (no more than 8 cards in your hand)

KEY TERMS
HAND: Cards in your hand (i.e. not the MOOD)
MOOD: Where you store cards to activate them
DISCARD: Add to the DISCARD pile
DRAW: Take a card from the DRAW pile
SUPPRESS: Remove a card from your MOOD
DESTROY: Force opponent to remove a card from their MOOD, added to discard pile

/b GAME CHANGERS /b
DRAMA: Change the course of the game, effecting one or more players. After being played add to DISCARD pile

BRAINFART: Play during anyones turn to stop play. Reversed by another instant card. All in- play cards go to DISCARD pile

PICK ME UP: A positive effect you can add to your own MOOD. If you forgot to use effects….too bad!

PUT DOWN: A negative effect used against opponents. Players must store in their MOOD & adhere to the effects

MISSION** : Play the game with or without random MISSION cards; each player is given secret win conditions


Optional: play with MISSION cards, shuffle mission cards, dealing one (facedown) to each player. You can choose to allow one swap in which case shuffle the returned mission into the pack and allow player to select a new mission


The first to collect 8 emotion cards (+ meet MISSION objectives) in their MOOD wins. Make the victory sweeter by exclaiming: "Its Been Emotional"

name: The Desolate Waste: Campaign Sourcebook
description:
The Desolate Waste Campaign is a post-apocalyptic, science-fiction campaign designed to be used with a slightly modified version of Gruntz where we make extensive use of the specialists, commanders, and monster rules to allow for a more nuanced skirmish style game. A basic person or Crew Member will use the Gruntz specialist template with scout level damage capacity.
Characters and Crew Leaders will use the Commander templates and abilities. Large monsters like dragons, large demons and inter-dimensional monstrosities will use the monster rules.
The first thing you will need to do is create a Crew Leader and 2-5 Crew Members.
You will need to generate their background, their class, goals and motivations and buy any special talents or abilities and their starting gear and weapons. You will also need to choose your groups initial allegiance to one of the many Power Groups.

Your Crew will need to acquire food, water, clothing or armor, weapons, ammo and eventually transport and energy or fuel. Life in the Desolate Waste is a constant struggle for survival.

The Desolate Waste Campaign is a set of rules for playing skirmish games in an original post-apocalyptic setting using the Gruntz 15mm ruleset.
It provides 25 linked scenarios and a sample crew and crew leader as wella s a complete description of the Town of Crossroads. The Scenarios tell the story of Earl Moore and his road crew and their overthrow of the wicked Viola Chance while defending from an invasion from Precinct 8.

The campaign setting also provides complete rules for surviving in the Waste, meeting contacts, performing jobs and complete descriptions and backgrounds of the 11 power groups in the Waste. There are also tables for random encounters in the Waste as well as generating salvage and job rewards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Alpha Centauri Campaign I
description:
The Rising Storm

The representatives of a local preservation society from a world within the sector, called Heaven's Gate, have been working with the governments of Earth for the last two decades. These representatives have helped scientists from around the globe in understanding the very advanced technologies of the Synod of Worlds.

As a result, the overall level of technology for the planet has jumped far ahead of what was predicted and the Earth is on the cusp of a new era of exploration and war. Planetary and orbital defenses have been manufactured non stop since the Prometheus Revelation. Planetary Defense Forts are littered around the globe on volcanic islands and barren mountain ranges in order to minimized collateral damage. Armies of powered armor, tanks and mecha fighting vehicles have been rolling off of the production lines and the men and women who will pilot them trained relentlessly in thier use. New tactics and weapons have been developed and the beginnings of a space navy are taking shape.

The preservation societies cannot provide warships to the Terrans but only old and frail cargo haulers of various sizes. Many of these have been put to use building a naval shipyard in the asteroid belt. The first of many warships are not due to for completion for many months and even more months for shakedown and training of its crews. The rest of the second hand frieghters are being hastily converted, with some advisor's assistance, into heavily armed Q-ships and commerce raiders. A half dozen bulk frieghters are being converted into military transport ships and one enormous bulk goods ship into a fleet carrier capable fo carrying squadrons of drone fighters. The first Operation of this new fleet would be to establish a base in the nearby system of Alpha Centauri.

The Alpha Centauri system lies on the main trade route and shipping lane through the sector. It is one of the many links in the jump chain between the Jump Gate worlds of Heavan's Gate and Lion's Gate. Jump sensors will be placed around the main jumps points and a ground base will be placed on the only habitable world in the system, Alpha Centauri 3a, nicknamed Plymouth Rock by the predominately American ground forces.

The Alpha Centauri Campaign uses a Logistics Point and Intelligence Point system to represent the Tail of the military force you are commanding on the table-top and to give you a real sense of growing or depleting resources with each victory or loss. Intelligence Points earned represent the ebb and flow of information on the battlefield. In order to play another scenario you must spend Logistics and/or Intelligence points as you attempt to find, fix and destroy your enemy. It is fairly simple and uncomplicated.

The campaign is compatible with the Full Thrust, Stargrunt II and Dirtside II rules systems available for free from Ground Zero Games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Sentai Campaign I
description:
Sowing the Wind

Our Preservation Society Liason, Tosk, has filled in some of our knowledge concerning the local sector. He has advised us to seek out allies for we are not strong enough to take on the entire Synod of Worlds alone. While the Synod is a vast conglomeration and possesses incalculable resources, it is weak locally. The Sentai system is the lynchpin of commerce within the system.

The Sentai system is heavily defended and will not be easy to gain control of. It contains the shipyards and orbital manufacturing that Earth will need to build ships and weapons and currently lacks. The Synod knows this and is gathering a fleet in the system to protect it and to launch and offensive against Earth. In order to destroy this fleet and secure our safety we need to gather an armada of like minded allies.

Tosk has given us the coordinates of six potential allies within the sector: Sera, Adama, Akra'hom, Trii'hom, Principality and De'nada. We will send diplomatic missions to each of these worlds and seek their aid and offer our assistance in return. They may be friendly but then again they may not. So we will proceed with caution.

The Terran Campaign against the Synod continues...


New ships
New Units
12 New Scenarios for Stargrunt II, Dirtside II an Full Thrust


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Sentai Campaign II
description:
Reaping the Whirlwind...

The naval portion of the Battle of Sentai is over and very costly. The carrier Enterprise went down with all hands fighting three Synod destroyers. Her fighters destroyed a Synod battlewagon and a heavy cruiser. The Ark Royal rotated the combined fighter groups of both carriers throughout the battle and kept them in the fight. Her own planes destroyed the three ships that had jumped the Enterprise and the combined groups claimed another heavy cruiser and a light cruiser before the day was out.

The light cruiser Charlotte died duelling with two wounded heavy cruisers. She had already claimed a battleship with her initial salvo of capital ship missiles. The two heavy cruisers were so badly mauled that they attempted to disengage but were run down by the destroyers Tang and Skate. After dispatching one of the heavy cruisers it was chasing the Tang turned and exchanged fire with a light cruiser. It took hits to the engine room and bridge and drifted out of control into Sentai's atmosphere, all hands are assumed lost.

Despite the losses we have secured the orbital space around the planet and the gator freighters have entered orbit. The Marines will assault the planet and neutralize the ground defenses in preparation for a larger landing by the Terran Legions. We plan to seize the spaceports and ground based planetary defenses before a counter-attack can be launched by the Synod through Hevan's Gate in the next system. This planet is the key to the sector. If we can hold this world, then the rest of the sector will be far more vulnerable and in no position to threaten Sol.


Twelve more scenarios recount the continuing fight for the Sentai System.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: A War in the Heavens: Campaign 1 – Gatecrasher
description:
It has been twenty years since the first, savage wars against the Synod of Worlds. The Terran Alliance has grown much in the last two decades of relative peace. Former Synod worlds within the sector have joined with us and our allies. Members of the Preservation Society have flocked to our banner and provided a desperately needed resource of information and technical expertise. The shipyards of Titan and numerous mining operations within the asteroid belt and small moons of Jupiter and Saturn have built the largest fleet in Human history. Our close allies, the Aven and Fel'akin, have trained with us and a mutual respect and admiration have grown out of the desperate years of the first Synod War. The Sector, however, will never be safe as long as the Synod controls the galaxy. The Synod scourge must be eradicated.
Task Force Alexander is composed of nearly three hundred warships and four hundred thrity five transports. The 1st, 2nd, 5th and 7th Marine Divisions along with the 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 5th Terran Legions form the backbone of the invasion ground forces. Numerous other Terran regiments and brigades support the primary landing forces along with four Fel'akin wargoups and six Aven multimode fighter wings. Fleet Admiral Harlie Mason commands the combined forces.
Their First Target is to break into the Hevan Sector through the Qetesh Gate system. Soon they will be knocking on Hevan's door.

'Gatecrasher is the 1st in a series of campaigns to liberate the Hevan Sector from the oppressive and genocidal rule of the Synod of Worlds. It provides 4 scenarios detailing the initial invasion of the Qetesh Gate system. It is compatible with Gruntz 15mm.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: A War in the Heavens: Campaign 2 – Dropping In
description:
The Qetesh Gate system has fallen and given us a valuable foothold into this sector. The next planet in the local jump chain is called Pathu Bahli and is a major mining and transportation hub in this sector. Normally a gate system would be the linchpin of a sector but Pathu Bahli is home to a Division of Galax Interstellar and it's corporate headquarters for this sector of the galaxy. Other than the extensive mining and refining facilities and the planet has considerable infrastructure which can be valuable if we can eventually colonize this world with our own people.
The system is full of resources and even possesses some ancient starship wreckage we might be able to reverse engineer and who knows what we might learn from that technology. The Admiral has declared this to be a critical system which must be taken before we move deeper into the sector. There are no native lifeforms other than plants and the atmosphere has a higher than normal CO2 level making it barely warm enough for life but requires anyone on the surface to wear a re-breather or sealed suit.
Dense cloud cover and rough terrain make it difficult to recon the area from orbit. Small recon teams from the 15th MEU (SOC) will have to drop in and take a look. We have some captured shuttles from the Qetesh Gate operation which could be used to smuggle recon teams into place. Once we have a better picture of the situation on the ground and the extent of their defenses we can send in the Legions.

Dropping In is the 2nd in a series of campaigns to liberate the Hevan Sector from the oppressive and genocidal rule of the Synod of Worlds.
It provides 4 scenarios detailing the initial invasion of the Pathu Bahli system.
It is compatible with Gruntz 15mm.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: A War in the Heavens: Campaign 3 – LynchPin
description:
The Chang Er system lies at an important jump nexus and must be secured. The populace is not affiliated with the Synod of Worlds and presents us with an opportunity to win over some allies in this long war. The xeno-liguistics and xeno-sociology advisors to the fleet have entered into a limited dialogue with the leaders of the Chang. The Chang are a martial meritocracy and value strength and power while abhoring weakness. The Chang are also an honor bound society so an overt demostration of power like an orbital strike would be seen not only as a threat but as a cowardly act.
The Chang have agreed to send observers to the fleet in order to get a first hand look at our war with the Synod. Thses observers would like to watch our conduct and report back to the Chang Overlord as to our honor and trustworthiness. They have suggested the Synod held Zakar system as a site suitable for this demostration.

Lynchpin is the 3rd in a series of campaigns to liberate the Hevan Sector from the oppressive and genocidal rule of the Synod of Worlds.
It provides 4 scenarios detailing the Raid on the research facility located on the planet Anhur in the Zakar system.
It is compatible with Gruntz 15mm.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: A War in the Heavens: Campaign 4 – Operation Stairway
description:
On May 15th of 2052 elements of the 15th MEU(SOC) landing battalion dropped onto the planet designated as New Pallas to take out a Consensus command facility. The drop went according to procedure and the combined Marine / Chang strike team hit the Consensus facility just before local nautical twilight. Chang units hit the perimeter while Marine elements of the now famous Echo company took out the comms tower and secured the headquarters facility.
Once they were relieved by the Legions, Echo Company was sent out into the ruined wasteland to investigate a energy field detected from orbit. What they found was an alien device of unknown function. A battle erupted around the device as Echo company fought off repurposed labor bots sent to destroy them. Once the device was secured they set out on foot to the landing zone for pickup. Consensus labor bots seemed to appear out of the woodwork as Echo company fought their way to the LZ. Once the handoff was complete with the techs on the dropship Echo company recieved word from an embattled Chang Cadre near their position. They boarded three smaller VTOLs and made a mad dash to reinforce their new allies. One of the transports took fire and crashed far from the Chang position. Marines fought a hard battle to consolidate their wounded with the Chang and hold out for relief. The next day a battalion was dropped in to relieve them. It had been a long few days for Echo Company.

Operation Stairway is the 4th in a series of campaigns to liberate the Hevan Sector from the oppressive and genocidal rule of the Synod of Worlds.
It provides 4 scenarios detailing the operation to eliminate the Consensus presence on the planet new Pallas and secure ancient alien artifacts and technology.
It is compatible with Gruntz 15mm.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Gapa Junior
description:
Gapa is an iconic card game that focuses on having fun, but in which competition with other players is an important element. This time it is a set created for the youngest. It consists of 31 cards with dimensions of 5 x 5 cm, each of which contains 6 different drawings.

As with the traditional version, players play a few cards when playing Gapa Junior. Then one player draws one card and places it in the center.

At this point, the duel of speed and perceptiveness begins. Players are supposed to compare whether the card from the inside has at least 1 element in it, which is also on the card they are holding. If this is the case - they must get rid of this card very quickly, and the one who does the fastest wins.

name: G.G.A.
description:
G.G.A. Granny Grating Armies is a rule set designed to be used with 10mm miniatures in the ancient world, the book contains rules so that you can conduct structured and abstract command based games.
Give your armies commands and watch as they complete them in battle!
GGA is directly inspired by the video game and infamous program "rome total war" which was in turn inspired by the BBC tv show "time commanders".
GGA is also well known for it's innovative "granny grating army" style of home made miniature making. The book is worth grabbing for the tutorials alone which have inspired people all across the world.

Home made hosts of soldiers built in a matter of hours with the GGA system. No need to ever wait weeks for a delivery again, simply craft an army and get gaming. "wargaming on your terms".
GGA is effective, elegant and boasts a unique energy and command point system. With mechanics in place to help emulate real warfare, you must be tactical and strategic. Simple to learn and enthusing to master the game brings to the tabletop a system like no other. Can you keep your army enegised and ready to go? Or will your war host burn out and fall to the whim of your enemy?

INCLUDES

Four Army lists to get you started: Romans, Spartans, Celts and Egyptians.
A comprehensive command grid to utilise in battle.
All the tokens and markers you need to play.
Instructions on how to build your own infantry, cavalry and archers.
Grannies History helps to keep you engaged with history!


—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: G.G.A.: Greece Source book
description:
GGA is simple and elegant and boasts a unique energy and command point system.
With the mechanics in place to help emulate real warfare, you must be tactical and strategic.
Simple to learn and enthusing to master the game brings to the tabletop a system like no other.

Now with this book expansion you can add named heroes, hero points and special themed scenarios such as the battle of Troy or the battle of Thermopylae (300 to most of us!).
This expansion also includes more commands, new armies and more instructions! A fantastic and colorful expansion to your GGA collection.

Expanded armies for Agamemnons Greeks, Sparta, Troy and Persia!
Two campaigns with three scenarios each!
Named characters, Hero Points and new fortifications!
New tutorials on miniature construction!


—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: G.G.A.: The Free People
description:
G.G.A.: The Free People is a book unlike many ancient wargaming books seen on the market today. With this book you can field unique ancient units such as Eastern Fire Bombers, Civilian Rabbles and Mercenaries. Effectively it is a book of "dogs of war" for the GGA system.

This book also has new commands such as Razing buildings and the new fortification "improvised barricades".
With hand drawn art and beautiful formatting the book is easy to read and in some cases highly educational as with all GGA products. All in all the perfect way to supplement your GGA experience.

Includes:

New commands for burning buildings and a new attack.
New fortifications.
New units including pirates, civilians and many many more.
New rules for taking captives during battle to sway the tide of victory!


—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Impetus Guide: The Parthians – Historical Background, Army Lists, Campaign game
description:
Impetus Guide: The Parthians

The purpose of this guide is two fold.
On one hand, it is to give the interested wargamer a guide to the Parthian armies and those of their enemies and to put the armies in a historical context. For many people the Parthians are a vague presence on the eastern edge of the world. As this guide shows, they were really a bridge between civilisations, linking Rome with India, acting as a barrier to nomadic tribes moving westwards and even having some contact with China.

The second purpose is to offer up some army lists (designed to fit with Impetus rules but easy to follow and equally easily converted for other wargames rules) to help those wargamers who use Impetus and who want to field the armies described in the guide. The idea is that the lists will enable you to produce an army which is reasonably authentic and as much as possible has some of the strengths and weaknesses of the original.

The third purpose is to provide a simple campaign to help players use their armies within their historical context.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Sail Ho!: Napoleonic Ships Game
description:
Sail Ho! Napoleonic Ships Game

These Rules have been written to provide a Fast-Play set in which the fun aspect is highlighted.
A game can be single ship to ship combat, or larger Fleet actions, and can run from a half to a couple of hours depending on the size of the Fleets and experience of the players. Several Fleets and multiple players can easily be incorporated.

The Movement system is Hex based, eradicating those minor tweaks and disputes bought about by rulers and angle markers. Ship types are generalised into three levels of Rated and several non-rated types, and include Frigates, fire ships, Bomb ketches, merchantmen and fortifications. Playing counters and sample Fleets are provided.

Combat includes exchanging cannon fire and grappling the enemy to board with Marines!

The effects of wind direction, day or night actions and accumulated damage is represented by various simple mechanisms that are easy to learn, yet hold subtle variations that an experienced gamer can exploit.

There is little record keeping, other than moving counters on a board, so the main focus can be kept on the models on the playing table. It is an I-Go-Y-U-Go turn system that prevents individual ship orders and snarl-ups, but does mean you have to keep your wits about you!

The Rules are originally intended for Napoleonic period ship combat, but can easily be used for other periods in which projectiles are the main offensive weapons, as opposed to the ramming tactics of earlier navies.

—description from the publisher

name: Sail Ho!: Campaign & Other Rules
description:
Sail Ho! Campaign & Other Rules

These Rules are a large expansion to the Basic Rules for Sail Ho!

These Rules are intended to allow players of the Sail Ho! Game to experience the organisation and running of a campaign set in the wider world of Napoleonic naval warfare. Many of these rules can be added to the Basic Rules without having to run a campaign, however.

Linked scenarios and challenges include Convoy duty, Harbour Raids, fire ships (left out of the basic rules; oops), Privateer actions, Blockade duty and the gathering of world-wide Trade to build national resources.

Commanders are introduced, each with their own special abilities.

Included in this package are more useful Game Counters, a Roster Sheet for organising your far-flung Fleets, and sample Fleets for other Nations; Russian, Swedish, Danish, Dutch, Portuguese, Spanish, Austrian, Naples and of course Pirates, and the various Merchantmen. Oh and a Blank sheet for adding your own.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Table Air Combat: Ki-61 Tony
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four aircraft represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

A performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

The Ki-61 was the only Japanese fighter to feature an inline engine, a license-built version of the Daimler-Benz 601 V-12. When the Ki-61 was first seen by Allied pilots, they mistook it for a German-built Bf-109 or an Italian C.202 fighter. Self-sealing fuel tanks and pilot armour sacrificed maneuverability for durability, and the inline engine made a streamlined fighter with higher speed than other Japanese fighters.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the Ki-61 Tony and two scenarios that reference other aircraft.

Misidentification: Ki-61 and Ki-43 Oscars engage American P-38L Lightnings.
Ganryu-jima: P-47 Thunderbolts defend B-25J Mitchell bombers against a flight of Ki-61 Tonys


This set contains miniatures for the Ki-61. Other aircraft must be purchased separately.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Canada Connections Card Game
description:
Bilingual word association card game celebrates all things Canadian. 150 cards relate to Canada's 150th birthday.

Designed and manufactured completely in Canada, the Canada Connections game is the second in a series of tabletop word games in which players connect related words. This version focuses exclusively on Canada with 150 cards containing 600 words in both French and English. There are over 4,000 known connections between the words on the cards.

Like a cross between Scrabble and dominoes, the game lets players connect words related to our culture, heritage, geography, politics, science, inventions, history, veterans, flora and fauna.

Although the game is about connecting words, it is really a game about connecting people. It promotes face-to-face communication for teams, families, schools and friends.

There are several methods of game play, the most common being one cards in the middle, with each player getting five cards. Players make connections between pairs of adjacent words, scoring as they go (each cards being worth from 1 to 5 points).

—description from the designer

name: The Face of Battle: Act With Daring, France 1940
description:
Act With Daring skirmish scenario book is the first WWII scenario book of the Origins award nominated The Face of Battle historical miniatures rules system.
Act With Daring covers the fierce battles and eventual collapse of the French Ninth Army during the opening days of the Blitzkrieg.
The battles of France 1940 were an excellent mix of troops, nationalities, vehicles and equipment.
From the intrepid horsed Spahi, to the massive B1 Bis tank, German and Belgium Engineers, regular to elite French forces. This all combines for fun and exciting skirmish miniatures play.

Act With Daring includes ten scenarios linked by three campaigns and one grand campaign. Players recreate small skirmish conflicts, armoured clashes and mixed infantry and vehicle battles.
Play the heroic defense of La Horgne or De Gaulle's famous counter-attack at Montcornet. Additional scenarios deal with the intense fighting in the Ardennes forest, the daring river crossings at Montherme and the final destruction of the Ninth Army. German forces will encounter French senior command units as headquarters and outposts are overrun. Optional forces allow for maximum replayability.

This 102 page book also includes a combat diary that details the day by day advance, attacks, and maneuvers of the German and French forces. Background information, tactical maps, force descriptions, and tables of organization for the Ninth Army and Sixth Panzer Division all enhance play and unit motives.

The scenarios are ideal for 15mm to 28mm individually-based figures.
Act With Daring scenarios are usable with many gaming systems: Arc of Fire, Battleground WWII, Crossfire, Battalions in Crisis, Cross of Iron, Disposable Heroes and more.


10 Scenarios
3 Campaign Games
Squad Reference Sheets for each scenario and force
Historical Notes on the Invasion
Detailed Day-by-Day Combat Diary
OOB for the French Ninth Army
OOB for the German Sixth Panzer Division
Historical Maps
Campaign Rules
and more...


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: These Fields of Blood: Wargaming the American Civil War
description:
These Fields of Blood is a rule set for playing wargames of the American Civil War.
The game is designed to play with forces from Brigade to Divisional level, and has the flexibility to play higher and lower level games.

The game uses a unique 'game engine' intended to move players away from tradional 'I-GO-U-GO' systems, and the slow randomness of traditional card based systems, and give a more real simultaneous feel with interaction of the players and forces.

As with other TFP Games, the system reflects the qualities of leadership. The engine creates a system where the pace of action and initiative is determined throughout the turn. Players are forced to make choices and perform actions of which the immediate consequences may not be established. It keeps on your toes every turn.

Players will be able to quickly get to grips with the game as the rules are intuitive and quickly remembered, with several 'playing card' size quick reference cards and Unit Cards providing all you need to manage a game.

A supplement for playing the American War of Independence has been release in PDF format called Land of the Free.

The rules feature;

68-pages in full colour.
A unique card based system that offers simultaneous play with a degree of unpredictability that focuses on the heat of battle.
The game 'engine' system is ideal for multi-player games.
Simple, clear text, organised in a logical flow, see our sample pages.
Simple clear rules mechanisms that are repeated through rules allowing fast learning and play.
Clear, precise examples with thoughts on alternative options, see our sample pages.
Detailing leaders with personality traits for command.
Uncluttered larger font play sheet, 11pt Arial.
Play cards to copy and other quick reference aids.
An introductory scenario.


—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Baptism of Fire: The Big Blue – 1940-1943 Africa & Middle East Supplement
description:
The Big Blue is a supplement for the original Baptism of Fire skirmish rules set in North Africa, 1940-1943.

Contains lots of army lists and generic scenarios, with lots of information regarding gaming in North Africa.

This supplement is useful for other rules as the army lists and scenarios can be used (ignore the points costs).

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Baptism of Fire: Crucible of Combat – D-Day & the Battle for Normandy, France 1944
description:
Crucible of Combat is a supplement for Baptism of Fire II yet may be used with other skirmish games including Baptism of Fire and the latest Baptism of Fire III.

The supplement is focussed on the 1944 Allied invasion and battle for Normandy.

It features many handy scenarios and a terrain guide in photos.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Sands of Blood, Sweat and Tears: Wargaming the USMC in WW2 Using Baptism of Fire II & We Can Be Heroes
description:
Sands of Blood, Sweat and Tears is a supplement for the original Baptism of Fire II and the original We Can Be Heroes rules. It will also work with the earlier Baptism of Fire rules.

It contains army lists for the USMC and Japanese from 1942-1945, plus a selection of scenarios based on real events through the island-hopping campaign.

This supplement can be used with other game systems requiring army lists and scenarios for this period.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Car Lords: Die-Cast Car Combat
description:
Car Lords

This game is played with small die-cast cars that represent your battle car on the tabletop.
You move your car around the table and fire weapons to damage and destroy the other cars.
Car Overlords is the most popular spectator sport in the future where drivers use modified battle cars to fight to the death for fame and huge cash prizes.
These cars are heavily armored and armed with advanced military weapons because paying spectators expect to see massive explosions and inevitable driver fatalities. Multiple cars enter a battle arena, they blast each other to pieces, and the last car standing wins. It has become the most watched television show with hundreds of millions of viewers watching this ultimate blood sport every night.

—description from the publisher

name: Maximum Overdrive: Game Supplement for Car Lords
description: Maximum Overdrive is a game supplement for Car Lords that adds semitrucks, motorcycles, new mods, and new weapons.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Fire Team Vietnam: Brown Water Navy Rules
description:
FIRE TEAM VIETNAM: BROWN WATER NAVY

You will find in the form of a pdf file to print:

Chapter F: Brown Water Navy River Boats

US Boats Movement and Combat Rules (26 pages)
Armament Cards (Poker Card Format) of US Boats and Vietnamese Boats (7 pages)
Action Order Markers and Explosion Markers.


Chapter B: terrains - Creek - River / Canals (5 pages)

These rules are made for Counter or Bundle available on wargame Vault

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Western Up Front: Western Front Infantry Combat c 1917
description:
Western Up Front is a company level World War 1 Western Front game designed for 6mm to 25mm miniatures.

Set in the period of 1916/17, the players use interactive card play to attack and defend Trench systems.

The design is inspired by the original Up Front game by Avalon Hill, but converted to miniature (or counter) play.

Designed as a multiplayer game, the mechanisms are simple, but realistic.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Fire Team Vietnam: Air Cav
description:
Fire Team Vietnam: Air Cav

Content:


Chapter H: rules for transport helicopters (UH1 D)
Helicopter Cards (poker card format)
2 sizes counters of Helicopters
Manoeuvring types counters (Approach, landing, Takeoff, Stationary and Tactical Flight).


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: After Civilisation
description:
After Civilisation

Civilisation failed now small groups of men and women fight over the remains to find enough supplies to get them through a few more days.

You will take on the role of leading a small group trying to recover the most resources and hold onto them.

A simple to learn and play game needing very few figures but requiring advanced planning to make the most of the forces available to you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Iron Brigade Miniature Wargame Rules
description:
Iron Brigade Miniature Wargame Rules

American Civil War Wargame Rules.

Rules for fighting tabletop games using miniature soldiers.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Micro Ancients: Expansion IV – Fall of Rome
description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion IV - Fall of Rome

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces four additional belligerents to enhance play: Byzantine, Hun, Late Roman and Sassanid.
The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976.
Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Micro Ancients: Expansion V – The Dark Ages
description:
Micro Warfare Series: Micro Ancient Expansion V – The Dark Ages

An expansion to the popular Micro Ancient game, this title introduces three additional belligerents to enhance play: Norman, Saxon and Viking.
The section for each army includes counters for use in the game; applicable rule amendments as well as some brief information about the country at the time (source: Wikipedia)

The Micro Warfare series was originally published by Tabletop Games in the 1970s with this title being published in 1976. Each game in the series aims to recreate the feel of tabletop wargaming with large numbers of miniatures but using printed counters and terrain so that games can be played in a small space and are very cost-effective.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Cosmic Eclipse Expansion
description:
TAG TEAM cards add a mighty twist to the Pokémon TCG, and Sun & Moon—Cosmic Eclipse mixes things up even more! In addition to new TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX like Solgaleo & Lunala-GX and Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX, there are two new TAG TEAM trios: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX and Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX. And for the first time ever, you'll find TAG TEAM Supporter cards like Red & Blue, Cynthia & Caitlin, and Guzma & Hala!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Between a Rock and a Hard Place: A Scenario for A Leader of Men
description:
Between a Rock and a Hard Place

In 1944 the USMC 1st Division was tasked to attack and secure the island fortress of Pelieu. The small island had become such a rabbit warren of honeycombed defenses that the USMC spent weeks grinding away at, taking the division close to complete exhaustion as a combat formation.

This scenario booklet looks at the part of that battle, presenting a a scenario for the rules A Leader of Men by TFP Games.
The scenario put you in control of either USMC or Japanese forces.
It may also be used as a solo play scenario using the rules in the ALoM rule book.

This scenario is not for the faint of heart, it will require courage and resolution to make it, and sometimes an acceptance that today you may have failed.

This scenario contains:

a deployment map,
scenario orders of battle and
special rules.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wings of War: Midway 1942
description:
Midway 1942 is a scenario rules supplement for the Wings of War (Wings of Glory) tabletop game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Seven Years: A Wargame
description:
Seven Years is a war game designed to be simple and efficient.

At the core are: a two-table engine, the five status definition of units, a flexible command system that can span from cumbersome to almost Napoleonic and last not least a more fluid game sequence, than most common rule sets can provide.

While operating at brigade level, it is designed to keep a balance of overall action versus micro management of the troops.

For my taste, so called “friction of battle” is a good thing as long as it doesn‘t bring all action to halt or replaces the player entirely. The game system also gives a bit room to manoeuvre.

Let us trust in the discipline and drill these soldiers were exposed to on a daily basis.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Antiquity: Fast Play Miniature Wargames Rules
description:
Antiquity

Fast play ancients wargames rules.
For 15mm or 25/28mm miniatures.

Turn Sequence:

Initiative phase
Movement phase
Missile phase
Melee phase
Morale phase

name: SOF Warrior: 21st Century Skirmish Rules for Role-Playing and Miniatures 15mm to 54mm
description:
In spite of the darkness, the SOF Warrior’s NODs enabled him to see a lone sentry armed with an AK-47 sitting approximately 75 meters away.
Suddenly, the man stood up and the SOF operative froze in place.
He cursed under his breath as he realized something must have betrayed his presence.
Although, he was certain he had not been spotted, the man began to run. The operative knew he was intended to be an early warning, and soon the other insurgents would be alerted.

Instinctively, his finger found the pressure pad on the fore grip of his M4 Carbine which activated the infrared laser sight, and in an instant the target was tracked.
With no time to attain a “cheek weld” he squeezed the trigger…
...and the player rolled the dice!

SOF Warrior is the modern version of Final Combat, and although it is designed around elite special forces, it plays brilliantly with regular formations.
This squad-level simulation includes many of the current weapons platforms.
Add an armored fighting vehicle to your squad and enjoy the most exciting close quarters battle experience for role-playing and miniatures available today.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Mission Command: Normandy – Reference Manual
description:
Mission Command: Normandy is a set of World War Two wargaming rules for use with miniatures.

The Mission Command approach:

Captures the essence of tactical and operational combat command from roughly company level to division level without real warfare's bloodshed, fear, death and destruction.
Models the differences in how different armies fight.
Reflects WW2 practice of tactical and operational command, control and communications.


With Mission Command: Normandy, if you're handling a German Panzer Division, it will be a different experience from handling an equivalent British or American unit.

Command, control and communications are not as abstracted as in most modern wargames - no command dice, no PIPs and no artificial 'fog of war' mechanisms.
Each command of company level or above is given orders at the start which can be modified later, but orders are brief.

Fog of war, imperfect information and sometimes confusion emerge naturally as players attempt to fight in accordance with national doctrines and complex tactical situations.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Order Counters, Simulation

name: Twister Scrabble
description:
This Twister game has a Scrabble twist. Instead of large colored circles, this Twister mat has printed Scrabble letter tiles. The designated judge spins the spinner and calls out a challenge based on where it lands, and then chooses a starting letter. Then the twisting, shouting, and laughing begins! Players place their hands and feet on the mat to make a word. Then depending on where the spinner has landed, they try to be the first to shout out, spell out, or use the word in a sentence to win the round. It's an exiting, active party game in which players use their hands and feet…and brain!

—description from the publisher

name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: WWII Corps level wargame rules
description:
SitzKrieg ohne Hass is an innovative fast-paced game placing the player in the role of the commander of a WW2 Corps or Army.

The game is about command, control and planning.
Good planning, effective control of your artillery, use of Division and Corps level assets, and use of the night turn to reorganise will all maximise your chances of success.
And use your reconnaissance screen to uncover enemy forces and gain the initiative.

A grid based battlefield regulates all firing and movement eliminating any micro-measurement.
No record keeping is required.

A Corps game can easily be fought through in three hours.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Black Seas: Spanish Navy 1st Rate
description:
First-rate ships of the line are the ultimate vessel in Black Seas. These ships pack a tremendous punch and can take quite the pummelling. Any enemy unfortunate enough to be caught in the broadside of a 1st Rate is not likely to be around long enough to take the tale. 1st Rates also have access to the greatest quantity and wealth of customisation and upgrade options in the game.

Spanish 1st Rates are especially characterful when utilising the national special rules in the game. Many Spanish vessels were extremely heavily armed, and thus can take the ’Over Gunned’ upgrade for no additional cost. This bonus does not come without penalty however, as such bulky ships were difficult to sail. They must therefore pass a skill test when attempting to sail at a quicker rate of knots. Veteran crews are also not allowed to be taken on such ‘Over Gunned’ 1st Rates ships.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: At Lances Point: Living Rule Book
description:
At Lances Point is a multi-period spanning tabletop wargame.

These cut down rules will give you all you need to play a basic game of ALP to get a sense of what the full game will be.
It combines cards with 15mm miniatures on a realistic gaming table set up to give you exciting and immersive battles of ancients right through to modern day.
This initial phase will concentrate on ancient and medieval periods but on full release, there will be additional sets for Napoleonic, American Civil War and many more.

The game combines combat cards with unit actions to give a unique game so be sure to get the card sets you need.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Ins bayrische Hochland
description:
Ins bayrische Hochland ("To the Bavarian highlands") is a vintage typical roll and move board game about traveling through the Bavarian highlands. The first player, who cross all 80 stops first wins the game.

—user summary

name: US Naval War College War Gaming Manual with scenario
description:
This is a complete set of rules with a scenario for a sample scenario for modern (as of 1969) naval warfare using: surface-to-air missiles (SAMs), gunnery, air, torpedoes and mines, etc.

The rules cover game setup, damage assessment, and game play.

The sample game gives the background and briefings and the two sides ORBATs. Then it sets out the plans of the two sides. It goes on to set out how the game is setup, managed and played.

The rules are supported by numerous examples of the forms used to manage the game, such damage assessment flowcharts and surface to air missile assessment flowcharts. There is sufficient information for the modern wargamer to understand how the game was conducted or to recreate the games for themselves.

reprinted without any updates in 2019 as "United States Naval War College Manual Wargaming (1969): Wargames at the Start of the Missile Era"

name: Cedar Point-opoly
description:
For more than 130 years, Cedar Point has been the favorite amusement park of thrill-seekers, family vacationers, and live show audiences. But don't let its age fool you! Every year it gets older, is a year it gets better!

As the coaster capital of the world - Cedar Point takes its guests to new heights, unbelievable twists, upside down turns, and speeds beyond compare! The Top Thrill Dragster, Millennium Force, and the Magnum XL-200, to name a few, are coasters without equal the world over.

You can't forget that this fantastic fun place offers a special playland for kids and families, waster oases, award-winning shows, and games galore!

So choose you token and roll the dice. Who knows? You may be the next big star at the Palace Theatre or racing through the dark on the Disaster Transport. It sounds easy enough, but add a trip to First Aid and lose your change on the Chaos, and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

Looking for a virtual visit to the largest amusement ride park in the world? Here it is!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Salnave's War: Ship Data and a Campaign System for "Dahlgren and Columbiad" and "Iron and Fire"
description:
Salnave's War: Wargaming The Haitian Civil War 1867-69 is a supplement for "Dahlgren and Columbiad" and A&AGE's "Iron and Fire" covering the naval side of the Haitian Civil War, 1867-69.

The supplement contains ship data for both sets of rules for all of the warships involved in the war, and a short campaign system based on "War of the Pacific" that focusses on the essential aspects of the war.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Ein Fall für Perry Clifton
description:
One player (Perry Clifton) pursues up to 4 burglars. Each piece moves on it'ts own track. Movement is determined by a die.
Each space on the game board represents 1 minute. The burglars have a 10 minute headstart. If Perry Clifton overtakes a burglar, the burglar is caught and eliminated from the game. If a burglar reaches space 88 he has escaped. Perry Clifton may use up to 10 stop-chips to put on the track in front of the burglars instead of rolling the die to move himself forward. The burglars may only pass the chip if they land on the same space it occupies.
The results of the game are documented on a piece of paper. After each player has played Perry Clifton once, the results are compared and the player who caught the most burglars in the shortest time wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Rund um die Tankstelle
description:
One player represents the ESSO gas station attendant (red car) and another a fee dodger (black car). The other players are ordinary car diivers. The attendant starts at space 8, all other players at space 16. Movement is determined by a die. The ESSO attendant has the task to handle the moveable shortway in the center of the game board. If a player gets onto a service point (spacees 1 to 6) he has to pay with a Service coupon of which the players have 6 at the beginning of the game. The fee podger uses the service points without paying. When the fee dodger uses the second service station, all other players start to pursue him. Only at this point the attendant enters the game too. If a player captures the fee dodger he gets 1 point and the fee dodger starts again on space 16.

The game ends, when all players have used all 6 of their coupons and the fee dodger is captured for the last time. The player with the most points wins the game.
—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Blücher: Holy Mother Russia
description:
The army of the Tsar of all the Russias was a tough, disciplined force, armed to the teeth with plentiful artillery. They proved to be formidable opponents for Napoleon’s armies, and ultimately victorious over his attempt to conquer their homeland.

Holy Mother Russia is a set of 58 unit cards, providing all of the Russian unit cards for Blücher. This set contains all of the units and officers that you need to create a Russian army for Blücher or for a Scharnhorst campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Blücher: König und Vaterland
description:
The Prussian army of 1806 was a well-trained and disciplined force with many excellent units, but they were famously defeated by Napoleon at Jena and Auerstädt. Animated by vengeance, the reformed Prussian army was instrumental in Napoleon’s ultimate defeat.

Two Armies in One Box:

König und Vaterland (king and fatherland) is a set of 95 unit cards that allow you to build either/both the Prussian armies for Blücher and for Scharnhorst campaigns. All the units and officers from both the early- and late-war armies are included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Blücher: Kaiserlicks
description:
During the wars of the French Revolution, the French called their Austrian enemies “kaiserlicks,” a mispronunciation of the German word for “imperial.” The humble kaiserlick was a well-trained and well-equipped soldier, the most consistent and frequent enemy of the French Republic and Empire.

Kaiserlicks is a set of 67 richly colorful heavy-duty poker-sized cards, covering the army of the Austrian Empire. This set contains all of the units and officers that you need to create an Austrian army for Blücher or for a Scharnhorst campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Blücher: Sunset of the Ghazis
description:
The Ottomans were the “eternal empire” that sprawled across three continents, a vast, multi-ethnic polity with a huge army. By the time of Napoleon they had been driven from the northern Balkans and most of North Africa, but they were still a major player in Eurasian affairs and a force that had to be reckoned with. Ottoman soldiers were tough and stubborn, and the Sultan’s vast armies included huge contingents of light cavalry.

Sunset of the Ghazis is a set of 76 unit cards, providing all of the Ottoman unit cards for Blücher. This set contains all of the units and officers that you need to create an Ottoman army for Blücher or for a Scharnhorst campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Kontaê!: Heroínas negras brasileiras
description:
An educational game for Brazilian students. The game introduces four influential black Brazilian women on three types of cards: One shows an image, others show biographical information, and some have poems about the women. The poems were written by Brazilian author Jarrid Arraes, whose book Heroínas negras brasileiras was an inspiration for the game.

Each group of students gets an image card and has to research the life of that respective personality (there is a QR code on the image cards which leads to a page with information). After the research phase, each group receives three random cards. The goal is to have a set of cards which all belong to their initial personality. But the poem and biography cards do not show the name of the personality, the students have to figure out which information or poem belongs to their character. The groups can exchange cards with a drawpile or with an open display of cards. Whichever group gets a full set first, wins.
A competitive mode is also included. In this mode, the teacher teaches about one personality, then deals out the cards to the students who have to figure out which cards belong to the character they learned about.
The game is available to teachers as a free print and play.

name: Ironsides: Being a set of rules for the larger actions of the Great Civil War in England
description:
Ironsides

English Civil War game.

Note that this game is not edited or laid out more than is necessary. That's why it's free!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Advanced Impetus
description:
Advanced Impetus

Free pdf with:

amendments,
errata,
clarifications and
tournament rules


for Impetus rulebook

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Woodlings
description:
Woodlings is a cultish, animal-infested game of murder, bluffing and elder-beings in the classic “Mafia” format.
Each player controls two Woodlings, little forest creatures each with their own abilities and attributes that they can use to their advantage.
The game revolves around Ancients, powerful, age-old woodland spirits that require specific sacrifices from their followers in order to stay sated.
At the start of the game, one Woodling will be anonymously designated the Killer, whose goal is to sacrifice two other Woodlings to an Ancient (of their choosing) without being caught.
Every other Innocent Woodling must in turn use their own abilities and deduction skills to collectively pinpoint the Killer before they accomplish their goal.

The game takes play over three stages
The Night stage
The Discussion stage
And the Voting stage

The game ends if

The Killer is accused (Innocent victory)
The Killer for whatever reason cannot carry out their sacrifices (Innocent victory)
The Killer sacrifices two appropriate Woodlings and is not accused the next day (Killer victory)

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: "Auf die Plätze" ... unser Chemnitz-Spiel
description:
The aim of this game is to occupy sights (places) of Chemnitz and get the most points.

The starting player draws a location card and places it at the corresponding location. This marks the start location for everyone. Everyone moves to a location (sight) during the first turn starting from the start location. Every time someone moves, a location has to be reached.

Movements are allowed in one direction only (shortest path): to the side, forwards, or diagonal. A chip gets placed in each tile. This applies to the target location as well. For each path up to six chips can be used. An already occupied tile can be skipped, but not a location or multiple occupied tiles. For each location up to 4 chips (own or foreign) are allowed, but only one per turn. After occupying a location the current player can (but does not have to) draw a location card and auction it.

A chip gets payed to the register and the card is auctioned. Up to 6 chips can be offered. If somebody offers six chips, the auction stop immediately. An auctioned location card can be used starting with the next round. Starting with the second turn, each player can choose: Either walk and auction or "cap". This means that one location card is placed on the corresponding location, or another location. When capping, you can place as much chips on the location card as there are beneath it. A "capped" location is locked.

The "i" wild card can be used to either "cap" a chosen location, the "IHK" wild card to get the own chips back from the register immediately.
