If it is passed on, the receiving player has to take back all of its own chips from the register. If the "i" wild card is drawn, the "i-Chemnitz-Service" will be the start location. When starting from the start location is not possible any more, because all the tiles around it are occupied already, another location card gets drawn as the start location. The game ends when someone runs out of chips.

Scoring: Only "capped" tiles with at least one chip on it get scored. For correctly "capped" tiles all chips are counted for the corresponding person. For incorrectly "capped" tiles only chips of the "capping" person are counted, and only if the player has at least one chip beneath the location tile. All other chips are lost. Some special points can be gained by having matched places you wrote down before the start of the game.

name: Spellandia
description:
Hidden deep in the Lexis Sea is the volcanic island of Spellandia. It’s a mythical landscape where its volcano spews letters and its islanders collect myriad words by navigating paths littered with these letters. Collecting words is the islanders’ sole occupation.

Spellandia is the tabletop game of making words on a constantly changing, multi-dimensional island comprising up to 54 land tiles with 162 letter fragments. Six islander tokens maintain player positions, with six scoreboards tracking individual scores.

Players explore and expand the island, laying and swapping land tiles, finding paths that form words and moving their tokens to score points. Play continues until a target score is met or exceeded.

—description from the designer

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Jung Pirates Starter Set
description:
When years passed without word of the Jung, they were considered lost, their return under the mon of the giant squid surprised everyone. They have reaped what they need from the traders on the seas of the Jwar Isles, forcing the Shiho to label them pirates. Their fleets are faster and their knowledge of the Isles’ waters are unparalleled by all but perhaps the Carp clan, allowing them to evade the larger, less experienced junks of the Prefecture. Long years away from the courts of the Jwar Isles have left the Jung rough around the edges but they have not forgotten their ancestry.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Silvermoon Trade Syndicate Starter Set
description:
The thriving port of Jima is the beating heart of the Silvermoon Trade Syndicate’s operations. In recent generations the merchants of the Silvermoon Syndicate have been the trade life blood of the Jwar Isles. Its famed arenas where Buto warriors clash in a brutal dance of Jumo, or the Flower Houses where ones' wildest fantasies can become reality with the touch of a Rose, the Syndicate rules. Some would liken the Silvermoon to the flip of a coin; If lucky you come up in the sun with the Five Fortunes blessing, call it wrong or try and cheat them and you’re likely to end up face down in the dirt!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Everybuddy
description:
Everybuddy is a game for 1 - 99 players where everyone simultaneously searches for a flock (a group of 3 cards) across which there are either 0 or 2 birdies or matching color.

It's a speed-matching, pattern recognition game for the whole family!

12 cards are laid out in a grid and each card has a different combination of birds. Players race to find three cards that meet the criteria to make a flock of birdie buddies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Physical Removal, Speed Matching

name: Sliders Word Game
description:
Slide and meld fragments into words in this lasercut word game. The game components include 144 letter, bigram and trigram tiles, each with a point value and a gameboard with angular stands.

Setup:

Assemble the board with the stands
Shuffle and scatter the tiles face down in a random pile
Grab 30 tiles and randomly stack face up within the slots
2 players: 30 tiles
3 players: 50 tiles
4 players: 70 tiles
5+ players: 90 tiles

Reserve a pile of face down tiles in a draw pile as per the number of players:
Set the remaining tiles aside and out of sight.


Game Play:

Pull one tile from the bottom of any column, letting the tiles in the column slide down.
Add a tile from the draw pile face up to the top of same column, except when there is only one tile left which is placed face down as the game-ending mystery tile.
Attempt to make a word from two or more of your tiles.
When made, place your word in a separate collection pile.


Ending the Game: The game ends when someone pulls the face down mystery tile. That player gets to use that tile to form a word, if possible. At this point the game ends.

—description from the designer

name: Gruntz: Activation Cards
description:
These activation cards are for use in the Gruntz 15mm SCI-FI Wargame.
They are printed in a small boardgame size card format for use during a Gruntz game.
The cards DO NOT come with plastic protection sleeves, the size is Mini American Board Game.

If you enjoy a solo game with a narrative feel, these cards are ideal to help in determining a random activation and also help add to the narrative if you follow the bonus events on the cards.

The cards make a game of Gruntz more dynamic, allowing for alternating activation of units using a random determination. I find it works great for getting more than 2 players into a game of Gruntz because the random nature of unit activation can involve all players, rather than waiting for the traditional I-GO-U-GO turn sequence.

The main Gruntz 15mm SCI-FI rule book includes rules for using normal playing cards, however the same rules can be used with these cards which also add some interesting chaotic battlefield bonus effects.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: La Petite Mort: Goodie Nerdz
description:
A goodie tile for La Petite Mort, representing the author of the game, Davy Mourier, and Monsieur Poulpe in tribute to the television series Nerdz.
This tile is a character card played as a basic game tile, with the Darwin Arward weakness, and three soul points.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: M.A.D.
description:
M.A.D - A game about cold war, hot conflict. and ending the world.

This is a moderate-level strategy game about sneakily building your "superweapon" to eliminate all other players. The manner in which you do this is through interesting and strange research types, the primary examples being physics, biology, psyche, and the occult. It can be easily played with only 2 players, and plays often better with 4 to 6 players. All players must draw and use cards from the same deck, often trading, discarding and stealing from each other to try and get the upper hand!

This game is a 2 phase game - cold war and hot conflict - that is controlled by a central 'Tension" mechanic, placing the pacing and speed at which the game takes place entirely in the hands of the players, where they can force their enemies into a war state, or bring their arms to bear.

Players can, and will, use security tokens and deterrents to disrupt the plans of the other players - because at the end, there can only be one!
Bluffing, lying and manipulating your competitors is to be expected, and intimidating an opponent to fold is a viable method of playing. It just pays to remember, if you try hard enough, almost any situation can be crawled out of.

—description from the publisher

name: Naval Battles CCG: Admiral's Handbook
description:
The Admiral's Handbook, official game rules for Naval Battles: Customizable Card Game.
Primary resource for game rules, images and layout.

You are an Admiral aboard your flagship cruiser.
Your orders are to protect your resources and eliminate all enemy and hostile forces in your vicinity.
Your enemy: the flagship across the water and he's out for the same purpose.

Customize your plans with strategies that will destroy and eliminate your enemies with ships, special resources, weapons upgrades, defense systems, instant abilities, air support and many elements to explore.
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Naval Battles CCG: Cube Game
description:
You are an admiral aboard a flagship cruiser.
Your objective is to build and deploy ships, weapons, aircraft and defense systems while protecting your resources from hostile forces.
Players build decks and face off 1 on 1 or in multiplayer to see who can build the most powerful fleet and sink their opponents' flagships.
Resource cards give you requisition, which you use to build your units.
The faster your build up, the more likely you are to win the game.

This pack contains 600 printed cards from the Core set of the game.
The Core set consists of 237 different cards in 6 main card types; ships, weapons, aircraft, defense, instants and resources.
Using the official Cube game rules, 6 players can build decks with 90 randomly selected cards and play a multiplayer free-for-all.
Other formats include Standard constructed format where players build decks containing no more than 3 copies of cards from the game.

The Core set consists of 36 rares, 54 uncommons, 132 commons, and 15 basic resource cards; and the Cube box contains 1 of each rare, 2 of each uncommon, and 3 of each common, plus 60 basic resources.
These cards have been updated with current errata version 1.1.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Arcadia Hills
description:
Arcadia Hills is soon to be the areas most prestigious residential neighborhood!

With the neighborhood currently undergoing construction, players will each take the role of a contractor who's job is to build as many similar homes in a row as possible by matching colors and patterns. Adding finishing touches like a swimming pool or a nearby park will increase the value of each home and the overall appeal of their street, leading to even more points for the player. After all the cards have been played, the player with the most points will be declared the winner!

Players may choose to battle head to head in a heated race to the finish, team up in a 2v2 cooperative battle for supremacy, or take on the job alone in solo mode!

-description from designer

name: Artillery Duel: An experiment in double blind warfare
description:
Your enemy lies in wait hidden from your view, but you have the same advantage.
Every shot you take will help to find your enemy, but you know they're going to shoot back.

But you aren't a stationary target and a wise player can balance between movement, searching and limiting their options.

Artillery Duel is an abstract game of combat that uses only scrap paper for each player.
It is an experiment in double-blind warfare blending battleship fire mechanics with movement and bluffing to keep your opponent guessing.

No randomization. Only tactics, and results.
Use your fire either to track your opponent or to destroy their terrain and limit their movement
Three special powers for advanced players to outthink and outshoot their opponent


—description from the publisher

name: To Covet Glory: Modifications to Kiss Me Hardy for Ships under the Rate
description:
To Covet Glory is a 94 page book that features rules modifications for the TooFatLardies game Kiss Me Hardy.
It is necessary to own KMH in order to use these modifications. KMH is designed for single ship or large fleet actions with ships that are of the rate (6th rate vessel or larger).
Small ships of less than twenty guns tend to play the same from a one gun rowboat to a 18-gun Brig of War. These modifications provide some uniqueness for the smaller ships and allow them to be battled out on the tabletop.
Like the original KMH rules, they are not scale dependent.
However, the changes were designed with 1/300 or 6mm ships in mind.
These can be obtained from sites such as Sea Dog Studios, Langton Miniatures and War Artisan. The later is an exceptional value as you are buying a paper kit that you print yourself and make as many as you would like.

Included in the book is a guide for creating your own ships or creating stats for historical vessels.
Fifteen historical scenarios covering: the American Revolution, The Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars, The Tripolitan Wars and the Quasi-War with France.

A section is included for creating campaigns with these small vessels.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Mafiosi: Bluffing Deckbuilder
description:
Mafiosi: Bluffing Deckbuilder is a deckbuilding bluffing games. Players will start the game with weaker cards, but those cards can be used to accumulate coins that can be spent to add more powerful cards to their deck. The trick is that all of the cards are initially played face down: players declare what card they are playing. If no one challenges the declaration, the player gets the effect of the card they declared. But if there is a challenge, the player who is incorrect is punished.

The goal of the game is to have the most influence when all of the elite mafia cards are purchased. Influence is given by the number of elite mafia cards in your deck as well as the amount of power that you retain (power can be lost if you are caught lying or attacked by other players).

The pool of cards in the shop varies game by game; 5 elite card roles are chosen (2 cards per role) and 4 mafia card roles are chosen (4 cards per role). Player decks start with two civilians and one thug, but they can use those cards to purchase more powerful mafiosi like soldato, capo, consigliere or criminals such as drug dealers, racketeers, or arson, or bribed officials such as police officers or politicians.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Income, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Graham Heffers Party Beast Game
description:
Win by being the first player to get rid of all his /her cards.

The game has the players moving round the board based on die rolls he / she can then attempt to get rid of a card of the category or colour that he / she has landed on. Challenges on the card are chat-up, trivia, charades, tongue twister, limerick and 30 second speech.

—user summary

name: Polo: The Board Game
description:
A complicated board game "Note the rules of Polo appear quite complicated . It is suggested that rules are read and then play begins. When needed refer to the rule under individual headings and it will quickly become apparent how play proceeds"

The object of the game is to accumulate as many tournament point as possible. The number of ponies and the amount of money left at the end of the game is irrelevant.

Players start with some money and 5 ponies
Play takes place round a board. With secret bidding for riders of different skill levels.

Tournaments are decided on the roll of the dice using a formula which gives advantage to the player (patron) who has spent the most money and is playing with the highest rated rider card.

name: Fee Fye Fo Fum: Eeny Meeny Miny Mo
description:
If you can say it you can play it!
The object of the game is to get 4 pieces on any horizontal or vertical row. The first player to do this is the winner.

Pieces are named must be moved in order Fee Fye Fo Fum got player 1 and Eeny Meeny Miny Mo for player 2. Play is on a 4 x 4 grid with initial starting places being labeled pieces can be moved one space in any horizontal or vertical direction and can jump over any piece on the board.

name: Waste Not Want Not
description:
The fun to to play environment game for all the family.
Discover important facts about the environment and the race to recycle your rubbish first.

Players must successfully complete the journey through four different industries. On the way they may need to answer brain-teasing questions, try to avoid the "environmentally unfriendliness" lying in wait and wish for a bit of luck with the roll of the dice. Each player has a waste bin filled with rubbish needing to be recycled. The player who empties their waste bin first is the winner

—user summary

name: Magmell
description:
Magmell (マグメル) is an anime-themed expandable card game that features competitive one-versus-one battles, familiar card battle mechanics, and gorgeous anime art.

In Magmell, players build a deck from a pool of 180 cards and then square off against one another in alternating-turn format. There are four types of cards that players must get acquainted with in Magmell: Unit Cards, Magic Cards, Crystal Cards, and Other Cards. Creating a deck that has a balance of all four types is critical to success.

On a player's turn, they can draw cards, play resource Crystals, summon units, activate spells, and engage in battle. During combat, the attacked player has the ability to choose who their defenders are, giving them some control over how each combat round plays out. Opponents alternate back and forth, taking turns and engaging in the aforementioned turn options until one of their life pools reaches 0.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: Day at The Races
description:
Feel the adrenaline-charged excitement and pulsating drama of 16 real life horse races as you wager thousands without losing a "kings ransom".

Each player is given a gambling float of £6,00. John Francome will give you some useful hints and tips to help you make as much money a possible in your quest to beat the bookie!

Before getting "under starters orders" take time to study the form check odds or use your own unique proven formula of gut instinct, favorite colors or names before placing your bets

A DVD based game of betting.

Components: DVD with 16 races, playing guide, play money, betting slips, bookmaker's slate, dry erase maker, and 4 pencils.

name: Kaiserfahrt nach Palastina
description:
Kaiserfahrt nach Palastina ("Imperial Journey to Palestine") is a typical spin and move mechanism based board game about traveling, but unique for historical theme (travel to Holy Land) and valuable components.

Before, during and after the second journey of the German Emperor Wilhelm II (ruled 1888-1918) in the Ottoman Empire in 1898 a wide variety of media and entertainment articles were produced and brought onto the market in order to publicize the trip, to benefit from it in any way or at least to make it understandable.

1846-1931 testifies: »Our emperor's journey to the Orient, as the most significant event of the past year, was still lively for the minds. All serious patriots could not think of this great and, in some ways, dangerous undertaking by the beloved ruling couple and their happy ending without a deep movement. All kinds of details of the trip, such as the importance of the whole company at home and abroad, kept the heads busy.
It is therefore not surprising that the publisher and »Royal Court Printing Company Adolph H. Engel, founded in 1848, took the opportunity to on the occasion of the imperial journey and the company's 50th anniversary, a board game under the name »Imperial Journey to Palestine.
The publisher was thus in line with the times. The first travel board games were created around 1800 in England and the USA. As so-called running games with obstacles, the course of which was determined by dice, they were based on the classic board game, the type of didactic goose game that has been known for centuries and has existed in countless variations, which was thematically mostly historically or geographically oriented. Now, on a mostly foldable, but still stable game pad, views of cities, landscapes, monuments and other sights were graphically depicted more or less elaborately along an itinerary and designed into a course on which the players replay a corresponding trip with all its amenities and dangers and after could experience.

—user summary

name: Dinner on the R.M.S Titanic
description:
A dinner party for 8 people intending to recreate a setting similar to one on the titanic. This only slightly qualifies as a game as the box includes a small set of trivia cards to play with during the dinner. It is intended more as a fun dinner with a theme.

From the box: "This box contains the ingredients for a unique and historic dining experience. You and your guests can travel back in time, taste the flavours, discover the story and become part of one very special moment in history."

The game consists of 48 trivia cards to divide amongst two teams after the meal. The team with the most correct answers wins the game.

Components: 8 x Invitations, 8 x reply cards, 8 x envelopes, 8 x place cards, 4 x menus, 1 x 16pg booklet about Titanic, 1 x CD, 1 x trivia game, 8 x character profiles and 1 x shopping list.
publishers: Classic Dining Moments Limited, Ginger Fox Ltd.

name: Poker Face
description: At last here is your chance to enjoy the excruciating excitement of the famous general knowledge quiz game from the comfort of your living room. Simply appoint a host to run the show, then use the sophisticated electronic buzzer and outdown console to recreate all the drama of the real-life studio. And don't worry if your trivia is terrible this is the quirky quiz game where tactics a skilful bit of bluffing and a deadly straight poker face will get you just as far as general knowledge while you battle the clock up the cash through a series of question rounds and face offs

name: The Coming Thunder: Seventeen Scenarios from June to December 1861 for Terrible Sharp Sword
description:
The Coming Thunder

This is a scenario book covering historical skirmishes from June to December of 1861 during the American Civil War.
All of these occur in a relatively small area of northern Virginia involving many of the same units.

There are 17 scenarios plus a campaign background to use with the campaign generator that comes with the rules.
The scenarios are all from the first year of the war as is the campaign generator.

The campaign generator is focused on the "Battle of the Peach Orchard" in the Fall of 1861. The battle was no one battle but a series of linked skirmishes that occurred across numerous orchards of peaches in Northern Virginia. It is an entertaining piece of history as the skirmishes had basically come to a stop once the troops had picked the peach trees clean of fruit.

The scenarios cover the following skirmishes:

The Battle of Fairfax Courthouse - June 1, 1861
Ball's Crossroads - August 27, 1861
Bailey's Corners - August 28 - 30, 1861
Munson's Hill - August 31, 1861
Lewinsville Part 1 - September 10, 1861
Lewinsville Part 2 - September 10, 1861
Lewinsville - September 11, 1861
Lewinsville - September 25, 1861
Munson's Hill - September 28, 1861
Springfield Station - October 3, 1861
Little River Turnpike - October 15, 1861
Doolan's Farm - November 16, 1861
A Running Skirmish - November 18, 1861 (on the Fairfax Courthouse road)
Hunter's Mill - November 26, 1861
Dranesville - November 26, 1861
Falls Church - November 27, 1861
Annandale - December 2, 1861


These scenarios are written for the TooFatLardies rules Terrible Sharp Sword.
However, they are perfectly compatible with other skirmish rule sets such as Brother Against Brother.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Shooting Stars: with Reeves and Mortimer
description:
Includes a book and CD for use in the game
The object is to play one whole game of shooting stars. The game consists of five rounds. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
The rounds
True or false - each player is asked a question at random and from the book play passes to the left
Impressions - use the book to select a celebrity and phase player says the phase in the style of celebrity other players vote on the acting
Club singer part one - select a song from CD and guess the song
Club singer part two - player sings in the style of viv from a list in the book
Dove from above - a question is asked players who know the answer coo like a dove and give the answer if incorrect another player can coo in
Quick fire - as per the dove from above but using the uriccca catch phrase

—user summary

name: Naughty forfeits
description:
A censor is chosen for each game. She is responsible for all decisions keeping score and timing.
If more than 3 are playing then 2 teams should be selected. In turn a stick is drawn and that forfeit is carried out if attempted at least one point is given with 5 points awarded for a Bafta performance first team to 25 points is the winner.

Example: do a strippergram impression as far as you dare.

—user summary

name: 中央総武線SPEED: 中央線区間 (Chuo-Sobu-sen SPEED: Chuo-sen kukan)
description:
Chuo-Sobu-sen SPEED (中央総武線SPEED) is a real-time card game for two players. (The rules suggest three is possible, but do not explain any rule differences.) The deck contains two cards for each station on the real-life Chuo line that runs east and west across Tokyo, along with two "new station" wild cards. The cards are shuffled and divided evenly among the players. Each player forms a tableau of four cards from their deck.

The players simultaneously reveal a starting card from their deck. At this point, players attempt to play cards from their tableau, either by playing an adjacent station on the Chuo line, making a transfer through another real-life rail line (printed on the cards), or playing the new station card. The first player to verbally call out their route gets to play the card. If a player plays the new station card, only that player may play the next card on that pile.

If there are no legal plays remaining, each player simultaneously plays a new starting card, either from the deck if possible, or from the tableau if the deck is empty.

The player who plays all their cards wins, and scores points equal to the number of cards unplayed by their opponent.

Decks using the same ruleset exist for the Yamanote, Keihin-Tohoku and Sobu lines, and since the lines overlap in real life, the decks can be integrated together.

—user summary

name: 中央総武線SPEED: 総武線区間( Chuo-Sobu-sen SPEED: Sobu-sen kukan)
description:
Chuo-Sobu-sen SPEED (中央総武線SPEED) is a real-time card game for two players. (The rules suggest three is possible, but do not explain any rule differences.) The deck contains two cards for each station on the real-life Sobu line that runs east of Tokyo, along with two "new station" wild cards. The cards are shuffled and divided evenly among the players. Each player forms a tableau of four cards from their deck.

The players simultaneously reveal a starting card from their deck. At this point, players attempt to play cards from their tableau, either by playing an adjacent station on the Sobu line, making a transfer through another real-life rail line (printed on the cards), or playing the new station card. The first player to verbally call out their route gets to play the card. If a player plays the new station card, only that player may play the next card on that pile.

If there are no legal plays remaining, each player simultaneously plays a new starting card, either from the deck if possible, or from the tableau if the deck is empty.

The player who plays all their cards wins, and scores points equal to the number of cards unplayed by their opponent.

Decks using the same ruleset exist for the Yamanote, Keihin-Tohoku and Chuo lines, and since the lines overlap in real life, the decks can be integrated together.

—user summary

name: Yamanote-sen SPEED: Takanawa Gateway Promo Card
description: Promo card for the new Takanawa Gateway station on the Yamanote line, announced prior to the original release of Yamanote-sen Speed but (as of this writing) scheduled to open in March 2020.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Trains

name: CARDominant
description:
Description: Strategy card game.

Battle against other players with a party of heroes, strategically allocate abilities to them, place them in formations and choose who to attack, for maximum effect.

Every side has 5 heroes. Players collect ability cards and assign them to the heroes. Every player then takes turns attacking each other.

The round ends, more abilities are picked up and assigned (stacking with previous ones) and the process continues until only one party survives.

Use one-off effects, give permanent buffs, synergise hero abilities and summon creatures to help you survive and win.

name: The September War Part II: the German invasion of Poland 1939 – A Campaign & Scenario Booklet for I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description:
The German invasion of Poland on 1st September 1939 precipitated the greatest conflict the world has ever known, ending the lives of some 60 million people across the globe.

Part II is the second scenario pack for I Ain’t Been Shot, Mum! covering the German invasion of Poland 1939.
It provides another thirty scenarios for the theatre.
Divided into six mini-campaigns, the pack begins with four based on specific German units: Panzerdivision Kempf, the 1st GebirgsjaegerDivision, the 4th Panzer Division, and the 1st Kavallerie Brigade.
Then there are two mini-campaigns based on the Soviet invasion of Poland: the Belorussian Front and the Ukrainian Front.
Finally there are details of two stand-alone battles: Westerplatte and the Hel Peninsula.

As always, there are attacks, counter-attacks, encounter battles, and desperate defences, all containing a whole host of useful scenario mechanics that can be re-used elsewhere.

No need for any preparation, each scenario contains:

a brief background history,
maps,
a full game briefing, and
a full briefing for each player.


Simply print out the pages you need, make up the deck from the list of cards required, unpack your figures and dice, set up the table and away you go!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Bashnya or Bust: An Operation Bagration Campaign & Scenario Booklet for I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description:
Bashnya or Bust! is a collection of fictional scenarios for IABSM set on the late war Eastern Front as part of the Kaunas Offensive. Soviet forces are attempting to drive through German defences in the Chera valley in order to break through into Germany itself, the Germans are trying to stop them.

The pack contains thirty-one individual scenarios set up in a five-step pyramid campaign i.e. scenario 1 leads to either scenario 2A or 2B; the result of this second game leads to one of scenarios 3A, 3B, 3C or 3D; and so on until scenarios 5A to 5P.

Although written as a fictional campaign booklet, no two scenarios are the same: each is unique and is also designed to be played as an individual game. Each of the three briefings for each scenario (Umpire, Soviet player, German player) contains enough background to give the game the same sort of context as with the background to an historical scenario.

Bashnya or Bust! is deliberately designed to give players who don't have enough time to write their own scenarios a huge number of games that they can play with little or no preparation at all. All you have to do is print out the three briefings, set up the table according to the map, make up the deck from the list of required cards, break out the figures and dice, and start the first turn. You don't even need to print the pack out in full: just the pages you need for the scenario you're going to play.

The campaign is structured so that you’ll get maximum use of the standard forces presented in Vpered Na Berlin, with well-designed and balanced scenarios for IABSM, or indeed any company level rule set you happen to game with. Anyone who has a company-sized force of Germans and Soviets for late war, eastern front should already have enough figures to play any or all of the games.

Bashnya or Bust! follows on from the popular Vyazma or Bust! and Blenneville or Bust! campaign/scenario packs, also available from the TooFatLardies.

Bashnya or Bust! contains an introduction, details of the campaign structure and forces involved, sixteen different maps (some games are played across the same terrain, albeit in a different direction), thirty-one different scenarios, and a collection of templates allowing you to print off Blind markers as appropriate.

Please note, whilst this is a PDF product, you don’t need to print this out like a book (although you can if you wish): Bashnya or Bust! is designed to allow you to just print the scenarios as you use them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Poczta: zabawa w listonosza
description: Treflik Family - Post: Fun postman is a family board game based on the license of the Treflik Family series. This time the heroes of the popular fairy tale are to deliver letters and parcels to characters from the popular fairy tale. Visit places known from the show and check if the residents are at home. You have a letter for them!

name: Fog on the Somme
description:
Fog on the Somme is a simulation of the first stage of the German Spring Offensive codenamed Operation Michael which took place in March 1918. The battle was the opening of a series of offensives by the German Army intended to force the Allies to sue for peace. The game is intended to simulate the interaction of ground and air elements during the offensive and the effect that aerial support exerted upon this battle.

The German player must capture as much ground as possible while taking as few losses as possible. Meanwhile the British must allocate reserves and airpower resources to slow down the German advance as much as possible by forcing the German player to pay heavier costs for their territorial gains.

The game uses a number of novel mechanisms to represent the attritional combat of the First World War and has been ran at several events including Connections UK Conference.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: ABCダンジョン (ABC Dungeon)
description:
ABCダンジョン (ABC Dungeon) is a board game with a theme of dungeon exploration.

There are seven rooms in a dungeon. Each turn, you play a card which indicates a room you will explore and an event effect. You place a floor tile on that room and place one of your exploration marker on that floor. Then, depending on the event effect, you gain treasures into your backpack, place some extra floor tiles, and so on.

At the end of game, for each room, determine the largest connected floors of the same color, and players score victory points depending on majority of exploration markers on it. Then they add victory points for treasures and other effects, and lose points for empty backpack spaces. The highest scorer wins the game.
user summary

たいまつでダンジョンを照らし、道を繋げて探索エリアを拡大していこう！
探索時にはお宝を発見する事も！持ち帰るためには荷物の整理が必要だ！
複数あるフロアを1番多く探索したプレイヤーが勝利！
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: The Osborne Family: Board Game
description:
Once upon a time in the land of oz. Reign prince of darkness and heavy metal legend Ozzy Osborne and his wife sovereign ruler Sharon, and teenage heirs to the throne, Jake and Kelly, give the world the key to their kingdom. The result?..

A progress round the board based on die rolls game with trivia questions that give you another throw. First to the limousine wins.

name: Moving On Up
description:
Designed with the help of pupils, this board game prepares students for making the transition to a new school - whether from First to Middle, Middle to High or Primary to Secondary.
Using four sets of question cards, covering motivation, solution, school and responsibility, students will learn about secondary school life and develop their awareness, personal and social skills, which promotes positive progress in their new school.
Suitable for two to six players, the object of the game is to collect 25 counters and for all the players to get to school.
The game is cooperative - there is no individual winner, either everyone wins or everyone loses.
Created by the East End Education Partnership Action Zone in Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, this is a unique and fun way to introduce 10- to 12-year-olds to the issues involved in moving schools, and is designed to fit in with the PSHE section of the English National Curriculum.

name: The Last Word: The Ultimate Wordgame!
description:
Blue tiles are blank worth 10 points
Red tiles are worth 5 points
White are worth 1 points
Object of the game is to score the most points

Play starts with a blue tile and a player turning a tile over and attempting to make a word against a timer. Play moves left with each person turning a tile. Words must be made crossword style. play ends when all tiles have been turned.

—user summary

name: Dogs of War
description:
We're low on ammunition.
Half the platoon is down with dysentery.
Who put this guy in charge?
WHAT THE HELL IS THAT?????

These are the Dogs of War. Battle is as far from chess or checkers as you can get.
Things happen that you simply can't predict, and it's a commander's ability to adapt to those things that often determines victory or defeat.

Dogs of War is a game supplement intended to add the element of pure chaos to any strategy game.
Players get over 200 events, problems, mistakes, countermeasures, and acts of fate that happen during war.

One adds flavor, two makes things interesting, three makes things very interesting, and anything over three cards each is an invitation to bedlam.

Dogs of War cards are full-color, with gripping photos of soldiers and war machines in the field.
Cards are provided with and without cammo background for less toner-intensive printing.
As an added bonus, you can use your Dogs of War cards as over 200 dice rolls, too!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: LPM 2.0: Little Plastic Men
description:
Do you spend hours painting little men only to put them on a shelf somewhere to collect dust?

Well no more get those figures down and bust loose LPM (little plastic men).

LPM is usable for any size figure from one inch to two feet. Reenact famous battles from squad to battalion size.
Easy to learn you will be playing in no time, so get out the dice and bring your little plastic men to life.
(This product is not an actual incantation to bring little plastic men to life. But if you can come with such trickery, get ahold of us, we'd love to see that!).

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Disney's Aladdin: The Adventure Game
description:
A simple roll the die and move on a board with some squares moving the player on or back (i.e. caught by palace guards miss a go) 61 squares in total.

—user summary

name: Snowball Wars: Booster Set One – Elf Help
description:
It's the first fast and furious booster set for the epic battle in a winter wonderland.

Snowball Wars Booster Set One is not a complete game, but adds Santa's Elves, presents and a Snow Beast to the Snowball Wars minigame. All files are 300dpi and include front and back views.

Cardstock Miniatures are an affordable and attractive alternative to metal or plastic miniatures. Print as many as you like as often as you like.

You will need:

a colour printer,
cutting tools,
glue,
foamcore and
time.


Assembly instructions are included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Klapperstorch und Kohlkopf
description:
A memo game for children aged 5-8 years, with the purpose to encourage tolerance for other cultures.
The memo pairs always show one and the same event, environment or object in two different cultures. For example, one card pair shows how children celebrate their birthdays in different countries. Another pair shows animals that live in the forest somewhere in Europe and in the jungle.
Designed for playing in day care centres, in primary school and within the family. A booklet gives tips to every picture (so far in German only).

Please note: The game is no longer available!

name: JungleHunt
description: A battery operated game where players use a hammer to strike animal pieces that are going up and down in an attempt to collect 6 animals of the same colour. animals stick to the hammer if stuck correctly

name: Aurelian: Action Cards
description:
Here are the 86 Action Cards for Aurelian.

This pack contains all of the common, national, and advanced cards. They are printed in full color on premium cardstock.

You must have a copy of the Aurelian tabletop rules in order to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Aurelian: Germanic Unit Tiles
description:
This pack contains 40 Germanic unit tiles for Aurelian.

They are printed in full color on premium cardstock.

The units included are:

3 x Noble Cavalry,
6 x Light Cavalry,
6 x Archers & Slingers,
5 x Optimates,
20 x Warbands.


You must have a copy of the Aurelian tabletop rules in order to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Aurelian: Roman Unit Tiles
description:
This pack contains 50 Roman unit tiles for Aurelian.

They are printed in full color on premium cardstock.

The units included are:

2 x Auxilia Archers,
6 x Archers & Slingers,
4 x Light Cavalry,
4 x Armored Cavalry,
4 x Clibanarii,
8 x Veteran Cohorts,
10 x Experienced Cohorts, and
12 x Raw Cohorts.


You must have a copy of the Aurelian tabletop rules in order to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Aurelian: Persian Unit Tiles
description:
This pack contains 51 Persian unit tiles for Aurelian.

They are printed in full color on premium cardstock.

The units included are:

4 x Elephants,
3 x Mercenary Infantry,
6 x Kamandaran,
8 x Tribal Cavalry,
6 x Cataphracts,
8 x Archers & Slingers, and
16 x Paighans.


You must have a copy of the Aurelian tabletop rules in order to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Aurelian: Sarmatian Unit Tiles
description:
This pack contains 42 Sarmatian unit tiles for Aurelian.

They are printed in full color on premium cardstock.

The units included are:

1 x Amazons,
4 x Nobles,
4 x Archers & Slingers,
8 x Horse Archers,
8 x Cavalry, and
16 x Warriors.


You must have a copy of the Aurelian tabletop rules in order to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Koncordia: Sci-Fi Miniature Game
description:
This is a set of wargame rules that aims to simulate battles in a fictional planet called Koncordia.
The game is inspired to Impetus, but contrary to those rules it uses individually based figures which are grouped in teams.

—description from the publisher

name: Battle of Teddysburg: American Civil Paw Game
description:
When the family goes to sleep and all the lights go out, many people believe that this is the time when bad things come out of the closet or out from under the bed.

Maybe this is true, but what we know is that the Teddys get out and recreate battles. They don’t kill each other, they dress up and re-enact war!

Teddys don’t fight wars. Teddys re-enact.

These rules are basic regimental rules. They are a short, simple set of rules designed to be used to play games with the 18mm Slave 2 Gaming figure range of American Civil Paw Teddy bear figures.

These rules are beta test rules that I hope we can get players to join in and help to create some fun rules.

My plan was to create a set of rules that were not hundreds of pages long, "Keep it simple" was the idea, with the idea for the future; having the game no longer than 25 pages long.

Please join in and help build a fun set of regimental rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Animals, Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Renegade Scout: Elite Pack
description:
Elite Pack for the Renegade Scout miniatures rules.

This pack is all about playstyle options:

10 new "Strange Terrain" features including the dreaded Glorb
10 new "Strange Worlds" to play on including Abyssal Cracks.
Blitz Mode - A set of rules tweaks for playing large games quickly.
War Mode - A set of rules tweaks for more gritty, military style games with a higher emphasis on morale, casualties and suppression.
The points system: Offering points values for all the troop types and weapons in the main rulebook.


Perfect for players who want pick up games or who like working out their armies in advance.

Whether you are looking for a new game mode, a new crazy place to have a battle or a new way to organize your armies, this expansion pack will add value in your games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fighting Vehicles of Unified Space: A Renegade Scout Supplement
description:
Fighting Vehicles of Unified Space

In this expansion for Renegade Scout you will find:


Back ground information on vehicle manufacturing and use in the Unified Space setting.
3 new weapons intended for vehicle use.
3 new vehicle modifications.
13 pre-designed vehicles, complete with profiles, weapon load-outs, variations, all ready to use on your Renegade Scout tabletops.
All vehicles and new weapons are given points values, compatible with the points system in the Elite Pack.


Whether you just want some ready-made combat vehicles to support your troops, or you want to know more about the forces in Fringe space, this supplement is ready to enhance your Renegade Scout experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 1
description:
Within the pages of Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 1 you will find 3 "army list" type units ready for play in any Renegade Scout game, complete with weapon options, points values and troop profiles.

Each of the 3 units (Fringe Gangers, Colonial Militia, Corporate Mercenaries) comes with a special ability, a new Command Decision, a new skill and a new piece of equipment unique to them.

We also offer up suggestions for how to use them, and scenario seeds for 3 match-ups using these new units.

This pack is 100% compatible with "Fighting Vehicles of Unified Space" and any units built using the Elite Pack.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 2
description:
Within the pages of Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 2 you will find 4 "army list" type units ready for play in any Renegade Scout game, complete with weapon options, points values and troop profiles.

This time, the units and new command decisions, items and skills are all for the proud K'Erin, warlike humanoids inspired by the Mass Effect Turians or Star Trek Klingons.

You also get scenario seeds for 3 match-ups using these new units.

This pack is 100% compatible with Fighting Vehicles of Unified Space and any units built using the Elite Pack.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 3
description:
Within the pages of Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 3 you will find a new alien species, the "Brutes" known as the Turik, uplifting from wartorn rubble by a trinity of well meaning alien civilizations.

The Turik are given a new squad type as well as a matching Personality to lead them, special rules, 2 new Command Decisions, a new Skill and a new piece of equipment.

On the battle field the Turik take the role of tough, durable troops able to shrug off frightening damage.

We also introduce the concept of Freelancers with the Nomad Tracker: A character that can be added to any force to act as a scout, lead a unit into the fray or hang back on a hill top and snipe.

As always, all units are provided with points values and options included for pick-up games.

We also include 3 scenario seeds including an infiltration mission, a 3 way gun battle and a sneaking job surrounded by angry wildlife!

This pack is completely compatible and intended for use with the 2 previous Patreon packs and Fighting vehicles of Unified Space.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 4
description:
The Renegade Scout: Patreon Pack 4 pack offers additional details about the elegant Precursors: Renegade Scouts answer to the Asari from Mass Effect or 40K's Eldar.

Provided are background details, 2 new squad types, 2 new characters (including the first proper Wyrd Caster in these packs), 2 new Skills and 2 new Command Decisions specifically for Precursors.

Additionally, 10 Artifacts usable by any character of any species are included to help you customize your leaders and heroes.

Precursor players also get a new set of sub-objectives that will be particularly fun in a 3-way battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hill
description: Hill is a chess-like battle game for 2 or 3 players who control armies made of Airplanes, Cannons, and Tanks. The first player to plant his Flag (King) in the center circle wins. Enemy pieces can be captured by entering their space. Planes are like chess Queens and Cannons are like Rooks. Tanks can move only two spaces. There is also a Trench which is a defense piece that blocks movement.

name: Word Wide Delivery
description:
Word Wide Delivery is a tabletop game where you use ships to hop islands, collecting and transporting a cargo of letters to deliver words. Up to nine players compete to load their ocean-going ships with letters matching a manifest of words and deliver them to their ports.

In this family word game, the goal is to make words from your ship's manifest while traversing the oceans back to your harbour. Compete with other players to make and score the most words.

The goal is to be the first person to exceed a target score by collecting letters and delivering sufficient words to your port.

Using their ship's manifest of words, players move their ships around the world collecting letters that match their words.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Set Collection

name: Artifacts Tabletop Scavenger Hunt
description:
A tabletop game that plays like a scavenger hunt where you explore tunnels, revealing and collecting various artifacts.

Play with lasercut tiles, using attribute cards to guide you and grab the hidden artifacts.

Collect artifacts on a gameboard that can be configured in myriad ways. As you traverse the maze of pathways, objects will be revealed. Collect those you are tasked to find, collecting them all to win.

description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Race, Set Collection

name: Back Of Beyond Strange World
description:
A simple set of rules for 28mm skirmishes in the Back of Beyond that can include lots of weird stuff such as Dinosaurs, Zombies and Mad Scientists.

The players could be controlling groups of adventurers looking for treasure or soldiers sent to deal with strange events in a distant province.

The game is best played with an umpire who creates the scenario and a number of players who will ideally have different and conflicting objectives.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies

name: Interesting Times In The Back Of Beyond
description:
Rules for wargaming in the Back of Beyond with 28mm figures, Chinese Warlords, White Russians, Bolsheviks and lots of other weird and wonderful forces.
Parties of archaeologists looting or protecting ancient relics bandits, arms dealers and the Mad Baron invading Mongolia.

These are simple rules for fun games ideal for multiplayer games controlled by an umpire where everyone has a different objective.

—description from the publisher

name: Banners & Billhooks
description:
Banners & Billhooks

Designed as a set of rules for historical "imagi-nation" wargaming in a medieval period.

This rules set is fairly smooth and uncomplicated, with play being fairly fast.

Army building is straight forward too, with most units requiring little serious book-keeping.

The game was designed for two players, but can handle more.

—description from the publisher

name: Firebrand
description:
Demons visit the planet of Edell in the guise of gods and goddesses. They plot to twist the laws of this world to serve their kind. Four demons compete for the loyalty of Edellian people. Their followers, divided by their allegiance to one of the four, strive to bring about their patron’s dominion. A secretive order of knights-hexer works to weaken the churches and stop the demonic invasion.

The Game
Firebrand is a tabletop game based on the award-nominated Song of Blades and Heroes. It aims to deliver consistent and intuitive gameplay with an original and engaging setting.

Features

Setting. Firebrand presents an unconventional fantasy world where nothing is as it seems. Take up the cause of one of four theocracies and fight for its patron demon’s dominion, or join the ranks of the knights-hexer and protect humanity from its own saints.
Map-based campaigns. Firebrand introduces a map-based campaign where each region will provide the player with different benefits. For example, capturing a town with a knightly order will allow you to enlist heavy cavalry, a village with a college of magic will let you hire a mage, and so on.
Orders. A new system of orders allows soldiers to retain cohesion and act as a single unit on the battlefield. Heroes and soldiers alike fall in line to march, charge and fire volleys when ordered.
Siege equipment. Cut swathes in enemy ranks using catapults and ballistas, dig trenches to funnel your opponent into explosive traps and strengthen your spell-casters by bringing solar furnaces to the battlefield.
Detailed magic system. Wizards, necromancers and telepaths will join your company, bringing with them spells beyond those available to an ordinary mage. The wizard will rain fire and lightning from every direction using powers of teleportation. The necromancer brings your opponent’s own soldiers back to life and places them under your control. The telepath subverts those yet living to your will.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Temperamental
description:
A card game similarly based on a much loved playing card game but with tweaked mechanics. Each player has a hand of assorted elements they can play on top of each other. Fire > Air > Earth > Water and so on with the objective to lose all the cards in their hand. But there are also combo cards. Cards that block other players. Cards that remove the current stack from the game. Its a very simple game with a surprising amount of strategy with the rules fitting on both sides of a single playing card.

The game is quick, easy to learn, and great for younger board gamers.

—description from the publisher

name: Solo Ops: Single Figure Universal Skirmish Rules
description:
Solo Ops is a set of one on one skirmish rules for any period including science fiction and fantasy with an innovative game engine which could be used as a replacement of you own RPG combat system.

Also includes a set of linked scenarios based on the 1963 film Jason and the Argonauts.
categories: Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Compost Heap
description:
Composting is the practice of collecting organic refuse — such as fruit and vegetable scraps — into heaps where it can rot and, once decayed, be used for such things as fertilizer, potting soil, and the like.
Compost Heap is a quick-play card game designed for use by two to four players that simulates this worthwhile activity.
It is intended to be fun, mildly humorous, and moderately educational.

There are three sorts of cards in Compost Heap — Good Stuff, Bad Stuff, and Incidents — and a total of 50 cards.

These cards have been set up so that they can easily be printed out or copied onto cardstock or blanks for homemade business cards. And, while it is perfectly acceptable to use the cards with plain backs, there is also a page of reverse sides that can be printed or copied onto them.

A version of this game originally appeared in the multi-platform game publication d-Infinity Volume #2: Lost Treasure.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Print & Play

name: Viking Warriors: A Faction for Ragnarok – Age of Wolves
description:
Viking Warriors is a supplement for the Ragnarok: Age of Wolves miniatures game that includes 10 sets of statistics that can be used together as a complete new faction for the game or in conjunction with those for any other warriors and any sorts of scenarios.
They include six named characters, among them those for a chieftain; five of his lieutenants, or thegns, including a rune-mage, a war-priestess, a bard, a woodsman, and a scout; and four different sorts of common warriors, or carls.
It also includes backstories for the various characters and for their place in a Viking holding called the Hringsgard.

Ragnarok: Age of Wolves is a skirmish-level game for novice and experienced tabletop players alike that emulates desperate small-scale actions during the unending winter that is the first stage of the Viking Apocalypse.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame

name: Dvergar Warriors: A Faction for Ragnarok – Age of Wolves
description:
Dvergar Warriors is a supplement for the Ragnarok: Age of Wolves miniatures wargame devoted to the Dwarves of the Mythic North that includes a complete new faction for the game that can be used by itself or in conjunction with any other existing warriors.

Dvergar Warriors include seven sets of creature statistics, three for named characters, a chieftain and two of his lieutenants, or thegns, one a wizard and the other a cavalryman with a magical axe; three different sorts of common warriors, or carls; and a war goat.
This title also includes backstories for the various characters and for their place in a Dvergar holding called the Yttrsholm; a profile for the Dvergar race; stats for a new weapon, the Dverg-Bow; and a new spell.

Ragnarok: Age of Wolves is a skirmish-level game for novice and experienced tabletop players alike that emulates desperate small-scale actions during the unending winter that is the first stage of the Viking Apocalypse.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame

name: The Hunting Party: A Scenario for Ragnarok – Age of Wolves
description:
Venturing out to hunt in the early part of the Ragnarok is not for the faint of heart or for those who are un­prepared. But obtaining food is essential to feeding a settlement that has run through most or all of its winter stores already, that awaits the warmer months of planting with growing unease, and that hungers as rations are cut again.

The Hunting Party is a scenario for the Ragnarok: Age of Wolves miniatures wargame that provides an en­counter between a band of Human warriors and a clan of the little folk known as Dvergar. It is designed for use with Skirmisher Publishing’s Viking Warriors and Dvergar Warriors factions for Ragnarok: Age of Wolves — which include stats for all the combatants mentioned in this publication —

Ragnarok: Age of Wolves is a skirmish-level game for novice and experienced tabletop players alike that emulates the desperate small-scale actions that might result during the unending winter that is the first stage of the Viking Apocalypse. As crops fail and food grows scarce, banditry becomes rife as formerly good folk are driven to extremes and bad men take advantage of chaos and hardship. Beasts haunt the wilds and prowl the outskirts of palisaded settlement and isolated steading alike. Trolls and their ilk gather, marauders sweep brigands and more into their bands, and whispers abound of gaunt giant wolves and worse, glimpsed in the swirl of a snowstorm. And where such monsters and everlasting winter hold sway, Frost Giants cannot be far behind ...

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame

name: Wars Of Phantasya
description:
Wars Of Phantasya rulebook for fantasy square grid wargame.

Compatible with any miniatures, including the designer's own paper mini sets.

The game uses stat cards to determinate the units size strength, morale, and so on.

Stat cards are designed for designer's paper miniatures but other common fantasy brands will be available.

The file includes the stat cards for the WARS OF PHANTASYA starter set.

name: Stars & Lasers: Supplement One – More Lasers...
description:
Stars & Lasers: Supplement One - More Lasers...

This supplement contains several new ships, including a selection of escorts, tenders and an alien corvette, and there is also a new large space station, all the new datasheets are included for these as well.

I have also added ten more scenarios, these include the following –

Now you see me, now you don’t… a small force is being hunted by unseen enemies as it travels home.
It will not die!!... a lone dreadnought, damaged from an earlier battle, has flown into a sector held by enemy ships.
Assault on sector 310Alpha… a planetary defence force is looking for a way to break the blockade around their home planet.
Plus, seven more, these have been made to help give a little variety to your tabletop space battles.


And I have also added two types of space scenery to the rules, including some simple instructions on how they were made.

And now there are some simple boarding actions rules using new squadrons of troop carrying assault ships.

I hope you have fun using this supplement in your games of Stars & Lasers!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Stars & Lasers: Supplement Two – "Pirates in Space"
description:
Pirates in Space is supplement number two for Stars & Lasers!!

It adds a few extra ships and their rules to the main system, and as always you are free to add as much or as little as you wish.

The supplement sees all the rules needed to bring rag-tag bands of pirates into your games of Stars & Lasers.

These pirates don’t have access to big military ships, they mainly use old heavy shifters and cargo ships and things like civilian liners, anything that they can fit weapons and armour to.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Otogidama
description:
In Otogidama, players tell stories one sentence at a time with added constraints of a color (unique to each player) and the positions of tokens on the board. While most of play is building up an interesting story, there's also a strategic component to which aspect of the story you focus on, as that affects scoring at the end.

Each scenario has four keywords; for example, the first scenario is "The Dragon's Cave" and some keywords are "Dragon", "Dangerous Traps", and "Treasure". Each keyword starts with two "shadows", or black stones. Each turn a player pulls a jewel from a bag and uses the color of the jewel plus a keyword to tell part of the story. The keyword they choose to use determines where they place the jewel, and the color of the jewel determines the next player.

For example, if you pick a red jewel and then choose the "Treasure" keyword, you might say "there's a legend that there's a giant ruby at the bottom of this cave". Over the course of the game you'll build on elements introduced by the other players.

You get points by getting rid of shadows, but also for each stone of your color on the board at the end of the game. You remove stones from the board by adding stones to keywords that already have three stones on them, so as the game progresses you'll have a choice between getting rid of shadows to get points directly or removing jewels belonging to other players to reduce their points. You'll have to balance both of these aspects to come out ahead.

Besides scenario-based competitive play, rules for non-competitive "free play" are also included.

—user summary

name: Urban Manhunt: the Miniatures Game – Single-Player System
description:
Urban Manhunt: Single-Player System

These rules allow you to play Urban Manhunt without any other players present.

The system is intuitive, fast-playing, and exciting!

Plus, you'll find optional rules to help customize your experience as well as a short story that continues where the core rulebook left off.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: For King and Parliament: The Battle of Stow-on-the-Wold
description:
The TtS! Battle of Stow-on-the-Wold Scenario is a digital file, designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules, but useful with other rule systems, too.

Stow is a modest scenario depicting the last major battle of the First English Civil War, which occurred when the last Royalist field army, led by the valiant Jacob, Lord Astley, was brought to ground by a superior Parliamentarian force. It is a modest-sized battle with only 21 units - it will suit two to four players. We have recently revised the scenario on the basis of further research.

The 8 page Scenario PDF includes a brief account of the campaign and the battle, reconstructed orders of battle for both sides and a deployment diagram. It can be viewed on a tablet, or printed out and bound.

Also included are the TtS! Battle of Stow-on-the-Wold unit cards, designed by Ian Notter. These can be printed out on card, and used, in conjunction with the scenario, to re-fight the battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: For King and Parliament: The Battle of Edgehill
description:
The TtS! Battle of Edgehill Scenario is a digital file, designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules but useful with other rule systems too.
It is a large and well-tested scenario that will suit two to six players.

The 18 page PDF includes:

a brief account of the campaign and the battle,
reconstructed orders of battle for both sides,
deployment diagrams and
images of beautifully painted wargames figures.


It can be viewed on a tablet or printed out and bound.

You may also wish to purchase the associated TtS! Battle of Edgehill unit cards; these can be printed out, and used, in conjunction with the scenario, to re-fight the battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Pair Three
description:
What can you do with the 400+ 3-letter words in the English language? You make a game out of them - PAIR THREE.

PAIR THREE is a series of simple word games where players connect three-letter words through certain relationships.

Components: The game comes with 112 lasercut, wooden tiles, each containing four 3-letter words.

Goal: Be the first player to discard all your tiles.
Four ways to play.

Matching Rules:
A word can be placed adjacent to another word when at least two letters match.
Examples:

First two letters match: men and met
Last two letters match: doe and toe
First & last letters match: red and rod
All three letters match: rat and art

Additionally, relate 300+ compound words and phrases:
ask for, eat out, dog tag, bed bug, pay cut, pen pal, gym rat, dry out, ice cap, gasbag, seabed, batman …
carrot, menace, barred, tiered, garage, digits, cotton, market, Carmen, Margot, Dayton, Red Sea …

Optionally, allow:
Homophones: bye and buy, won and one
Mirrored letter pairs: got and fog, win and ink
Related connections: sun hot, hen egg, cap hat, arm leg, man boy

—description from the designer

name: Bad War: Renaissance Wargame Rules
description:
Bad War is the fourth set of wargame rules using the AB One system.

Previous titles include Father Tilly which covers the Thirty Years War and Bloody Kingdom, a set of English Civil War rules.
Bad War is designed to cover warfare in the sixteenth century, a period which seems from this distance to offer the wargamer a terrifically interesting and colourful selection of gaming opportunities. Full of garishly dressed soldiers, colourful and exotic troop types and with the introduction of the firearm, the beginnings of modern warfare.
Armies struggled to find a way of incorporating this new technology, much time was devoted to experimentation with battlefield tactics and still the tried and tested methods of medieval warfare produced dramatic victories. Few could stand against the awesome charge of the French Gendarmes nor face the ferocious onslaught of the Swiss pike-square. And yet warfare did evolve during this period. The arquebus and musket do replace the bow and crossbow, knights begin to put aside their lances and take up the pistol.

What I have attempted with Bad War is to bring out the qualities of some of these more exotic troops, the Doppelsöldner, the Aventuriers, the Black Bands, the Gendarmes, the Landsknechts, the Stradiots and the Condottieri.
Rather than a simple factor rating their quality, these troops have different characteristics that shape and modify their actions. Gendarmes are likely to disobey orders and attack their nearest opponents, the Swiss will seek out any Landsknechts and visit bloody slaughter on their foe and any Stradiots can certainly be relied upon to loot the baggage train - either their opponents or their own!

Bad War can be played with either 25/28mm or 15mm figures and a wide variety of popular basing is allowed.
The rules have many similar features to the other AB One games including the entertaining "War-Tokens system".

Also provided is a Fornovo scenario which includes a map, order of battle and unit cards that can be printed out for use during the game and army lists for the Early Italian Wars.
Although Bad War focuses initially on the Italian Wars, the rules can be used for any European warfare of the sixteenth century. Later supplements will cover the French Wars of Religion, the Spanish and Dutch war and the wars of Henry VIII and Elizabeth I.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: The German War: Wargame Supplement for Father Tilly
description:
The German War is the second Father Tilly supplement, covering the 1622-23 fighting in the Palatinate and featuring army lists and profiles of the generals that fought in this campaign.

Included are three scenarios that feature maps and orders of battle for the battles of Wimpfen, Hochst, and Stadtlohn.
In addition to the army lists, profiles, and scenarios are new war-tokens and a section on rules to cover the design and use of Battle Wagons.
The German War also contains a large section describing the use of map movements.

This is really a game within a game allowing players to use their war-tokens to try and out-manoeuver their opponents before the main battle, to give them a crucial advantage once the shot begins to fly!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Father Tilly: Campaign – Campaign Rules for Father Tilly & Escalade
description:
Father Tilly: Campaign is a game supplement for the Father Tilly rules that allows players to fight a series of connected scenarios within their chosen phase of the Thirty Years War.
These new rules show the effects of campaigning on the players armies and the rewards for the victorious and the penalties for the defeated.

This supplement also introduces some of the wider strategic events that occurred in Europe at the time of the war and how these impacted on the combatants.
For instance, the granting by the Pope of massive subsidies to the emperor Ferdinand II, harvest failures in Germany, the Dutch capture of the Spanish treasure fleet, the Peace of Monzon, the Sack of Magdeburg, the death of Gustavus and the civil wars in Britain.
Depending on which phase of the Thirty Years War players choose, each turn they will be faced with one of these strategic events and will find that their army either benefits or suffers from its implications.

Also included are a number of familiar campaign elements such as ways of improving the profiles of generals and units as they benefit from their successes on the battlefield (and of course a way of penalising the unsuccessful).
Players can also employ a number of "campaign assets" between battles such as forced peasant labour, hostages, control of imports, scorched-earth tactics or a number of other useful methods of undermining the opponent.

Players will be able to use these rules to run campaigns with either the big-battle Father Tilly rules or the Escalade skirmish rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: The Swedish War: Wargame Supplement for Father Tilly
description:
The Swedish War is the fourth Father Tilly supplement to date and it contains extensive army lists for the period including the armies of Sweden, Saxony, Bavaria and of course the Imperial and Catholic League armies.

The Swedish army is looked at in considerable detail and all the rules are described to allow players to use this excellent army.
Also considered are the changes that Wallenstein applied to the Catholic forces in order to cope with this new and formidable enemy.

This supplement also includes three scenarios:

the Battles of Breitenfeld,
Lützen and
Nördlingen and
generals profiles for the major commanders of the period.


In addition to this are many new war-token.
The arrival of the Swedish army was a major challenge to the Catholic armies - do you have the skill to use it - or the strength to resist it??

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Father Tilly: Thirty Years War Scenario Supplement – Werben, Bamberg, Lech: July 1631 - April 1632
description:
This supplement is designed for the Father Tilly rules and covers the end of the conflict between King Gustavus of Sweden and his bitter opponent Count Jean Tserclaus, Baron of Tilly, commander of the Catholic forces in Germany.

Three scenarios are described in this booklet,

the first, the skirmish at Werben is a small encounter game that does not require huge numbers of figures and can easily be handled by two players.
The next scenario Bamberg' is a larger affair that requires a more substantial commitment in time and figures. This game can be played with up to two or three players per side.
And finally, the last scenario covers the Battle of Lech. This is a large battle requiring around two hundred and fifty figures per side, three to four players per side plus a good five or six hours gaming.


The Lech scenario is based around a river crossing under heavy enemy fire and contains special rules for boats, bridges and other details that allow such actions. Players will need to have a copy of the Swedish War gaming supplement for the details of Swedish generals, troops and tactics, in order to properly use these scenarios.

The Battle on the Lech was Tilly's final battle. Defending a river crossing to prevent the Swedish forces from crossing into Bavarian territory, the old Catholic general suffered a fatal wound while encouraging his beleaguered troops to stand fast in the face of punishing Swedish artillery fire. Will the Imperial army suffer the same fate as the historical outcome or can they deliver a major reverse to the great Swedish king?

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Gallows Hill: A Thirty Years War Battle Scenario for Father Tilly
description:
Gallows Hill is a Thirty Years War scenario for Father Tilly taken from a critical section of the Battle of Breitenfeld in 1631.

Victory or defeat in this encounter could change the outcome of the whole battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Grand Ambition: Wargame Rules for the Wars of James II, Louis XIV and William III
description:
Grand Ambition is another set of rules that uses the AB One system.

Having covered the Thirty Years War period and the English Civil War with previous versions, I wanted to finish off the seventeenth century by covering the wars of James II, Louis XIV and William III.
This later period saw the rise of the standing army: regular troops, funded by the state and employed all year round.
This period also saw significant developments in weaponry and tactics and it is these changes that I hope are reflected in the rules.
Included in the Grand Ambition rule book are sections detailing with the organisation of troops and the type of formations and tactics deployed.

All of the rules necessary to run the game including Initiative, Game Sequence and Movement, Shooting and Combat, Orders and Morale for individual units and the army as a whole, plus extensive army lists can be found here.
In addition to this is the section describing the war-tokens and their usage plus a system regulating the deployment of armies and a system for generating battlefield terrain.

Towards the rear of the rules can be found a section for converting the game to lower level "company actions" plus a method for generating scenarios for smaller scale engagements.

Finally, the rules provide a scenario to use with the Grand Ambition rules which includes a map and order of battle for the game.
